Balance & mobility symptom reports

Male, 16 - 25 years

Age Reported Symptoms Notes
16 2021-01-27 dizziness Patient received COVID vaccine at 1317 today. At monitor station c/o feeling lightheaded. At 1323 pa... Read more
Close
Patient received COVID vaccine at 1317 today. At monitor station c/o feeling lightheaded. At 1323 patient assessed to be sweaty, pale and c/o feeling hot. Yawning and looking faint. Patient seen by provider.. At 1330 patient transferred by wheel chair to an exam room to lie down. Vitals obtained. Patient began to feel better and feelings of lightheadedness began to resolve. Lungs CTA, no signs of allergic symptoms, color to skin returned At 1340 patient wanted to sit up. Orthostatic vital signs obtained. Patient had no complaints of dizziness. Patient was discharged at 1355, ambulatory, alert, NAD.
16 2021-03-18 dizziness seizure like symptoms; Dizziness; lethargy; fatigue; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable... Read more
Close
seizure like symptoms; Dizziness; lethargy; fatigue; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable pharmacist. A 16-year-old male patient received first dose of intramuscular BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE) on 02Mar2021 at 12:00 at single dose in left arm for COVID-19 immunisation at the age of 16-year-old. Lot number was EN6205. Medical history and concomitant medications were unknown. On 02Mar2021 at 12:00, the patient experienced Dizziness, seizure like symptoms, lethargy, fatigue. It was unknown if the patient was treated due to the events. The patient recovered from the events in Mar2021. It was unknown if the patient had COVID prior vaccination; it was unknown if the patient was tested for COVID post vaccination.; Sender's Comments: Based on the current available information and the plausible drug-event temporal association, a possible contributory role of the suspect product BNT162B2 to the development of event Seizure cannot be excluded. The case will be reassessed if additional information becomes available. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to Regulatory Authorities, Ethics Committees and Investigators, as appropriate.
16 2021-03-20 dizziness Patient received vaccine and went to sit down in front of pharmacy. He then immediately started feel... Read more
Close
Patient received vaccine and went to sit down in front of pharmacy. He then immediately started feeling lightheaded, his eyes rolled into the back of this head and he had a couple of convulsion. He did not lose consciousness and was immediately aware. He was pale, lips were blue tinged, pulse was 60, sweating and blood pressure was 98/50. Paramedics were called but he had recovered by the time they got there. They said he had a fainting episode due to the vaccination and did not have a seizure. The patient had not eaten anything the whole day and he felt that contributed. Followed up with patient's parent and he is feeling just fine now.
16 2021-03-24 dizziness Pt reported lightheadedness within 15 minutes s/p vaccination. Instructed pt to lay supine in car se... Read more
Close
Pt reported lightheadedness within 15 minutes s/p vaccination. Instructed pt to lay supine in car seat with lower extremities elevated. Pt reported resolution of sx within a few minutes. Consistent with mild vasovagal reaction.
16 2021-03-24 fall Systemic: Confusion-Mild, Systemic: Fainting / Unresponsive-Mild, Additional Details: Patient and hi... Read more
Close
Systemic: Confusion-Mild, Systemic: Fainting / Unresponsive-Mild, Additional Details: Patient and his mother presented about 30 minutes after receiveing vaccine stating he passed out in the car for about 15 seconds and fell on his way back into the store. He lied down for a while and said he was fine. Mother said do not call an ambulance, she would take him to the emergency department.
16 2021-03-25 dizziness After vaccine pt showed signs of severe nausea, dry heaving, and dizziness. Pt laid down for 30min. ... Read more
Close
After vaccine pt showed signs of severe nausea, dry heaving, and dizziness. Pt laid down for 30min. Patient revealed of symptoms, vitals are stable. Patient escorted by dad home.
16 2021-03-29 dizziness Systemic: Dizziness / Lightheadness-Medium, Systemic: Fainting / Unresponsive-Medium, Systemic: Flus... Read more
Close
Systemic: Dizziness / Lightheadness-Medium, Systemic: Fainting / Unresponsive-Medium, Systemic: Flushed / Sweating-Medium, Systemic: Seizure-Medium
16 2021-04-01 dizziness C/O dizziness. Denies chest discomfort. C/O HA Hx of anxiety with needles per Dad. Vital Signs: BP... Read more
Close
C/O dizziness. Denies chest discomfort. C/O HA Hx of anxiety with needles per Dad. Vital Signs: BP 104/64 HR 88 Resp 18 O2sat 99 Skin Signs: Warm and dry Circulation: Cap refill <3 sec Respiratory: Breath sound clear bilaterally Initial Treatment: Full set of vitals and observe. Bottled water and granola bar 11:35 AM Vital Signs: BP 104/62 HR 68 Resp 18 O2sat 98 Skin Signs: Warm and dry Follow up Treatment: Moved from triage to observation area for additional 15 min Patient smiling and conversing with RN. Driven home by parents
16 2021-04-04 dizziness, fall patient reported feeling hot and dizzy 5 minutes after injection and collapsed to the floor next to ... Read more
Close
patient reported feeling hot and dizzy 5 minutes after injection and collapsed to the floor next to his mother. Denies loss of conscience or injury. Patient was transported via gurney to EMS room for observation by physician, patient reports he had not ate anything this morning, apple juice and granola bar given to patient with no issues. Mother reports that this has happened in the past. Patient denies chest pain shortness of breath nausea, discharged into mothers care in no distress @ 9:55am.
16 2021-04-04 dizziness Systemic: Dizziness / Lightheadness-Medium, Systemic: Nausea-Medium, Systemic: Weakness-Medium, Addi... Read more
Close
Systemic: Dizziness / Lightheadness-Medium, Systemic: Nausea-Medium, Systemic: Weakness-Medium, Additional Details: Patient felt like he was going to pass out, said he has never had a reaction to needles or shots. EMS evaluated the patient and determined he could go home.
16 2021-04-04 dizziness Eight minutes after receiving his vaccination, he developed lightheadedness and had a brief episode ... Read more
Close
Eight minutes after receiving his vaccination, he developed lightheadedness and had a brief episode of syncope. He had a small laceration on his right for head.
16 2021-04-04 fall Pt was sitting down, and mother was standing by patient. Pt fainted and fell out of chair, Did not... Read more
Close
Pt was sitting down, and mother was standing by patient. Pt fainted and fell out of chair, Did not hit head per mother. Patient was awake and aware right away and sitting up. EMS came to evaluate patient.
16 2021-04-04 fall Patient received 1st dose of vaccine. Minutes after, while in the observation area, pt appears to h... Read more
Close
Patient received 1st dose of vaccine. Minutes after, while in the observation area, pt appears to have had a vasovagal reaction with a brief loss of consciousness, pt fell to the floor, had very brief shaking activity followed by immediate arousal by patient as medical provider has seen in other vasovagal incidences. Pt was alert and oriented upon arousal and pale. EMS was called by a store patron. Upon EMS arrival, Patients blood sugar was taken and found to be 55, pt does not have a history of diabetes. Pt stated he had had a waffle that morning for breakfast and had not eaten since the morning (time of event is estimated around 11am). Vital signs within normal limits. Patient stated he felt like he was having an anxiety attack prior to event. Parents decided to take patient to the hospital for further testing. Mother stated patient was discharged from the hospital that day and tests were normal.
16 2021-04-05 dizziness Patient was nervous upon receipt of vaccine. It was an unscheduled (expiring) dose. Per parent, he... Read more
Close
Patient was nervous upon receipt of vaccine. It was an unscheduled (expiring) dose. Per parent, he had fallen asleep outside vaccine room and they had to wake him up to get vaccine. I gave immunization and asked him to stay for 15 minutes afterwards. His Mom ran to consult window to notify staff patient was passing out. I was sanitizing vaccine room so I immediately ran to him and his Dad and I caught him as he was slumping over. He was shaking really hard, weak, and clammy. He was coherent b/c I asked him his name but did not have clear recollection of timing of vaccine. He was very pale in color. His Mom grabbed him a Gatorade and he seemed very thirsty as he was drinking. He mentioned he felt dizzy and that both arms were hurting and the arm I gave vaccine in felt like he had sweat dripping off it. (I felt his arm and it did not). I grabbed an instant cold pack and placed on his neck to help cool him off. His color returned over the 30 minutes. I asked parents if they wanted me to call ambulance but they wanted to wait and see how he responded. He looked at his iPhone data and his heart rate had spiked. Unclear if right before vaccine or right after but I believe he mentioned it went up to 120 when Mom said his normal resting heart rate was 60. He ate some gold fish and seemed to perk up and have a few funny conversations showing his personality. I explained to him very important to let parents know if he experienced any other side effects after leaving. He was able to stand up and walk out of RX with parents.
16 2021-04-06 dizziness Patient felt dizzy and black out for about 30 seconds. Patient was alert and talking in one minute.
16 2021-04-06 fall About 5 minutes after shot he said arm is tingling then fell off chair and hit the floor. He passed ... Read more
Close
About 5 minutes after shot he said arm is tingling then fell off chair and hit the floor. He passed out for a couple of minutes and then opened eyes and said my throat is closing up. The EMS gave Benadryl and used the Epi Pen. He was transported by ambulance to the hospital.

Close
Systemic: Dizziness / Lightheadness-Medium, Systemic: Weakness-Medium, Additional Details: PT PALE AND WEAK
16 2021-04-08 dizziness 4/9/2021 Patient was observed post Covid-19 immunization for 15 minutes . During the observation ... Read more
Close
4/9/2021 Patient was observed post Covid-19 immunization for 15 minutes . During the observation period, he experienced an adverse reaction with the following symptoms: diaphorectic, light headed..pale. Assessment : Time of assessment 1105, pale, diaphoretic, light headed. Sitting on floor, transferred to wheelchair Actions taken: Vitals sign taken VAERS form completed 1105- BP - 79/33, P- 51, O2- 100%, 1110: BP- 84/44, P- 52, O2- 100%, Jiuce and granola bar given, at 1118- Bp- 97/60, P- 57, O2-97%, 1141: BP-97/60 , P- 56, O2- 99% Medications administered: No medication administered. Disposition: Reports no further symptoms of adverse reaction after observation for 30 minutes. Discharged home. The Patient was provided with Vaccine Information Sheet and instruction to access the system. Immunizations Administered Name Date Dose VIS Date Route Pfizer COVID-19 Vaccine 4/9/2021 11:00 AM
16 2021-04-08 dizziness Dizzy, lightheaded, pallor of lips, BP 86/48 HR 60 supine, after 30 minute 106/66 HR 66 sitting

Close
Systemic: Dizziness / Lightheadness-Medium, Systemic: Flushed / Sweating-Medium, Systemic: Headache-Medium, Systemic: Visual Changes/Disturbances-Medium, Systemic: Weakness-Medium, Additional Details: Patient was felling hot and had anxiety before getting the shot. He said he had breakfast at 7am and recieved the shot around 11:30 am.
16 2021-04-08 dizziness Nausea, dizziness, change level of consciousness, diaphoretic. Patient transferred to floor, feet el... Read more
Close
Nausea, dizziness, change level of consciousness, diaphoretic. Patient transferred to floor, feet elevated, patient alert and oriented x 4. No shortness of breath or throat swelling. Pulse lowered from 57 to high 40's briefly. Patient transferred to doctor's office. Vital signs stabilized and symptoms resolved. Patient was then discharged home with his mother.
16 2021-04-08 fall 11:15 Patient fell out of chair and hit his head on the gym floor, he lost conscientiousness, after ... Read more
Close
11:15 Patient fell out of chair and hit his head on the gym floor, he lost conscientiousness, after he work up, he stated " I have a headache." Blood pressure elevated, sweating, kicking, confused initially but quickly able provide his name, birthdate, and current location. B/P 147/85 HR: 100 Oxygen Sat: 100% 11:20 am B/P 153/78 HR: 99 Oxygen Sat: 99% 11:40 Patient states " I'm not feeling alright but I think I'm going", patient was talking on the phone to his dad, unable to complete his sentence and began to fall out of his chair, patient eye's began to twitch, legs kicking, but patient was able to state his name. Patient was sent to the Emergency Room via ambulance. Father of the child will meet them at the hospital for further evaluation.
16 2021-04-09 dizziness 4/10/2021 Patient was observed post Covid-19 immunization for 30 minutes based on pre-vaccination ... Read more
Close
4/10/2021 Patient was observed post Covid-19 immunization for 30 minutes based on pre-vaccination screening . During the observation period, he experienced an adverse reaction with the following symptoms: dizziness. Assessment : Time of assessment 0918. Alert and oriented. Actions taken: Vitals sign taken VAERS form obtained and completed by RN. VS at 0918- BP- 146/81, P- 77, O2- 100%, 0920- BP- 158/89, P- 80, T- 97.9, VS at 0934- 138/81, P- 72 Medications administered: No medication administered. Disposition: Reports no further symptoms of adverse reaction after observation for 30 minutes. Discharged home. The Patient was provided with Vaccine Information Sheet and instruction to access the system. Immunizations Administered Name Date Dose VIS Date Route Pfizer COVID-19 Vaccine 4/10/2021 8:33 AM 0.3 mL 12/11/2020 Intramuscular Manufacturer: Pfizer, Inc Lot: EW0162
16 2021-04-09 dizziness dizzy, flushed
16 2021-04-10 dizziness Post vaccine, patient vomited, felt dizzy & was pale. Empress EMS checked out. PT transported to M... Read more
Close
Post vaccine, patient vomited, felt dizzy & was pale. Empress EMS checked out. PT transported to Medical Center.
16 2021-04-11 dizziness Patient felt warmth in his arm and became faint. He had his eyes open and remained sitting, but beca... Read more
Close
Patient felt warmth in his arm and became faint. He had his eyes open and remained sitting, but became pale and not responding appropriately. He was reclined with his feet up, cold cloth and returned to normal rather quickly. His vitals were withing normal limits, drank water, was observed x 30 minutes. His mother, who was present the entire episode, stated he has had a sililar reaction to a previous routine vaccine. Instructed to contact Primary Care MD to discuss further immunizations. Patient walked out with his mother feeling fine.

16 2021-04-12 vertigo Patient reports feeling "ringing in ears, head spinning, and vision going dark" on vaccine floor. Up... Read more
Close
Patient reports feeling "ringing in ears, head spinning, and vision going dark" on vaccine floor. Upon arrival to observation area at 1632, patient appeared pale, alert and oriented. Vitals 1635 HR-65, RR-18, BP- 101/39, Pulse ox- 99%, 1641 HR-72, RR-18, BP- 100/53, Pulse ox- 99%, 1645- HR-65, RR-18, BP- 100/58, Pulse ox- 100%, 1648 (while standing)- HR-64, RR-18, BP- 104/51, Pulse ox- 100%. Patient stated he felt better. His mother stated she felt comfortable taking him home. Patient left accompanied by mother.

after injection pt felt dizzy, brought to Observation 1 in wheelchair. Given apple juice and crackers at 09:28. Vitals at 09:20 a.m. BP 124/73, pulse 86,resp. 16, O2 96%. Pt. lying down. 16 2021-04-15 dizziness Patient felt dizzy, hot and light headed immediately following vaccination. He lied on the floor for... Read more
Close
Patient felt dizzy, hot and light headed immediately following vaccination. He lied on the floor for about 5 minutes and had some water. He sat up since he was feeling better. He then became nauseated and lied back down. After another 5 minutes he was feeling better. He slowly went from lying to standing to walking. He sat outside for another 5 minutes and felt back to normal.

Patient fainted in chair and regained consciousness and transferred to med bay. Patient states vision and hearing went fuzzy, nausea, lightheadedness. Pt given juice, decreased ____, A&Ox4. Mild HypoTN and Brady at baseline. BP 103/58, HR 50, RR 16 -- > 114/66,52, 16 Pt able to stand and walk. Released from vaccination site.

16 2021-04-16 fall Recipient experienced brief loss of consciousness (few seconds per report) / vasovagal syncope from ... Read more
Close
Recipient experienced brief loss of consciousness (few seconds per report) / vasovagal syncope from a standing position. He fell and hit his right frontal bone of skull upon fainting. Patient awoke after a few moments per report and was AAOx4 within moments of this reporting clinician's arrival to scene. Vital signs stable. Patient's frontal bone with minor red abrasion / erythema and scant swelling. He did not complain of changes in vision/ nausea / emesis. Neurological and Musculoskeletal exam intact without issues.
16 2021-04-17 dizziness Systemic: Dizziness / Lightheadness-Severe, Systemic: Fainting / Unresponsive-Mild, Systemic: Flushe... Read more
Close
Systemic: Dizziness / Lightheadness-Severe, Systemic: Fainting / Unresponsive-Mild, Systemic: Flushed / Sweating-Medium, Additional Details: After getting the vaccine, patient was feeling lightheaded while he was sitting down. He tripped over the chair and fell over when he tried to get up too quickly. Patient fainted briefly as we were trying to get him to a chair and was pale initially. 911 was called. After he was given water and the paramedics arrived patient got better. paramedics tested vitals and everything was in normal range. patient reported being nervous about getting the vaccine. paramedics left after collecting info
16 2021-04-18 dizziness Systemic: Dizziness / Lightheadness-Mild, Systemic: Flushed / Sweating-Mild, Systemic: Nausea-Mild
16 2021-04-18 dizziness Flushing, sweating, dizziness. BPs 104/55 (pulse 68), 102/60 (pulse 64), O2 sat 100%. Water, juice, ... Read more
Close
Flushing, sweating, dizziness. BPs 104/55 (pulse 68), 102/60 (pulse 64), O2 sat 100%. Water, juice, and crackers given.
16 2021-04-18 dizziness Patient went to observation area and was sitting with his mother after receiving vaccine at 03:41 PM... Read more
Close
Patient went to observation area and was sitting with his mother after receiving vaccine at 03:41 PM on RA. Patient told nurses at 03:45 PM he felt lightheaded, was seeing blurry vision, and his stomach hurt. Patient was pale, diaphoretic, and had unstable vitals. First set of vitals was taken on the RA at 03:46 PM with BP 80/40 mmHg, HR 90 bpm, RR 18 bpm, and oxygen at 98%. Patient was told to take slow deep breaths, was given an ice pack for the neck, water to drink, and some pretzels. At 03:48 a second set of vitals was taken on the LA with BP 120/60 mmHg, HR 56 bpm, RR 18 bpm, and oxygen at 100%. Patient claimed vision was no longer blurry, he was no longer lightheaded, and stomach no longer hurt. Patient was no longer diaphoretic and was no longer pale. Last set of vitals was taken on the LA at 03:50 with BP 122/78 mmHg, HR 56 bpm, RR 17 bpm, and oxygen 100%. Patient stayed for an additional 15 minutes and left at 04:16pm with his mother. He claimed to feel back to normal. Both patient and his mother, father, and sister were educated on what to do if he starts to feel these symptoms again.
16 2021-04-18 mobility decreased, joint range of motion decreased Fever, chills, headache and swallen axillary lymphnodes. Pain and redness in left axillary area lim... Read more
Close
Fever, chills, headache and swallen axillary lymphnodes. Pain and redness in left axillary area limited left arm and shoulder range of motion. Tylenol and warm compress was used to provide comfort. Today a call is going out to the Dr. to provide any further instruction as today is day 3 and there is still quite a bit of axillary discomfort.
16 2021-04-19 dizziness NAUSE DIZZINESS sat 98 hr 83 bp -94/76
16 2021-04-19 dizziness Patient had a syncopal/near syncopal episode shortly after vaccine given, becoming very lightheaded/... Read more
Close
Patient had a syncopal/near syncopal episode shortly after vaccine given, becoming very lightheaded/dizzy. Had a very short period of unresponsiveness, approximately 5 seconds. He does report having a similar situation after flu vaccine in the past. He was placed in supine position, cool compress applied to forehead. After several minutes was able to consume water and lollipop. He was made to remain in the treatment area for 30 minutes post vaccination, at which time he recovered without any further treatment and was able to leave with his mother, ambulating steadily without assistance.

Close

First set of vital done at 1158am. 138/62, 18, 92, @ 96% O2 sat. Mom stated that this is not a new event, has a history of syncope with injections. Second set of vitals @ 1158, 118/60, 84, 99% O2 sat. Returned to chair. Had a second episode, and was once again lowered to the floor, and positioned with head between knees and did deep breathing exercises. Next set of vitals at 1209 am, 118/62, 77, 18, 98% O2 sats. Returned to chair when stating he felt better. Discharged from Recovery with Mother to home at 1233 am with final set of vitals of 110/70, 64, 18.

16 y/o VR present with father received vaccine and approximately 1 minute later became unresponsive, falling forward and hitting his face on the carpeted floor. VR became rigid with posturing that lasted one minute. VR regained consciousness. VR had a 2.5cm laceration to the left eyebrow and abrasions to the left face. Hemostasis is achieved with pressure. NIHHS is 0 at the time VR regained consciousness. CN exam intact as tested. Cerebellar exam is intact  gait is deferred. VR had been fasting. BP 90 /50, HR 50, 99% on RA, RR 16. Sitting causes lightheaded/dizziness. Ambulance was called and VR transported to Emergency Department. Father present throughout the likely multifactorial syncopal event.

Close
Patient received vaccine around 745 am on 4/22/21. He did not have any side effects or concerns until 4/23/21 at approximately 9:30 am when he had what Mom describes as a grand mal seizure while at school. Patient was reportedly sitting in his chair at school. He stretched his arms above his head then fell onto the floor with full body convulsions for just under 1 minute. Patient vomited about 20 minutes later. Our office was informed by mother around 10:30 am. Patient at home and sleeping. Advised Mom to take patient to local ED for further evaluation and monitoring.
16 2021-04-23 dizziness, fall Patient started to feel dizzy for about one minute. His father states that patient was sitting up on... Read more
Close
Patient started to feel dizzy for about one minute. His father states that patient was sitting up on a chair and he started to fall backward, so his father caught him and lowered him to the ground. He did not hit his head. He was not responsive for approximately 10 seconds, per the father. Clinical monitors arrived and patient was alert and oriented to name, place, date/time. He was slightly pale and clammy but he denied any dizziness, chest pain, palpitations, shortness of breath, headache, changes in his vision/hearing, or nausea. He was laying on his back on the ground with his legs elevated on a chair and he started to feel better, and his blood pressure and oxygen saturation were stable with mild bradycardia per the vital signs obtained by one RN. He said he was feeling better and he was smiling and joking with staff. He slowly started to sit up and sipped bottled water. Stated that he had not eaten since 11am, and he agreed to a snack. I left to get him a snack, and RN said that he started to "zone out" and he lost consciousness again for approximately 20 seconds. When I came back, he was sitting up, conscious, and had spit up saliva and water onto his shirt. His breathing was steady. He again stated that he was feeling better very quickly, again in good spirits, but his father and I agreed that it would be best to call 911 to transport him to the ER just to be safe. He did not hit his head. He denied dizziness, chest pain, palpitations, shortness of breath, nausea, changes in vision, and headache. He was alert and oriented to name, place, and time. EMS was requested and they arrived, took his vitals, and he was transported to the Emergency Dept for futher care. He and his father were confident that he would recover quickly as he had a history of syncopal episodes related to vaccines in the past.

16 2021-04-26 dizziness After reporting symptoms of dizziness, Patient was monitored by RN at vaccination site. While monito... Read more
Close
After reporting symptoms of dizziness, Patient was monitored by RN at vaccination site. While monitoring, RN noticed patient exhibiting muscle tremors throughout his body that he reported not being able to control. Reaction intensified with patient advising that the was having sharp right sided chest pains that he rated on a pain scale of 0 to 10 as being an 8. In addition he stated that the felt as though his throat felt as though it was closing off. EMS were notified and while en route, RN continued to monitor patient. Patient remained able to speak with RN, pulse remained 70s bpm and respirations within normal range of 14 to 20. Patient did not display any symptoms of having trouble breathing. EMS arrived to evaluate patient; administered oxygen therapy and ran a 12-lead echocardiogram. Patient's parents opted to take patient local hospital to be evaluated, but declined to do so via the ambulance and transported patient via private vehicle.

Close
Covid vaccine site: Per chart pt received covid vaccine at 1413 accompanied by his Grandma. About a minute later, pt had a syncopal episode while walking to observation area. Per grandma, pt hit L-side of face on plastic chair. Medical staff responded to incident, RN and Dr, pt supine on ground - awake and alert. Dr examined pt. VSS taken: BP: 130/60 HR: 74 O2sat: 99% RA. 1420: With permission from Dr, pt stood up to sit on the wheelchair. Pt wheeled to observation/triage area. Intervention: Ice and gauze dressing. Pt is awake and alert, mild swelling to L side of-face, under eye - small break in skin noted, bleeding controlled. Pt had some juice, water and crackers, no difficulty swallowing. Pain 2/10, tolerable. Cold compression on and helping. Grandma remains with pt - per grandma, pt has history of passing out with blood draws. 1440: Pt remains awake and alert, NAD, no new or worsening complaints. Grandma remains at bedside. 1505: Orthostatic BP done per Dr. Results given to MD. No new orders. 1510: Dr OK'd pt to go home with grandma. Grandma and pt stated they are comfortable to go home. Instructed pt and grandma to monitor for symptoms and to call PCP or 24 hour advice line for new or worsening symptoms. Call 911 or go to emergency if has emergent symptoms. Grandma and pt verbalized understanding and agreed. Pt and grandma exited triage area, ambulatory with steady gait and in no apparent distress. Grandma will drive pt home.

A 16-years-old male patient received bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE), dose 1 via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Arm Right on 11Apr2021 14:30 (Lot Number: EW0150) (age at vaccination: 16-year-old) as SINGLE DOSE for covid-19 immunisation. There were no concomitant medications (no other vaccine in four weeks and no other medications in two weeks). Right after the patient was administered the vaccine, he started getting dizzy and felt nauseated, was sweating profusely and breathing heavy then he passed out. They were in the car so the nurse reclined his chair. He passed out and then woke up and then passed out (twice) -They gave him water and gum to chew and remained laying flat. After about 20 or so minutes he felt better and nurse checked his pulse and heart rate during the ordeal. The adverse events start date was reported as 11Apr2021 14:30. No treatment received for the events. The outcome of the events was recovered.

Close

He was extremely pale and started to nod off as if he was going to pass out. Chair placed so could sit down and instructed to breathe slowly and VSS obtained. BP=122/70-98% spot oximeter-78 pulse. He was able to drink some water and part of a cookie. He fully recovered and was able to return to class after 25 minutes.

16 2021-05-07 dizziness, fall seizure; passed out; light headed; fell out of chair and hit floor; making a gurgling/growling sound... Read more
Close
seizure; passed out; light headed; fell out of chair and hit floor; making a gurgling/growling sound; his right arm was contracted and tight; his right arm was contracted and tight; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer, the parent. A 16-year-old male patient received the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 MRNA VACCINE; Lot: ER8736), via an unspecified route of administration in the left arm on 23Apr2021 at 09:30 (at the age of 16-years-old) as a single dose for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history included Ehlers-Danlos syndrome. The patient had no known allergies. The patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19 prior to the vaccination. Concomitant medications were none. The patient did not receive any other vaccinations within 4 weeks of the vaccine. On 23Apr2021 at 09:45 (reported as 13 minutes after the vaccine), the patient said he was lightheaded and then fell out of the chair and hit the floor. He started making a gurgling/growling sound. After the nurses flipped him over, they noted that his right arm was contracted and tight. They were unable to determine if he had passed out or had a seizure. He had no seizure history. He regained consciousness after about 45 seconds to a minute. The patient was not treated for the events. Since the vaccination, the patient was not tested for COVID-19. The clinical outcome of passed out was resolved on 23Apr2021, while of seizure, lightheaded, fell out of chair and hit floor, making a gurgling/growling sound, his right arm was contracted and tight was resolving.

16 2021-05-07 dizziness Child woke up at 3 am with severe nausea. Within minutes he complained about not being able to breat... Read more
Close
Child woke up at 3 am with severe nausea. Within minutes he complained about not being able to breathe. His lips turned blue and he was about to pass out. As I was able to keep him awake, I am not sure whether he would have had a febrile seizure (it very much looked like it) or just fainted. The fever spike was too fast, and his body couldn't handle it. His extreme nausea persisted for four hours (but he didn't vomit). He was completely debilitated. Fever spiked to 103 but stabilized at 102 for the following 24 hrs.

16 2021-05-11 dizziness Approximately 5 minutes post vaccine, mom alerts the pharmacist that patient is experience some visu... Read more
Close
Approximately 5 minutes post vaccine, mom alerts the pharmacist that patient is experience some visual disturbances. The patient states that he felt dizzy/eyes were "going black" in and out. Heavier breathing than normal. States it feels harder to breath, but no reports of swelling or itching. Also states that ears were ringing. Pharmacist attempted to check blood pressure on patients left arm with an automatic cuff, but the machine errored twice. Then attempted to check BP with a manual cuff. Reading was varied due to patient moving his arm and hard to hear. Seemed to be around 90/50, but not precise. After 10 minutes, patient stated he was starting to feel better, just felt thirsty. Pharmacist rechecked BP on right arm with a different automatic cuff and reading was 104/62, with a pulse of 101. Patient continued to improve, stating that visual disturbances were gone and hearing had returned to normal. Was able to stand and walk around without feeling dizzy. No difficulty breathing reported at that time. Patient and mom waited another 5 minutes to ensure he had no symptoms and then were able to leave approximately 25 minutes post vaccine.

Close
Patient is a 16-year-old male patient admitted with seizure like activity. One day prior to admission patient received his second COVID vaccine, Pfizer brand. On the day of admission Patient woke at 0200 with pain in the left side of the chest, mid-axillary per patient's description it was cramp-like pain and he was able to go back to sleep. At 0500 he got up to use the restroom and went into the kitchen. He told his mom he didn't feel well and fell forward making a gurgling sound, arms rigid, was unresponsive, and this lasted 1.5minutes according to mom. Mom called EMS and when he awoke he stated he was nauseous. After EMS arrived it was 2-3 minutes and he did not feel well again, he stood up and head fell back, eyes open, he was shaking, and making a gurgling noise again, this episode lasted 30 seconds. Upon awaking he was disorientated for a few minutes then back to baseline, he was nauseous again and very tired. He came to the ED where EKG (pending), CBC (normal), PT/PTT/INR (slight elevation), CMP (normal), TSH (normal), Ethanol (None), Troponin (normal), Head CT (normal), and chest xray (normal) were done. He received a NS bolus was given. He was admitted to the pediatric hospitalist for further evaluation and management. This is where he had a 24hour Video EEG with normal EEG he was discharged home.

Immediately after injection Patient began to faint and clench his arms. His head tilted back and eyes were glazed over. Lips became pale and face was pale. He was clammy to the touch on the back of his neck. His blood sugar at the time of injection was 113. He had not eaten breakfast yet. This lasted about a minute or so. He was finally able to say that he felt ok, but asked what happened. This happened a second time about 4minutes after the first time. But didn't seem to last as long. I gave him some juice and saw that his blood sugar was dropping to 85. Then a few minutes later his blood sugar was at 62. He continued to drink the juice and had 3 4carb glucose tablets. He started to feel better about 15 minutes later. He states that he felt numbness in his hands and feet initially. All feelings returned and color to his face and lips. His blood sugar began to rise again and he was feeling better. No hives or rash was noted on his body and the injection site was normal.

16 2021-05-25 dizziness Previously healthy 16 year old male presenting to hospital as a transfer for chest pain and elevated... Read more
Close
Previously healthy 16 year old male presenting to hospital as a transfer for chest pain and elevated Troponin levels concerning for myocarditis. Patient has otherwise been healthy. Two days ago he received his second dose of COVID vaccination. He initially felt fine, but later that day had some body aches. The next day he felt feverish off and on and had dull left upper sternal border chest pain intermittently. Today, he reports sharp 7/10 mid sternal chest pain, lightheadedness, sweating, chills, and intermittent non-productive cough. He presented to original hospital for evaluation. The patient admits to tactile warmth since Sunday with no documented temperatures. He recently received his second dose of Pfizer just before onset of these symptoms. He reports difficulty sleeping since Sunday, but no shortness of breath, rashes, syncope, nausea, or vomiting. He has not had any other recent illness, fevers, or known COVID-19 exposures. He denies any history of prior cardiac disease and there is no known family history of cardiac disease, arrhythmias, or sudden death in the child or adolescent period. He denies illicit or recreational drug use. In the ED, he was well appearing with pain now 1 out of 10. POC troponin was 16.8 ng/mL. He had labs pertinent for ESR 10, CRP 3.0, BNP 24. RP2 PCR was negative. UDS was negative except for opiates (s/p morphine). IV was placed and patient was started on IV fluids. EKG was obtained and showed questionable left atrial enlargement per ED read. Cardiology was consulted and performed Echocardiogram in the ED at bedside and was within normal limits. Cardiology resident team contacted for admission. Past Medical History: No major medical diagnoses Past Surgical History: Orchiopexy, T&A Family History: No cardiac family history Social History: Lives at home with mother. Has two healthy siblings not living at home Immunizations: Up to date Medications: None Allergies: NKDA Etiology of likely myocarditis remains unclear at this time. In his age group, this would most likely represent a viral myocarditis. He would likely benefit from cardiac MRI during this admission for further evaluation of myocarditis. His EKG findings with his age group are unlikely to be secondary to myocardial infarct. No arrhythmias or heart block noted on EKG at time of admission or telemetry in ED. There is no family history of autoimmune disease or cardiac disease to suggest an autoimmune component or genetic etiology.
16 2021-05-25 fall, dizziness Patient received the Pfizer COVID vaccine at 1745. Patient states he didn't feel right but stood up ... Read more
Close
Patient received the Pfizer COVID vaccine at 1745. Patient states he didn't feel right but stood up to go to the observation area and lost consciousness causing him to fall backwards to the floor where he was witnessed hitting his head on the gym floor. Patient was unresponsive for approximately one minute and was then alert and oriented but c/o dizziness. VS at 1756 BP 137/63 HR 85 and O2 Sat 98%. Patient remained in the supine position for approximately 10 minutes and was then aided into a sitting position on the floor and then assisted into a chair. Patient was then observed for 30 minutes by staff where he continued to c/o lightheadedness and dizziness. VS at 1806 BP 115/68 HR 84 O2 Sat 97%. EMS was then called to assess patient for continued dizziness. VS by EMS sitting BP 122/77 and standing 117/70. Patient was offered to be taken by EMS for further assessment but patient and grandfather both declined further care at this time. Patient and grandfather were instructed to call 911 immediately for any change in mental status, nausea/vomiting, or any other reaction symptoms with verbalization of understanding and agreement. Patient was advised upon discharge to stay hydrated and rest for the remainder of the evening. Patient and grandfather were also encouraged to discuss reaction with patient's PCP prior to receiving second dose.

Diagnosed with hemophagocytic lymphohistiocytosis on 5/7/2021 after bone marrow performed on 5/5/2021. Presented to our office on 5/5/2021 for evaluation due to the finding of pancytopenia on 4/28. Mom states he received his second COVID vaccine on the 10th of April and since then he has been hurting head to toe, complaining of his throat, and feeling dizzy. He has had low grade temps mostly from 100-101, but it has gone as high as 103.6 deg F. They presented to urgent care 1 week after the vaccine and was told that it was likely due to the vaccine, he had fluid in his ears and he was prescribed an antihistamine. He went back to urgent care a few days later and saw the same NP who told them to go to their PCP. At their PCPs office he tested "faintly positive for Flu A" and was given tamiflu and zofran which has since completed. No bruising, bleeding, gum bleeding, nose bleeds. He has been having leg pain/difficulty walking and his friends brought him a cane to use. He has had possible night sweats, mom reports he "burns up constantly." Decreased appetite, lost 4lbs, hasn't eaten much since last week. Labs were performed at the PCPs office on 4/28/2021: WBC 1.7 Hgb 10.3 Hct 30.1 Plts 118K ANC 500 Mono was negative. A referral was placed to our office on 5/4/2021 and he was brought to our clinic today for evaluation.

16 2021-06-09 dizziness Pt received the 2nd dose of the COVID vaccine (Pfizer Lot # EW0161 expiration date 07/05/2021) at 16... Read more
Close
Pt received the 2nd dose of the COVID vaccine (Pfizer Lot # EW0161 expiration date 07/05/2021) at 1603. At 1612 the client stood up with his father and both started walking towards the zero gravity chair. Client was being supported by his father. PHN and EMT responded and helped the client into the zero gravity chair at 1612 and raised the client?s feet. Client stated that he felt ?dizzy and lightheaded, and I knew it was happening.? Client was pale but alert and oriented times four. Client was offered a juice, which he accepted and started to drink. Vital signs were taken at 1613 (blood pressure 78/32 oxygen 98% heart rate 48). Client?s father stated, ?he has a history of passing out with needles.? At 1617, color started to return to the client?s face, and client stated, ?I?m feeling fine.? Vital signs were taken at 1617 (blood pressure 98/58, heart rate 74, oxygen 96%). Client finished the juice at 1619, and the color had completely returned to his face. Vital signs taken at 1624 (blood pressure 98/48, heart rate 58, oxygen 96%). Client?s dad stated that the client?s blood pressure is ?normally under 100,? and that his vital signs ?are normal for him.? Client does not have any medical conditions and is not taking any medications. Client is allergic to peanuts and shellfish. Vital signs taken at 1636 (blood pressure 102/50, heart rate 58, oxygen 96%). Vital signs taken at 1642 (blood pressure 104/52, heart rate 59, oxygen 96%). PHN provided client and his father education on when to seek emergency services and to follow up with his primary care provider. At 1642 client stated, ?I feel fine,? and left the facility unassisted with a steady gait.

WE CALLED 911 AND PARAMEDICS WERE ON THE SCENE SHORTLY. AFTER EXAMINATION AND PATIENT FELT BETTER, HE WAS CLEARED TO GO HOME.

16 2021-06-10 dizziness Pt rec'd first dose of Pfizer vaccine at approximately 0950 and immediately after reported feeling n... Read more
Close
Pt rec'd first dose of Pfizer vaccine at approximately 0950 and immediately after reported feeling nauseous and dizzy. MA retrieved a water bottle for pt and called for the RN. The RN, also responded, pt was pale, moist, coherent. At 0954, pt had seizure activity while sitting in chair, dad held pt, hands, arms, and legs stiffened and pt's head rolled back. Pt was secured by dad and activity lasted approximately 7-10 seconds. Immediately after this activity, pt was oriented to self, place, date, and situation, then reported increased nausea. At approximately 0958 pt started vomiting. 911 was called by the RN, at 0955 and provider, was retrieved immediately from COVID testing tent. During this time, pt started to report seeing purple lights at approximately 0957. Vitals were attempted at 0954 but pt started seizing. At 1001 pt reported total vision loss. At this time, EMT's arrived on site and began to obtain vitals. Pt's BP was 50/30, EMT's started an IV and prepared pt for transport to gurney. At 1008 pt reported sight returning. 8L of 02 were applied to pt via non-rebreather at approximately 1000 at which pt's 02 sats registered at 72%. EMT's placed pt on gurney at 1008 and started en route to Hospital. Prior to seizure activity, pt's medical hx, medication list, and allergies were confirmed with pt's father. Father reported pt has no medical hx, does not take any medications, and does not have any known allergies. Father denies pt having any seizure before, any hx of brain tumors, hx of epilepsy, hx of diabetes. Father remained with pt during duration of incident and accompanied pt and EMT's in ambulance to the hospital.

The patient said he was not hurt but I called 911. they arrived about 15 minutes later and evaluated the patient. The patient revealed he had ran 2 miles earlier that day and had nothing to eat or drink besides a Yoo-hoo all day. The EMTs said he was very dehydrated. Close
Pt stated that he was feeling lightheaded and dizzy while sitting in post-vac after receiving Pfizer (EW0196) vaccine. Pt became pale and clammy to touch and sat down on floor. Pt's mother stated "he gets like this when he gets shots." Pt denies any SOB, itching, pain, or other discomfort. Pt has no orofacial swelling or visible hives/rash. Pt was given juice to drink and stated that he felt better afterward. Pt's skin returned to normal and he sat up in a chair. Pt was released at 12:40 into care of mother. Pt stated he was no long symptomatic and felt "back to normal." Pt left clinic with mother, walking with steady gait, and in no apparent distress.
16 2021-06-23 gait disturbance Next day on Saturday; developed fatigue & extreme tiredness. Slept most of the day. Did eat two meal... Read more
Close
Next day on Saturday; developed fatigue & extreme tiredness. Slept most of the day. Did eat two meals with a slight headache. Sunday headaches worsened with ear aches, fatigue & slept all day. Gave Patient Tylenol, pushed fluids to tolerance & used cold compress towels on his head for his headaches. Monday symptoms persisted & taken to his primary MD & was given medication (Tylenol) & was instructed to administer Ibuprofen if symptoms of headache continue. Prior to MD visit he fainted & vomited attempting to use the toilet. Unable to tolerate any light from the house with sensitivity to his vision. Encouraged to hydrate with GatorAid & fluids with meals to tolerance. Was instructed to take patient to Emergency if symptoms persist till Tuesday to obtain IV hydration. Tuesday late afternoon 4:30 pm, took patient to Emergency & was assessed for blood work which was normal & given IV hydration while there. Wednesday- symptoms subsiding with no further headaches & is now able to walk by himself with improving strength. He ate 3 meals today & hydrating most of the day. Sitting up more & trying to improve his strength & endurance. Less sensitive to light.
16 2021-06-24 balance disorder, motor dysfunction, gait disturbance 6/3/21 at 1230 pm: Sudden onset of right arm numbness progressing to transient blurry vision, diffic... Read more
Close
6/3/21 at 1230 pm: Sudden onset of right arm numbness progressing to transient blurry vision, difficulty walking, right lower extremity weakness, difficulty moving his mouth, stuttering, imbalance, and right sided facial droop. He was admitted to hospital on 6/4/21. Found to have a demyelinating process (see imaging report below). He received IVIG treatment and IV steroids with some (but incomplet)e improvement and was discharged to Rehab on 6/16/21 on oral steroids. However, he had recurrence and progression of symptoms and was sent back to hospital on 6/19/21 with worsening right sided hemiplegia. He underwent repeat high dose IV steroids and initiation of plasmapharesis. He has currently (as of 6/25/21) completed 3 of 5 runs of plasmapharesis with marked improvement in symptoms but still has significant right sided motor deficits. Neurologists here now feel comfortable making a diagnosis of multiple sclerosis. He will likely be discharging home for ongoing therapy and treatment after he completes plasmapharesis on 6/28/21.
16 2021-06-25 dizziness We were sitting in the after-shot waiting area for the mandatory 15 minute wait period. Patient was ... Read more
Close
We were sitting in the after-shot waiting area for the mandatory 15 minute wait period. Patient was getting restless and started asking to leave ~13 minutes after shot. I said ?no, we need to wait the full 15 minutes they recommend?. About on minute later, or ~14 minutes after shot, Patient said he felt like he was going to pass out. As I turned my head to look at him to began to slump towards me unconscious and I held him up by his shoulder and waved the paramedics over. He was unconscious with eyes closed for about 5 seconds and by the time the paramedics got there his eyes were fluttering, but he remained unresponsive for another ~10-15 seconds as they were calling his name, tapping his shoulder, and asking him questions. Then he finally came around and, while groggy, he was able to answer questions. He sat there a couple minutes talking to paramedics and they had wheelchair, but he said he could walk and got up slowly to walk slowly back to clinic area.

Close
Patient was administered the 1st dose of the Pfizer Covid-19 vaccine, approximately 5-7 minutes after the dose he reported dizziness, loss of vision, and trouble breathing. No signs of a rash or hives. Parents were asked if Epi-pen could be administered. Parents refused administration of Epi-pen. Patient was told to sit down and given water along with Benadryl (25mg, 2 tabs). After 5 minutes still reported no improvement and trouble breathing, 911 was called and paramedics were called on site. Patient was observed for 15-20 minutes, at which point he reported feeling completely fine. No trouble breathing/swallowing, and no dizziness reported. Patient declined any medical transport, and went home with parents.

17 2021-04-01 dizziness During monitoring, patient c/o nausea, dizziness and became pale. Vitals: systolic BP 52; pulse ox 8... Read more
Close
During monitoring, patient c/o nausea, dizziness and became pale. Vitals: systolic BP 52; pulse ox 88%. Patient lost vision and pupils slow to react. Called EMS and gave 2L supplemental 02 via rebreezer. Patient moved to hospital bed and had legs elevated. Upon recheck blood pressure improved and patient responsive to questions (suspected vasovagal response). After EMS arrived, patient's family declined to send patient to hospital via EMS, and ultimately left the clinic with his family.

17 2021-04-04 fall Pt was in observation area and stood up from chair then synopsized with some jerking motions and fel... Read more
Close
Pt was in observation area and stood up from chair then synopsized with some jerking motions and fell to the ground not confirmed to have struck his head or neck. His mother was at his side and holding his head up. H r was awake not confused or post ictal, no tongue biting or bowel bladder incontinences. He was able to get up into the wheel chair with assistance. He was subsequently diaphoretic and pale, with dilated pupils, His mother reported that he takes dexmethylphenidate and escitalopram for ADHD.. She said he runs cross country and he reported he didn't eat since the night before, He received narcan nasal spray and was transferred to a stretcher and placed in Trendelenburg position. He subsequently improved with resolution of pallor and improvement in pupillary dilation. He went to the ED via EMS
17 2021-04-05 fall After leaving vaccination room with mother, heading towards the lobby for minimum of 15 minutes post... Read more
Close
After leaving vaccination room with mother, heading towards the lobby for minimum of 15 minutes post-vaccination observation, patient collapsed/ fainted and fell to floor. Mother was able to catch and support patient's head as patient slowly fell to floor. After only seconds, patient alert again and speaking and answering questions correctly. Patient attempted and was able come to a complete unassisted standing position, but was immediately encouraged to stay lying down until EMT has arrived. EMT arrived, assessed patient vitals, and encouraged patient and mother to go with them to hospital if they were concerned, but mother declined and signed affidavit. Patient and mother left to go get late lunch, as it was revealed patient had not eaten breakfast or lunch yet and was nervous about getting the shot.

4/8/2021 Patient was observed post Covid-19 immunization for 15 minutes . During the observation period, he experienced an adverse reaction with the following symptoms: Feeling light headed and weak. Assessment : Time of assessment 0947, patient sloughing in chair feeling faint. Able to answer questions. Actions taken: Taken to stretcher, Vitals sign taken VAERS form obtained and completed by RN. 0947- 142/78, P- 88, RR- 16. O2- 100% 0957- BP127/66. P- 84, - 0952- CBG- 84 Water given. Medications administered: No medication administered. Disposition: Reports no further symptoms of adverse reaction after observation for 45 minutes. Discharged home. The Patient was provided with Vaccine Information Sheet and instruction to access the system. Mom with patient. His vision went completely black but he did not lose consciousness. His eyes were very blood shot during this and he was very pale. He recovered from all symptoms after about 10 minutes. Close
At 10:16 patient's mother brought him to our attention regarding how he was feeling. She states that patient was feeling hot and took off his sweatshirt and complained that he was starting to feel "dizzy" - then he started looking "grey" and not responding to any of her questions. States that he was progressively getting worse over time. Patient was flushed and hypotensive (80's/40's) initially followed by bp of 90/50 then before he left 102/60 at 10:45am. Initially his heart rate was 74 bpm and before he left it was 82 bpm. His temperature was around 97.5. Patient had not had anything to eat or drink prior to appointment. Patient was given a snack and water before leaving.

Close
On 4/16/2021 at 2:17 PM, 17-Year-old white male received his first dose of Pfizer vaccine lot #ER8729 0.3 ml to his right deltoid. At 2:28 pm while patient in the observation area, patient noted pale in color, he was complaining of dizziness, blurred vision. Patient taken to designated area while provided complete privacy. Vital signs as followed: BP 90/60, respiration 16, pulse 54, o2 sat 97% on room air, patient lowered to the floor with his feet elevated . 2: 33 pm Patient voiced that his feeling better. Patient skin color improved 100/80, respiration 18, o2 sat 98% on room air. Patient endorsed allergy to penicillin which he describes reaction as hives, also as per patient and his mother who currently in vaccine clinic, patient had similar above reaction to flu vaccine a year ago. Patient denies any known past medical history nor currently on medication. 2:38pm Sitting vital sign : BP 110/70, pulse 76, o2 sat 97%, resp 18, Patient denies any further symptoms. 2:43 Pm Standing BP 120/80, pulse 65, o2 sat 97%, resp 18. Patient remained stable, able to ambulate steady gait. No complain voice Patient released thirty minutes post observation accompanied by his mother in stable condition. Writer recommended to patient if symptoms reoccur to sick immediate medical help. Patient and family verbalized understanding.

17 2021-04-16 dizziness A few minutes after patient received dose this morning around 9:20am, he became pale, developed hot ... Read more
Close
A few minutes after patient received dose this morning around 9:20am, he became pale, developed hot flashes, shaking, nausea, dizziness, and hands feeling numb/tingling. Provided the patient with a cold pack for the back of his neck and water to drink, and encouraged him to sit with his head lowered. The patient's father pointed out that he had not had anything to eat that morning, which could have contributed to his response. After a few minutes, most of the symptoms abated, and patient was feeling much better. His father left the store with him at that time. Called the father later that day, and he said patient was feeling better. Had taken nap and was only feeling a little tired. I explained possible side effects from vaccine and father thanked me for our time and concern.

There were no seizure like symptoms or post-ictal state. Patient was helped onto a cot and a set of vitals was taken, BP 118/84, O2 98%, HR 84. 17 2021-04-20 fall Patient walked into the observation area around 5:16pm after his vaccination. He was with his stepfa... Read more
Close
Patient walked into the observation area around 5:16pm after his vaccination. He was with his stepfather. He was with normal mentation, walking on his own, and talking with his stepfather in the waiting room. Within 1-2 minutes in the waiting room, he leaned to the right in his chair, hit the glass (glass did not crack or shatter, no head injury), and was not responsive for about 5 seconds. His father called his name and grabbed his hand but no response. I rushed over and patient became responsive and endorses not remembering what happened. He does not remember the event. No body shaking, tongue biting, or incontinence. He was taken back to the vital room, and his first BP was 70/35, pulse in the 60s. He denied any symptoms, and physical exam including neurological exam were normal. He was speaking coherently and with good mentation. He was given a water to drink. Repeat blood pressure 5 minutes later improved to 96/59 with no medication. He was moved to a clinic room and was laid supine with his legs elevated. Orthostatic blood pressures were within normal limits (111/63 supine, 110/72 sitting, 109/69 standing). Patient was able to walk out on his own and was in normal mentation. No medications were given or interventions wee done.

Patient received vaccine and came and sat down next to his father in the waiting area. Approximately 5 minutes after sitting down he fainted and fell out of chair. His father guided his fall. It took 2-3 minutes for patient to gain conscientiousness. He was disoriented, pale, groggy. 911 was called and arrived approximately 20 minutes after event. After the paramedics examined patient, he regained his bearings and color. The family decided to go home at approximately 10am. I spoke with mother at 7pm tonight and patient has been fine all day.

Close
Patient was seen in COVID vaccine clinic for first dose of Pfizer vaccine. Patient has a history of vasovagel episodes related to anxiety and past healthcare appointments. Per mother patient has "White Coat Syndrome", and has been 2 years since previous episode. Given history patient laid supine on examination table for vaccine. Immediately following vaccine patient complained of lightheadedness and lost consciousness for approx 30 seconds. Patient woke up to stimulation but continued to complain of "fuzziness". Initial vitals HR 45, BP 100/51, MAP 73, RR 14, and sats 99% with bounding pulses.

Close
After I administered the vaccine, patient said to his mother "that was it", he also told his friend on the mobile that he just got the injection, then he said "I feel dizzy", I said "are you serious?" He said "Yes" and he just went out of consciousness in his mother's arm. I shout "call 911" and held his head which tilt backwards with eyes rolling back. together with his mother we lowered him to the floor and I supported his head at all times; as he was flat on the floor, he raised his own head and regained consciousness. Both mother and I tried to talk to him and keep him awake when he closed his eyes, he was laying on the floor flat and talking until EMT arrived at 16:42. EMT pulled him off the floor and took him to the ambulance.

17 2021-04-28 dizziness dizziness, nausea, vomiting, diaphoretic
17 2021-04-28 dizziness Patient was in his usual state of health. On Wed, 4/7/21, at 10:20am, he received the first dose of ... Read more
Close
Patient was in his usual state of health. On Wed, 4/7/21, at 10:20am, he received the first dose of Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine. No immediate vaccine reactions. He went home, complained of pain at the vaccination site and took a nap because he stayed up late the night before. On Thursday morning, he woke up with chills and feeling like having a fever. He took Tylenol and then took a nap. On Thursday night, he began to have chest pain but he did not tell his parents. On Friday, he continued to have chest pain so he told his parents about it. His father told him that if chest pain got worse, they would go to an ER. On that night (Friday) at 1am, he told his parents that he was not feeling well, his chest pain had gotten worse and he wanted to be taken to an ER. He also had abdominal pain, dizziness, disorientation, and he vomited. He was taken to ER where he was found to have elevated troponin of 10. The ER recommended transferring for further work up and the father drove him to the hospital. At the hospital, he was found to have elevated troponins and NT-proBNP concerning for myocarditis of unclear etiology. He was monitored on telemetry and had no concerning ectopy. He had an echo on admission that demonstrated no structural abnormalities, trivial mitral valve regurge, and normal biventricular systolic function. EKG was unremarkable. Troponins were trended q6h and decreased from 32 -- > 23 -- > 17. NT-pro-BNP decreased from 439 to 322 at discharge.

Close
Felt dizzy - patient laid down snack and juice given, felt better. Able to sit up then stand without difficulty, ready to leave. Informed to seek medical attention with any further problems.

BP: 110/60, HR 60 O2Sat 99%. Mom reports this happens to the pt every time he has a vaccine or blood work. Mom was given the information for the high risk vaccination clinic, she will contact them to schedule the pt's second dose in the hospital setting. Pt felt better, signed a refusal with Ambulance and went home.

Close
Patient given first dose of COVID vaccine today. After being vaccinated patient walked over where his brother was sitting. Soon after siting he felt weak and fell to the floor, patient appeared to be shaking for 2 seconds, generalized, witnesses unsure if he hit his head. No eye rolling, no foaming of the mouth, no incontinence noted. Patient was monitored and assisted off the floor to a wheelchair. While being assessed at a nearby cot, while siting, the patient's eyes rolled back, upper limb shaking for 2 seconds. Patient does not remember either episode. Vitals: 120/70, HR 88, RR14, Oxygen 100%, Glucose 113, exam: patient alert and oriented x3, PERRLA, heart RRR, normal S1 and S2, no murmur, lungs cleared. Due to second episode occuring, 911 was called. Mother was on site and full report given to her. Patient was getting up and heart rated noted to drop to 56, he felt dizzy at this point and sat down, then laid down. The patient was evaluated by EMT and was taken to hospital for further evaluation.

Fainting twice the next morning; Tachycardia (up to 145 bpm); somewhat disoriented for about 24 hours; Chills and fever starting that evening; Chills and fever starting that evening; Very lightheaded; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 17-year-old male patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, solution for injection), dose 2 via an unspecified route of administration, administered in right arm on 22Apr2021 15:00 (Batch/Lot number was not reported) at the age of 17 years old, as single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. The patient's medical history was not reported. Concomitant medications included colecalciferol, fish oil (VITAMIN D WITH OMEGA 3); saccharomyces boulardii (FLORASTOR); and multivitamins; all taken for an unspecified indication, start and stop date were not reported. Historical vaccination included bnt162b2 on 01Apr2021 (product=COVID 19, brand=Pfizer, Lot number=ER8737, Administration time=03:00 PM, Vaccine location=Right arm, Dose number=1, age at vaccination=17 years) for COVID-19 immunization. On 22Apr2021 20:00, the patient experienced fainting twice the next morning, tachycardia (up to 145 bpm), somewhat disoriented for about 24 hours, chills and fever starting that evening, and very lightheaded. No treatment was given for the events. The patient was recovering from the events. The patient was not diagnosed with COVID prior to vaccination and has not been tested for COVID since the vaccination. Information on the lot/batch number has been requested.

17 2021-05-12 fall, dizziness Pfizer vaccination administered into left deltoid at 0849. Reporter, RN arrived to patient at 0855 a... Read more
Close
Pfizer vaccination administered into left deltoid at 0849. Reporter, RN arrived to patient at 0855 after being notified patient had fallen off his chair. Patient found to be laying facedown and unconscious near the chair he was sitting in. No initial response by patient to verbal and physical cues. Patient was pale in color and diaphoretic. Patient was placed into right side laying position. After about a minute of being in side laying position and continued verbal/physical cueing, patient awakened. Assisted patient to supine position, cool packs placed to armpit area, Excess sweat on face wiped. Two small abrasions noted to left side of face; nose and near top of mouth. Upper and lower extremities also had small abrasions. Patient reported he started to feel dizzy and tired shortly after receiving the Pfizer vaccination. Patient does not recall falling. Mother confirmed patient had eaten breakfast, no history of low blood glucose levels. Denied experiencing shortness of breath prior to fall and while nursing staff was present, No neurological deficits noted during assessment. No rash noted. Patient continued to be diaphoretic. Reported stomach was upset. Vitals taken at 0902; blood pressure 116/74, pulse 74, respirations 18, oxygen saturation 98% on room air. Permission by parent given to treat patient with epinephrine. Patient received 0.5 mg of epinephrine at 0900 and again at 0905. EMS arrived at 0912. Patient more alert at this time and diaphoresis subsided at this point. After EMS obtained further information, patient was assisted into a sitting position on the floor. Patient complained of stomach upset again and vomited two times. Ambulance arrived at 0935 and patient placed onto gurney. Ambulance departed at 0935 to transfer patient to Medical Center for further observation.

Close
Seizure; Felt dizzy; Eye sight was blurry; Shake and jerk; Shake and jerk; Skin turned pale; Heart rate was high; Nauseous; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer. A 17-year-old male patient received bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE), via an unspecified route of administration, administered in left arm on 28Apr2021 16:00 as unknown, single for covid-19 immunisation. The patient medical history was not reported. Concomitant medications included fish oil; magnesium [magnesium citrate]; vitamin d [vitamin d nos]; probiotic [bifidobacterium lactis]; vitamin b complex (VITAMIN B). The consumer stated, approximately 20 minutes after receiving the vaccine (28Apr2021 16:15) the patient felt dizzy, eyesight was blurry, and he began to shake and jerk. It resembled a seizure. His skin turned pale, heart rate was high, and he felt nauseous. It took him approximately 5-10 minutes to feel "normal" again. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. The adverse event result in emergency room/department or urgent care. There is no treatment for AE. Prior to vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. Since the vaccination, the patient has not been tested for COVID-19. The outcome of the events was resolving. Information about Batch/Lot no. has been requested.

17 2021-05-16 fall Pt was seen at ED on5/8 for L sided weakness in the setting of a headache. Pt?s mother reports that ... Read more
Close
Pt was seen at ED on5/8 for L sided weakness in the setting of a headache. Pt?s mother reports that these symptoms began 2 days after receiving second dose of Pfizer COVID-19 vaccination in R deltoid. She says that on 5/6, pt complained of L arm weakness during cooking class at school, which was followed by a mild L sided headache later in the day. Symptoms resolved without intervention but recurred on 5/8 with associated L sided facial droop, slurred speech, L arm spasms, and L foot drag. Pt was seen at ED for this and had a HA (5/10 in severity) at that time -- workup was unremarkable with a normal head CT, laboratory workup, and resolution of symptoms. Pediatric Neurology evaluated the pt, deemed no further workup necessary, and advised outpatient follow up. Pt presented again to the ED on 5/10 with concern for full tonic/clonic seizure, witnessed by pt?s mother. Mother reports that she heard pt fall and went upstairs to find pt seizing on his bed -- says that pt had shaking of bilateral upper extremities (in flexed position close to chest) and symmetric lower extremity shaking; eyes were closed without clear focality or eye deviation. Also some drooling, though no incontinence or tongue biting. Episode lasted for approximately 2 minutes; pt was confused and did not recall what happened immediately afterwards but improved within the next 8 minutes. He was taken to the ED by EMS. By the time he arrived in the ED, he had left sided weakness again. He was given Keppra 1g, placed on EEG, and was admitted. EEG overnight was read "normal" and additional workup was unremarkable. Pt had MRI brain completed showing cortical abnormalities in the R parietal lobe, suspected to be related to recent seizure. MRA showed patent intracranial cerebral vasculature. MRV showed no evidence of dural venous sinus thrombosis. Weakness resolved by the morning and pt was back to baseline on morning of 5/11/21. However, around 9 AM, L sided weakness (face, arm>leg) with associated headache recurred. Mom says that this event was captured on EEG. He was then transferred to our facility. He was placed on pEEG and had repeat labs, imaging completed. Pt did have L sided facial droop, L arm weakness, and slurred speech on arrival, but this resolved within 24 hours. Pt had one additional episode of "wave" of L sided weakness including L sided facial droop and slurred speech at one other time during the hospitalization, but no additional seizure like activity. He was discharged on 5/14 with a normal neuro exam-- some labs (including labs of Rheum and Id workup were pending at time of discharge.) Primary and consulting teams elected to forgo steroids but reconsider should symptoms worsen or return. Pt was readmitted on 5/16-- had an episode of expressive aphasia + headache while at a social gathering; states that he became overwhelmed by the noise. No additional seizure like activity.
17 2021-05-17 dizziness Soreness at injection site; extreme dizziness (cannot move head without disorienting dizziness).

A 17-year-old male patient received the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Lot Number: ER8731; Expiration date was not reported) on 15Apr2021 (15:00) as a single dose, with route of administration unspecified, for COVID-19 immunization at the clinic (not a military facility). The patient had no relevant medical history and concomitant medications. On 15Apr2021, after the first dose of vaccination, the patient had fainted; dizziness; sweaty palms; heart rate has dropped; had weird burning sensation at the back of the neck with tension; was disorientated; and had lost his color. In Apr2021, the patient had weird sensation in the throat; headache; had pressure in his ears; and was gassy. The outcome of the events was unknown for 'lost his color'; was not recovered for 'headache'; and was recovered on an unspecified date in 2021 for all the other events. Information on lot/batch number was available. Additional information has been requested.

Patient fainted (loss consciousness) a couple of minutes after receiving injection. Mom caught him and called for help and reported his eyeballs rolled up and he started down when she caught him. by time Pharmacist and store staff got there (less than a minute) he had regained consciousness but very lightheaded. No breathing difficulty. So got a chair and had him sit with head down and store staff observing. After another 10min he still reported lightheaded and nausea, so ambulance was called. When they arrived and checked him out everything checked out normal and he was feeling better so they released him to his parents care. Called on 5/24/21 at 10:10am and spoke to mom who reported he was doing fine and no apparent after effects.

Close
A 17 Year old boy, received his first dose of COVID -vaccine, Pfizer. He walked out of the health room feeling fine. Stood outside in the waiting room talking to his mom during his 15 min observatory period. within 10 mins, he fainted and fell on his face on the floor. Till the pharmacist came out to him, the pharmacist kept tapping his shoulder and called his name out loud, he recovered and woke up. pharmacist checked his BP and was 121/71 and 68 HR. 911 was called , and paramedics came in, checked his vitals and all were normal . He just hit his chin when he fell, and bled from his gum, no loose teeth reported and a chin wound that might need glue stitches per paramedics. Patient was fine and talking when paramedics transported him to the hospital.
17 2021-05-24 vertigo, fall Patient received the Pfizer vaccine in the morning, then woke at about midnight. He went to get a dr... Read more
Close
Patient received the Pfizer vaccine in the morning, then woke at about midnight. He went to get a drink of water, and was holding a glass of water in his hand. He started to feel as if the room was spinning, became very sweaty, had ringing in both ears, and lost consciousness, striking his head on the counter. The event was unwitnessed. He reports waking approximately 1 hour later with a bad headache. He had a headache and felt disoriented. He denies urinary/bowel incontinence or tongue biting. He was able to walk back to his room without difficulty, took ibuprofen, and went back to sleep. He woke the next morning with nausea and vomited, but this did not impact his headache. He has not had any notable neurologic symptoms since that time, but continues to have a minor headache. He has not had any further vomiting. Headache has not subsequently woken him from sleep and does not worsen with recumbent positioning. He denies visual changes, memory changes, difficulty swallowing, shortness of breath, ringing in his ears, or dizziness. He says his headache is located mostly around his forehead and at the top of his head that is now mild and feels like pressure ?like a tension type headache.? His mother is a nurse, and evaluated him the next day. The family did not feel that he needed to be seen in the emergency department, or prior to this visit. He has not had any previous episodes that were similar. Patient was evaluated in my clinic. Complete neurologic exam was within normal limits. He has been referred to neurology for further assessment.

17 2021-05-31 dizziness Pt was given second dose of Pfizer vaccine on 6/1/2021 at 1050, pt complained of feeling dizzy, ligh... Read more
Close
Pt was given second dose of Pfizer vaccine on 6/1/2021 at 1050, pt complained of feeling dizzy, lightheadedness, and diaphoretic at 1057. Pt was observed- pt was pale, diaphoretic, drowsy but arousable, pt oriented x4. Vital signs were taken immediately: BP 62/33 (44), HR41, SpO297% RA, vital signs were repeated at 1105 as followed BP 68/28 (41), HR 41, SpO2 97% RA. RN STAT and 911 were called. Ice pack was applied to back of neck, ammonia was used for pt to smell, pt states he had breakfast in the morning but did not drink a lot of water. RN tried to take manual BP, attempted twice, unable to obtain bp. RN STAT nurse arrived, report given to RN STAT, pt placed in gurney to be taken down to treatment room. At treatment room, pt looked "regained his color, not as pale as before" according to patient's mother. Mother at bedside throughout whole event. Vital signs were taken once arrival to treatment room at 1116: 117/41 (72), HR50, SpO2 97%. EMS arrived to treatment room, EKG taken- sinus bradycardia shown on screen, pt's mother unable to verify pt's resting HR. Pt states he is an athlete, runs track in school. Blood glucose 98. Pt stated he felt back to normal, mother said she would monitor him from home.
17 2021-06-01 dizziness Vaccinating nurse noticed patient became pale and fixating his eyes after receiving first dose of pf... Read more
Close
Vaccinating nurse noticed patient became pale and fixating his eyes after receiving first dose of pfizer covid-19 vaccine. Vaccinating nurse asked patient if he was okay and the patient responded "I feel lightheaded. I think I will faint." Vaccinating nurse guided patient to the floor and elevated legs on chair. Lead nurse and EMT responded to the patient in nurse station. Patient was alert and oriented x 4 during whole interaction and stated he felt better within two minutes. Patient was able to sit up against wall and was offered water. Vitals were taken: BP 130/90, HR 67, O2 SAT 98%. Patient offered gravity chair and patient stated he was ready. Patient was stood up with two person assist and after 10 seconds of standing patient was able to verbally state "I feel fine now, I can walk to the room." Lead nurse directed EMT to monitor for 30 minutes in gravity chair and take final vital signs and escort patient with father to car.
17 2021-06-01 dizziness Patient felt lightheaded, dizzy, popping and ringing in ears, blurred vision, and fainted for a few ... Read more
Close
Patient felt lightheaded, dizzy, popping and ringing in ears, blurred vision, and fainted for a few seconds. This occurred about 5-10 min following vaccination. Most likely a vasovagal syncope reaction. No history of allergic reactions nor syncope. After laying patient down and elevating his legs, he felt much better. Patient remained in this position for about 15 minutes. He then sat up, ate a snack, and drank water and was observed for an additional 15 minutes. Vitals were within normal range. Patient stated feeling"normal" and "fine" after this and he was able to go home without additional issues.
