17 2021-06-06 fall, dizziness 6-4-2021 15:30. Subjective: This 17 y/o male pt presented to the vaccine administration site and was... Read more
Close
6-4-2021 15:30. Subjective: This 17 y/o male pt presented to the vaccine administration site and was administered his first dose of the Pfizer Covid-19 vaccine. Prior to receiving the vaccine the patient had made a comment in regards to not liking needles. Following vaccine administration the pt stated that he began to feel dizzy and ?then things went dark.? The patient was seated vertically in a chair and had fallen forward onto the ground. Patient care was immediately administered and the patient was moved supine with his lower extremities elevated. The patient regained consciousness immediately and asked if he had ?fainted?? The patient then stated that he was very warm and had not eaten or drank very much today. The patient attempted to then sit up rapidly from a supine position causing him to have a second vasovagal syncopal episode. The patient was placed in a supine position following this and cold packs were administered as well as vitals were taken. The patient remained A&O X4 with a GCS of 15 for the remainder of patient contact. EMS was called and the patient was then transported with consent of his legal guardian to the nearest E.D. Objective: Pt was noted to have two consecutive vasovagal syncopal episodes following his first dose of the Pfizer Covid-19 vaccine. The patient stated he had not eaten or drank very much today. Assessment, PE,VS: The patient was noted to have a small abrasion to the right side of his face secondary to his glasses striking him after he had fallen. The patient's BP was noted to be 100/60 mmhg with a pulse of 64. The patient was A&O X4 with a GCS of 15 following his two separate syncopal episodes. HEENT: All findings normal, pt?s pupils PERRLA at 4mm. Cardiac: Normal Pulmonary: Normal, however verbal respiratory rate control was advised to the pt. Abdomen: Normal, cold compress applied. Extremities: Normal, Cold compress applied. Plan: Pt was continuously monitored and transferred to EMS care for transport to the nearest

not able to function; sleeps all day; lost 14 pounds since the second dose of the vaccine/lost another 4 pounds over the weekend; chest hurt; Shortness of breath; fatigued and very weak; fatigued and very weak; Headache; cannot focus on school online; blood pressure goes up and down; heart rate goes up and down; Dizziness; muscle mass depleting; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient's parent). A 17-year-old male patient received BNT162B2 (Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 mRNA vaccine), dose 2 via an unspecified route of administration, administered in the right arm, at age 17 years, on 12Apr2021 (Batch/Lot Number: EW0158) as 2ND DOSE, SINGLE DOSE for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included pressure in his eye from an injury, asthma (diagnosed when the patient was about 2) and has family members with asthma and heart conditions. Patient is in perfect health, he works out 6 days a week, and does football conditioning 5 days a week. History of all previous immunization with the Pfizer vaccine considered as suspect (or patient age at first and subsequent immunizations if dates of birth or immunizations are not available) was none. Concomitant medication included timolol taken for pressure in his eye from an injury from an unspecified start date to 20May2021. Additional vaccines administered on same date of the Pfizer Suspect was none. The patient historically received first dose of BNT162B2 (Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 mRNA vaccine, Lot Number: EP7534) at the left arm at age 17 years on 22Mar2021 for COVID-19 immunization. The patient got his second dose of the vaccine on 12Apr2021 and shorty after on 19Apr2021, he became very fatigued, very weak, his chest hurt, and he had shortness of breath. On Apr2021, patient had dizziness. The patient used to have bulky arms and now you can see his muscle mass depleting in Apr2021. The patient cannot focus on school online because of the headaches from 19Apr2021. The patient's blood pressure goes up and down from 19Apr2021. For days from 19Apr2021, the patient's heart rate will be fine in the 60s and it goes up to 120 or 130 with chest pain, it fluctuates depending on the day. The patient visited the emergency room on 05May2021, but was not admitted and no one knows what was going on with the vaccine. It was also reported that the patient lost 14 pounds on 25Apr2021 since the second dose of the vaccine. They knew the patient has already lost 10 pounds and then yesterday, 25May2021, the patient weighed himself and noticed he has lost another 4 pounds over the weekend. Patient had bloodwork on 20May2021 and it was all negative. The primary care provider was concerned about the weight loss so she ran a bunch of blood work. The patient is negative for COVID test and chest x-ray on 21May2021 and he has had multiple tests done. The patient went to his primary care provider on 25May2021 (yesterday from the time off reporting) and the reporter mentioned that maybe can they look at this as being a side effect from the vaccine. The patient's doctor laughed and said nothing has been proven yet about this. The reporter felt that this is a reaction to the vaccine. At the time of reporting on 26May2021, the patient was not able to function and sleeps all day. The patient also underwent lab tests and procedures that includes being tested negative for mono twice now (on unspecified dates). Clarified that they have not filed a safety report with Pfizer on the patient's events. The outcome of the events 'dizziness', 'lost 14 pounds since the second dose of the vaccine/lost another 4 pounds over the weekend', 'muscle mass depleting', 'cannot focus on school online', 'not able to function' and 'sleeps all day' was unknown; while for the other events, it was not recovered.

After about 5-7 minutes he felt better and sipped some water. He was helped up to chair and remained seated for an additional 10 minutes at which time his mother stated he was feeling like himself and the left the pharmacy
17 2021-06-14 dizziness, fall I gave the Pfizer vaccine first dose to patient and consulted patient waiting in the store for 15min... Read more
Close
I gave the Pfizer vaccine first dose to patient and consulted patient waiting in the store for 15minutes and told him common side effects. After 10 minutes sitting down, his mom notified us the patient fell on the floor. He hurt his right eye brown and caused bleeding and we called 911 . I took the patient sat on the chair in the lobby and tried to clean his opened wound on the eye brown. We gave him drink some water and he felt tired and light dizziness.After 20 minutes, 911 came and checked his pulse, oxygen, and clean his wound. After 30 minutes, patient felt okay and no longer having dizziness and he refused to go to Emergency. He still had pain from hurting eye brown.
17 2021-06-14 dizziness Vaccine administered at 1215 pm. In waiting area around 1225 pt felt very faint sitting in chair nex... Read more
Close
Vaccine administered at 1215 pm. In waiting area around 1225 pt felt very faint sitting in chair next to grandmother. Patient appeared to have seizure like activity and paramedic called immediately. After 1 to 2 minutes patient started responded well and just stated she felt very faint. Paramedics arrived and waiting for patient to fully recovered. They did state her blood pressure decreased to below baseline but quickly came back up to normal as patient started feeling better. They deemed patient to be stable and didn't think it was from the vaccine itself versus receiving an injectable vaccine as patient often feels faint after giving blood. They walked patient and grandmother to their personal car so she coudl be taken home.

Close
The patient was walking around the store with parent waiting their 15 minutes to see if there was a reaction to the vaccine, The patients parent then yells out for help and yells that the patient has passed out and just received the vaccine. I ran over to make sure the patient was alert and he tried to stand up after falling so we escorted him to a chair and called 911. I waited with the patient until the fire department arrived, the patient was sweating, pale, and seemed to be breathing normally.
17 2021-06-16 fall Patient was administered the COVID19 vaccine and 5 minutes later, while in the observation chair, fa... Read more
Close
Patient was administered the COVID19 vaccine and 5 minutes later, while in the observation chair, fainted and fell to the ground. His mother was present with him and the pharmacy staff rushed over to help. He came to after a minute or 2, but the paramedics were called immediately. Patient was a sweaty, hot. Paramedics arrived, did some test and said his blood pressure was low. They proceeded to take him to the hospital. Mom called around 3pm 6/17 and informed the pharmacy staff he was administered fluid, they ran more tests and he was waiting to be released.

17 2021-06-19 dizziness Patient received dose 1 of the Pfizer COVID vaccine (lot ER8735, exp 7/2021) at 1015. At 1020, patie... Read more
Close
Patient received dose 1 of the Pfizer COVID vaccine (lot ER8735, exp 7/2021) at 1015. At 1020, patient reported to LVN that he felt nauseous and dizzy. Patient was given emesis bag. Patient's sister reported patient had not eaten since the night before. Vital signs: blood pressure 110/60, pulse 90, respirations 16. PHN approached the patient, noting diaphoretic skin. Patient was placed supine in zero-gravity chair and given juice and granola bar. Patient denied allergies, medical conditions, and medications. At 1025, vital signs: blood pressure 112/60, pulse 80, respirations 16. Patient reported symptoms improving, PHN noted patient's skin was no longer diaphoretic. At 1030, vital signs: blood pressure 110/60, pulse 77, respirations 16. Patient finished snack and juice, reported feeling better. Patient reported similar reaction when having blood drawn previously. At 1035, vital signs: blood pressure 114/62, pulse 72, respirations 16. PHN encouraged patient to stay for monitoring for 30min. PHN educated patient about following up with medical provider and when to call 911. At 1040, patient sat up. Vital signs: blood pressure 110/64, pulse 70, respirations 16. At 1045, patient stood up closely monitored by PHN and EMT, reported symptoms had resolved. Vital signs: blood pressure 110/62, pulse 77, respirations 16. Patient drank water. At 1050, vital signs: 112/60, pulse 74, respirations 16. Patient left walking with steady gait at 1052 accompanied by sister to drive him home.
17 2021-06-20 dizziness patient is a 17yo male who experienced a syncopal event approximately 10 minutes after receiving his... Read more
Close
patient is a 17yo male who experienced a syncopal event approximately 10 minutes after receiving his first dose of the Pfizer covid-19 vaccine. while sitting in the observation area with his mother, patient began to feel light headed and nauseous. patient was assisted to yoga mat on ground with lower extremities elevated. Per pt and mother, patient has a significant history of anxiety, and also becoming light headed and nauseated, in association with medical procedures, specifically when involving needles. patient's mother also reports patient has "passed out" previously when he experienced a hypoglycemic episode. Patient reports only having eaten a cookie and a slice of bread for the entire day. Upon initial assessment, no acute distress noted, AOx4, verbal, able to make needs know, and answers questions appropriately. Respiration even and unlabored, lung sound clear to auscultation. after approx <1 minute, noted progressive decreased level of consciousness, patient was minimally responsive for <15 seconds. Noted patient with significant diaphoresis, patient skin and lips were slightly pale & intact. Respiration remained even and unlabored, lung sound clear to auscultation. no sx/sx of allergic reaction. patient's mother Denied any significant past medical history, or allergies. Patient was assessed while laying on yoga mat on ground with bilateral lower extremities elevated, in observation area. Physical examination and past medical history obtained simultaneously. Initial vital signs @ 1845 95/32 hr 49 O2sat 99% rr17. Patient started to regain consciousness after <15 seconds, with progressive alertness. After approx 1 minute patient was AOx4, verbal and able to make needs known. Patient was provided with a gatorade drink, and encouraged to finish entire drink. Continued to observe patient for an additional 30 minutes. No acute distress noted throughout that time. Respiration remained even and unlabored, lung sound clear to auscultation. denies dizziness, light headedness or other symptoms. Skin warm, dry and color appropriate for ethnicity. V/S@ 1853 111/51 hr 90 O2sat 99% rr18 , AOx4, no acute distress noted. @ 1900 Patient reported ?feeling better?, denied lightheadedness or nausea. V/S @ 1900 128/66 hr 92 O2sat 99% rr 18. Instructed patient's mother not to leave patient unattended for remainder of day, and encouraged oral hydration. Instructed to call 911 if experiencing return of initial symptoms, difficulty breathing or loss of consciousness. Educated patient and his mother on sx/sx of allergic reactions, and anaphylaxis. Encouraged patient to follow up with his PCP. patient and his mother expressed understanding of all instructions and education. V/S @ 1930 135/72 hr 83 O2sat 98% rr18, no acute distress noted, patient denied any symptoms at that time. Patient left home with mother @ 1930.

17 2021-06-22 dizziness 17 y/o male presented to ED (6/21) after experiencing "chest pain" with exercise (playing basketball... Read more
Close
17 y/o male presented to ED (6/21) after experiencing "chest pain" with exercise (playing basketball). This occurred 5 days after receiving his 3rd dose of his Pfizer vaccine (6/16). He received a 3rd dose at the recommendation of his PMD after being informed that his 2nd dose was expired at the time when he had received it on 6/7 Following this vaccination he "slept for 18-20 hours" and had subjective fevers which self-resolved after 24 hours. He developed dyspnea, acute onset of R-sided/mid chest pain and the sensation that his heart was racing. He presented to the ED and was admitted to the PICU for monitoring. Labs revealed elevated troponin (240 ng/L) which downtrended to 89 ng/L by 6/23. Concern for myocarditis vs pericarditis in setting of recent Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine; started on ibuprofen 400mg PO q6h.

Patient felt dizzy after receiving his vaccine upon walking to observation room pt fainted and was guided to the floor by his mother. Patient came to by the time the nursing staff reached him. vitals were assessed and were as follows bp 52/23, hr 58bpm, O2 sat 100% temp 97.2, respirations 16. Patient was given fluids and the site MD was contacted. MD came to see patient and gave more fluids and considered him ok as his BP began to slowly rise. Patient reported that he gets faint like that every time he gets shots or blood draws. Patient also stated that he didn't eat much today (a bite of chicken). Pt has a history of spitting out food and poor eating habits.

Close
Patient received his 1st dose COVID vaccine at 6:56 PM and immediately said he felt lightheaded and nauseated. Patient had an emesis x1 which was clear. Vitals taken: BP 92/60, HR 55, SpO2 100%, Temp: 99.0, RR, 20. Patient is present with his father who both decline that the patient have any past medical hx, patient denies taking any medications, denies any known allergies to food or medicine. Per the patient's father, "my son always gets like this after shots". Patient's father verbalized that his son always gets extremely anxious prior to getting any vaccine. Patient rested in a clinic room for 15 min with his father, was provided water, and said he felt much better post 15 min. Patient requested anti-nausea prescription. Zofran e-prescribed to patient's pharmacy. Patient stable prior to leaving clinic. Strong ER precautions provided. Both patient and his father verbalized understanding.

Had second Pfizer Covid vaccine 3 days ago ~12 hrs after which had fever to 102, headache, dizziness which all resolved after ~ 24 hours. Took Benadryl this morning ?25 mg, which decreased pruritus. No facial or intraoral swelling, no dysphagia, no wheeze, no shortness of breath, no nausea or vomiting. No known other potential precipitants i.e. no new foods, soaps, lotions, pets, plants, medications. PMH: Neg Allergies: None known Meds: vitamins Immunizations: UTD Surg: Undescended testicle repair Social History: Lives with family. Family History: No conditions relevant to this visit Final Diagnosis 1. Rash R21 2. Allergic reaction T78.40XA Assessment/Plan Rash likely allergic reaction, plan to treat with Benadryl. 17 2021-07-07 dizziness Patient is a 17 year old male with only past medical history of anemia at 1 year of age (resolved wi... Read more
Close
Patient is a 17 year old male with only past medical history of anemia at 1 year of age (resolved with iron and vit C supplementation), who presented to an Hospital on 7/7/21 with 2 days of chest pain radiating to his L arm, generalized upper extremity weakness, SOB, vomiting, found to have an an elevated troponin level of 0.626 with ST segment elevation on EKG, echo reportedly normal. Patient reportedly tested positive for COVID-19 on 6/6 and subsequently went into quarantine, was re-tested on 6/21 and tested negative. He arrived on 6/28 and received his 1st dose of Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine on 07/03/21. Of note, he was told he might feel dizziness and arm achiness after the vaccine but denies he was informed about possible inflammation of or around the heart after the vaccine. On 7/5 he was awakened in the morning by chest pain 6/10 and shortness of breath that started in the right lower sternal border and progressively moved to the left lower sternal border and then to his L shoulder and arm which he describes as feeling like he had been "punched" or a constant achy feeling. He took Tylenol x1 on Monday with minimal improvement. He initially thought it was reflux pain and took tums but it did not improve. He had one hour of relief but then the pain returned. He reportedly felt dizzy Monday evening as well. The pain was absent on Tuesday, but he woke up this morning again with the same chest pain and shortness of breath, prompting him to seek medical attention. In the outside ED, he had one NBNB emesis that was not preceded by nausea. En route from Hospital to Hospital he complained of chest pain 7/10 for which he was placed on 2L O2 which reduced the pain to 4/10. During his admission his troponin levels initially up trended and peaked at 5.67 before beginning to downtrend. He was diagnosed with myopericarditis and started on ibuprofen three times a day around the clock. He was discharged home on 7/8 with specific return precautions, follow-up appointment with cardiology, and strict instructions to avoid exercising and strenuous exercising until cleared by cardiology.

On April 23, 2021, we flew from one location to another for a visit. Patient became dizzy with vertigo and nausea, which worsened as the day progressed. We had to visit the ER that evening. His heart rate was @ 103 bpm and the ER evaluated him for several hours. The ER prescribed Meclizine. When we returned home patient saw a vestibular specialist @ Hospital and was diagnosed with vestibular neuronitis.

Close
Patient was nervous about getting vaccine. Discussed safety profile of vaccine and that many people are tolerating very well. Patient seemed much better after discussion and was ready to get vaccine. Gave injection and he was doing fine and went to sit down for 30 minutes as recommended. After giving next vaccine about 15 minutes later patient apparently tried to come across waiting room to speak to me and started to fall. Next patient was leaving room and caught patient, preventing injury and called for help. Multiple staff responded. Patient reported dizziness and seeing colors. Was breathing fast but not having any swelling or trouble breathing. Was able to stand after a minute and was taken to clinic that is right next to pharmacy for evaluation. Patient was evaluated and left within the next hour doing well. Spoke to patient in the afternoon and reports recovering well, has a headache that he thinks is stress related. Counseled to continue to monitor and seek medical attention if any worsening of symptoms.
18 2021-03-23 dizziness Patient received the Pfizer Vaccine at 9:10 am at vaccination site then sat at the observation area ... Read more
Close
Patient received the Pfizer Vaccine at 9:10 am at vaccination site then sat at the observation area for 15 min. for monitoring. Nurse was flagged down by observation staff stating patient c/o dizziness 15 mins after administration of vaccine. RN offered patient to laydown. patient refused stating only slightly dizzy. patient drank water, ate a candy bar, RN took VS and noted to be stable. Patient was monitored for 30 mins before departure. VS stable prior to departure. Patients father drove after appointment and RN instructed patient and family on Symptoms of Severe Adverse Reactions to report to health care provider or to go to the emergency room. Patient verbalized understanding.

Close
Patient reported dizziness, lightheadedness, had progressive symptoms of diffuse flushing of the skin, fatigue. He was given 25 mg of Benadryl and placed on a caught to rest for about 30 minutes. After the dose of Benadryl and with time, his symptoms progressively improved. No itching of the throat, skin, no SOB or CP.

18 2021-04-03 mobility decreased Mild soreness when using shoulder on vaccine arm (left) at 7:58am Sudden headache, at 9:45pm Arm sor... Read more
Close
Mild soreness when using shoulder on vaccine arm (left) at 7:58am Sudden headache, at 9:45pm Arm soreness increases substantially (cannot comfortably raise whatsoever) 9:45pm Chills at 9:50pm Fever 100 degrees F at 10:30pm Fever broke and chills stopped at around 3:00 am on 3/31 (the next day) Headache where it hurts to look to the side persists until 4/2 after which it gradually goes away becoming negligible by 4/4
18 2021-04-05 dizziness My healthy 18-year old son had his first dose of Pfizer, and within a few minutes he felt dizzy. His... Read more
Close
My healthy 18-year old son had his first dose of Pfizer, and within a few minutes he felt dizzy. His heart rate was also rapid. He didn't think much of it, but the dizziness persisted and so they had him lay down with feet up. After about 20 minutes, he began to vigorously shake (rigors I believe is what it is called.) He felt numb in both arms and also his tongue and mouth. We had 3 nurses attending to him, and after about 30 minutes they decided to send him to the ER for evaluation since the very strong shaking and other symptoms were worsening. The shaking, dizziness, numbness all subsided after about an hour. He was given a Zyrtec upon first symptoms about 15 minutes after dose. The ER doc doesn't believe it was an allergic reaction but potentially a strong vasovagal response and immune response. He felt tired after but was completely fine 2 hours later. We were discharged from the ER a few hours later after evaluation. Vitals were in normal range including blood sugar, blood pressure and oxygen. He was fully hydrated prior and had a turkey sandwich and orange prior to coming so was not low on food either. The shaking was very extreme and concerning. It has been almost 24 hours and he is feeling fine other than a sore arm.
18 2021-04-07 dizziness Pt. C/O feeling dizzy and nauseated. Had an episode of seizure that lasted for 5 sec, vomited small... Read more
Close
Pt. C/O feeling dizzy and nauseated. Had an episode of seizure that lasted for 5 sec, vomited small undigested food particles and became diaphoretic afterwards. A pkt of 125 mls of apple juice and water offered. (11 call made. Pt. finished the apple juice but had few sips of water. Pt reported having had similar episodes whenever he got blood draws and confirmed the reaction was related to sensitivity to needles ( vaccination needle) than the vaccine. Paramedic team arrived at 3:25 p m. Pt. and mom refused the Ambulance services to the ER, but agreed to remain in the observation room for further observation.at about 4:05 p m. Pt and mom left the recovery hall .
18 2021-04-07 gait inability Have become extremely sick and nauseous and weak, exactly 1 week following vaccination. Constantly t... Read more
Close
Have become extremely sick and nauseous and weak, exactly 1 week following vaccination. Constantly throwing up for almost 12 hours as well as being unable to walk or sit up without almost passing out. Stuck in bed for almost 3 days.
18 2021-04-08 dizziness A nurse in observation was made aware of a patient feeling faint around 1430. This nurse responded t... Read more
Close
A nurse in observation was made aware of a patient feeling faint around 1430. This nurse responded to this patient. She stated patient looked gray and said his oxygen saturation was 78%. His blood pressure was 88/60. She poured cold water on his chest, thinking he could be overheated. She instructed another nurse to call 911. A call went out over the walkie-talkie for a Charge Nurse to come to the scene at 1440. At this time the other nurse was already on the phone with EMS. When I arrived to patient around 1441, patient's oxygen saturation was 99% and pulse was 80. He was pale. He was talking coherently. He stated he had not eaten all day. I gave him some hard candy to suck on. Around 1445, EMS arrived. They assessed him and determined he did not need additional care. He signed EMS forms and the patient's brother drove him home. Patient was advised to make sure he did not go a whole day without eating before getting his second dose of the vaccine.
18 2021-04-08 dizziness Patient received the COVID-19 vaccine (first dose Pfizer). He reported no previous adverse reactions... Read more
Close
Patient received the COVID-19 vaccine (first dose Pfizer). He reported no previous adverse reactions to vaccines. During the 15 minute monitoring period, the patient fainted. He appeared pale and sweaty, and he reported dizziness, lightheadness, and blacking out. He laid down for several minutes and sat up in the chair with assistance when he was no longer lightheaded. His blood pressure was 108/71 with heart rate 76. EMS checked the patient and cleared him approximately 20-25 minutes after receiving the vaccine.

18 2021-04-12 fall Patient received covid vaccine, on the way to observation, turned and fell. Placed in a chair, autom... Read more
Close
Patient received covid vaccine, on the way to observation, turned and fell. Placed in a chair, automatic cuff unable to read bp, hr 40s, sats 94%, pale, diaphoretic, slow verbal responses. Observed patient, another nurse gave candy, applied ice to back of neck. Patient had another brief syncopal episode with quick recovery while seated. Code Medic called. Placed on sim lab stretcher after awake and feeling better while waiting for code team. Abrasion noted to just under chin. Bp improved to 115/74 with HR 67, spo2 100%. Code team arrived and assessed patient. Patient condition improved, attempted standing with observation by code team. Assisted to observation room. Given sprite and more snacks. Mom and patient state both are feeling better.

Site: Pain at Injection Site-Mild, Systemic: Dizziness / Lightheadness-Medium, Systemic: Flushed / Sweating-Medium, Systemic: Hypotension-Medium, Additional Details: 18 yo male fell out of chair and hit the left side of his head, ~5 min after receiving vaccine. 18 2021-04-15 fall Patient recieved vaccine without any issues on 4/16/21. Patient walked to waiting area with pharmaci... Read more
Close
Patient recieved vaccine without any issues on 4/16/21. Patient walked to waiting area with pharmacist, was not having any issues or concerns, and was observed for several minutes by the RPH. Approximately 5 minutes after receiving the COVID-19 shot, the patient passed out, fell out of his chair, and hit his head. The patient immediately regained concousness and sat back in his chair. The RPH immediately had a pharmacy associate call 911 and observed the patient. Patient stated he felt a liquid tingle go down his arm from where he received his vaccine then passed out. Patient stated he had a headache and appeared clammy. RPH provided an instant ice pack and observed patient until EMS arrived. EMS provided care to patient and determined he did not need to go to the hospital. Patient was advised to go to hospital if he becomes nauseus. Patient claimed he was okay and just has a headache. Patient's mother took him home.

RN ran over to check on pt as pt eye rolled back and pt limbs fell limp. Pt moved to the floor by RN, rolled to the side by RN. Pt regained consciousness almost immediately and was laid on his back with feet elevated. Pt stated he felt fine, did not recall exactly what happened. Pt helped up into chair, given water and crackers. Pt stated he felt fine, observed by medical personnel for 30 min and pt was able to ambulate off site.

18 2021-04-24 fall, dizziness Passed Out; feeling light headed/lightheadedness/being lightheaded; Fell Down Stairs/falling; hit hi... Read more
Close
Passed Out; feeling light headed/lightheadedness/being lightheaded; Fell Down Stairs/falling; hit his head and his knee; hit his head and his knee; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient's father). An 18-year-old male patient received bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Solution for injection), dose 1 via an unspecified route of administration, administered in right arm at the age of 18-year-old on 07Apr2021 09:50 (Batch/Lot number was not reported) as single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included ongoing congenital diaphragmatic hernia (that prevented his lungs from developing before he was born). There were no concomitant medications. The patient previously took influenza vaccine (FLU) for immunization and without a reaction. Caller is a consumer, calling about his 18 years son who received the covid vaccine this morning and had an adverse event afterwards. Caller reported that his 18 years son had his first covid vaccine dose this morning. He has had all of his vaccinations, even the flu shot every year without a reaction. After having his covid vaccination, on the way home he said he started feeling light headed. He was supposed to go back to school once they got home but the caller noticed that his son hadn't left yet because he drives himself. He reported that his son's room is downstairs and when he looked his son was laying down at the bottom of the stairs and appears to have passed out. He reports that now he is fine and he has eaten. Calling now because he was concerned and "wanted to make sure there was nothing else I should do in this situation''. Caller stated that he took his two kids to get their vaccines. His son is 18 years old and his daughter will be 18 next Tuesday.Stated that they stayed at the site in case of a reaction to the vaccine and nothing happened. On the way back home the son became lightheaded. Caller thought maybe he needed to eat even though he had eaten a light breakfast before they went to get the vaccines. Stated his son got home and passed out. Caller had never seen his son pass out before. Said his son fell down the stairs while going to the basement where is room is located. Caller was concerned this could've been a reaction and is calling to see if there is anything further they should be concerned about. The son's vaccine, lightheadedness, passing out, and falling all took placed today 07Apr2021. Caller said he nor his son are certain if he was injured during the fall. His son thinks he hit his head and his knee and noticed that his shorts where ripped behind the leg on 07Apr2021. Caller states his son says he is feeling back to normal and fine. The son was supposed to go to school after the vaccine but the caller had him stay home so he could keep an eye on him. Caller stated it was scary. The caller opened the door and saw his son lying on the floor with the gum he had bought at the drug store strewn out everywhere. Caller stated they are believers in vaccines. Stated his son used to have a part time job at the grocery store bagging groceries for customers and was wanting to go back to work. Caller also said that his son was born with a congenital diaphragmatic hernia that prevented his lungs from developing before he was born. Caller stated that due to this him and his wife felt it was best for the son to get the vaccine since if he got the Covid virus it could have been really bad for him. Caller denies any medications, labs, testing or treatments that are relevant to these events. Caller stated his son is healthy. Stated when his son mentioned being lightheaded in the car, the caller didn't think much of it. The outcome of events was recovered on 07Apr2021. Information on the lot/batch number has been requested.

Patient fainted after waiting for 10 minutes. He did not lose consciousness. He responded to RPH commands. He did not have shortness of breath, rash, inflammation. He urinated himself after falling. He remained laying on the ground for 20 minutes, after which he stood up and had recovered from the dizziness/nausea. Patient and parents did not wish for 911 to be called or to go the hospital. They agreed to call 911 if patient has any further symptoms.
18 2021-04-25 dizziness Patient received his first dose of Pfizer vaccine and waited 15 minutes in the observation area. Upo... Read more
Close
Patient received his first dose of Pfizer vaccine and waited 15 minutes in the observation area. Upon rising from chair, patient reported feeling dizzy and faint. Patient called for assistance. Patient reported feeling hot and sweaty and being unable to hear and see correctly. Pulse and SpO2 were taken, Pulse was initially 54 bpm and rose to 68 bpm after drinking water. SpO2 was 94-95% RA. Patient refused EMS. Patient reported feeling better after about 20 minutes. Hearing and vision improved. Patient remained in observation area for another 20 minutes before leaving in stable condition.

18 2021-04-28 dizziness Patient received Pfizer vaccine on left deltoid and immediately displayed seizure like activity whil... Read more
Close
Patient received Pfizer vaccine on left deltoid and immediately displayed seizure like activity while sitting down. Patient eyes rolled back and was briefly unresponsive for a few seconds. EMS was notifed at this time. The patient was assisted and carried down to the matted floor and feet were elevated on a chair. Patient did become responsive and was alert and oriented but continued be dizzy. Patient did not have labored breathing or respiratory distress at this time. Patient's vital signs were taken at 14:50: 130/71, 80hr, 95% PsO2, 18rr The fire department arrived and transported patient to Hospital. Patient did have another seizure like activity and patient's heart rate dropped into the 40-50s. Peripheral IV on right hand was initiated and bolused. Patient's mother, was notified of event and patient's sister who was waiting outside was brought into facility. Patient's sister who is 14 years old was later picked up by mother.

After administration, during the patient's required observation period, the patient started to feel lightheaded and dizzy. He went to stand up and then blacked out, falling to the floor. He did not injure himself or experience any trauma in the fall. He did not lose consciousness. I believe he was experiencing increased anxiety from the event as the patient mentioned several times that he did not like needles/injections. The patient remained sitting upright for an additional 15 minutes, drinking water, and his mother escorted him out of the store and drove him home.

Close
extreme hallucinations; not feeling well; chills; aches and pains; headaches; slight numbness in his extremities; difficulty walking; he did not get much sleep; fever; This is a spontaneous report from contactable consumer (parent). An 18-year-old male patient received bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE), dose 2 via an unspecified route of administration, administered in left arm on 23Apr2021 at 12:45 (Lot Number: Ew0153) at the age of 18 years, as a single dose for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history included autism spectrum disorder, ADHD (Attention deficit hyperactivity disorder) combined, learning disabilities. The patient had no known allergies. Prior to the vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. Concomitant medication taken within two weeks of vaccination included alfetamine aspartate/alfetamine sulfate/dexamphetamine saccharate/dexamphetamine sulfate (ADDERALL) taken for an unspecified indication. Historical vaccine included BNT162B2, dose 1 in left arm, on 02Apr2021, lot # EK5730. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within four weeks prior to the vaccination. On 23Apr2021 at 21:00 the patient experienced extreme hallucinations, not feeling well, chills, aches and pains, headaches, slight numbness in his extremities, difficulty walking, he did not get much sleep, fever. The clinical course of events was reported as follows: My son reported to me at bedtime last night, the night of his second Pfizer vaccine dose, that he was not feeling well. I told him to take some Advil and go to bed. He had a very bad night with chills and aches and pains but most distressing was his description of having had extreme hallucinations. He said that he was aware they were hallucinations and not real during and after the experience, but it was nonetheless concerning. It is also concerning that he didn't wake me for help. At any rate, he did not get much sleep and I have to assume his fever went pretty high before morning. He described to me the need to hydrate during the night. He also relayed to me this morning an experience of headaches and slight numbness in his extremities, difficulty walking, but he is now feeling much better. He is dressed, has eaten, and is playing games on the computer. I am keeping a close eye on him today and should we return to that level of concern, we will take him to urgent care. The clinical outcome of the events was recovering. It was also reported that since the vaccination, the patient had not been tested for COVID-19.

18 2021-05-19 dizziness Fainted within 30 seconds/Passed out completely after shot; Passed out completely after shot; Some i... Read more
Close
Fainted within 30 seconds/Passed out completely after shot; Passed out completely after shot; Some intermittent light headedness and dizziness; Some intermittent light headedness and dizziness; Irritating; scary/ fearful; scary/ fearful; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient's mother). An 18-year-old male patient received the first dose of BNT162B2 (Pfizer-Biontech Covid-19 Vaccine, Lot. EW0169) at single dose, on 22Apr2021 at 17:30, for COVID-19 immunization. The patient had not received any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the BNT162B2 vaccine. Relevant medical history and concomitant medications were unknown. Patient's mother reported that her son fainted within 30 seconds of receiving the Pfizer vaccine 1st dose and since then he had experienced some intermittent light headedness and dizziness. He passed out completely after shot. Adverse events were described as following: "patient is due to get his second dose of the shot later this evening but is having periods of lightheadedness and dizziness. Patient's mother states that her son also feels like he is going to pass out. She states that this started 30 seconds after the first shot. Her son only passed out once, completely right after the shot, it was a bad experience. She's glad he actually wants the other one today, but he is concerned because he is still lightheaded and dizzy after 3 weeks. Patient's mother states that he has been trying to function, work, and live his life but its irritating to him and scary. The doctor suggested that he should get his second dose but her son is a little fearful". Physician Office Visit required. The patient did not recover from intermittent light headedness and dizziness, while clinical outcome of the other events was unknown.; Sender's Comments: Based on known drug safety profile and strong temporal relationship there is reasonable possibility of causal association between the reported events and the suspect drug. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to regulatory authorities, Ethics Committees, and Investigators, as appropriate.

He and his mother went to the restroom where she helped him to the floor so he did not fall. No emergency medication was administered . Paramedics arrived to check him out, and he left the store under his own power. 18 2021-05-24 dizziness Patient received vaccine around 5 pm. For the first two minutes after vaccination the patient seemed... Read more
Close
Patient received vaccine around 5 pm. For the first two minutes after vaccination the patient seemed to be fine. Starting around that 3rd minute the patient got very dizzy and nauseous. He was then seated to prevent further NV. I asked the patient if they were breathing ok and the patient stated his breathing was fine. After about another minute the patient's eyes got glossy and the patient seemed to be out of it. I asked multiple orienting questions such as his name, where he was, and what day of the week it is. He was only able to answer the day of the week and his head was bobbing. I then called 911 as the patient became very pale and started to profusely sweat. While on the phone with the 911 operator, the patient went completely unconscious and lost control of motor functions. I was able to confirm the patient was still breathing and still had a heart rate (although rapid) and thus compressions were not given. The EMT arrived quickly to the scene and took over care of the patient. After about 20 minutes of checking vital signs, the EMT gave the patient and his family the option on whether they want to go to the hospital or not for further examination. The family decided they wanted to take the ambulance to the hospital.

An 18-years-old male patient received of bnt162b2 (BNT162B2, Formulation: Solution for injection) via an unspecified route of administration in left arm on 07May2021 12:10 (Lot Number: EW0183; Expiration Date: 31Aug2021) as 2nd dose, single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included lyme disease ongoing from 2013 and it was reported that her son had no tick bite & was diagnosed through a blood test. Her son had fatigue, migraines, lethargy & the doxycycline made him sick as a dog. A chiropractor had success using various tinctures & after 1 to 1-1/2 years, her son went into remission. Her son has a low degree of pain & soreness & has learned to deal with the pain. When his immune system is triggered, his Lyme disease comes back & he takes tinctures for a week or 2 & his symptoms goes away. No further details provided. The patient's concomitant medications were not reported. The patient previously received first dose of BNT162B2 (Lot number: EW0164 and Expiry date: 31Aug2021) administered in left arm for COVID-19 immunisation and experienced chest pain, headaches and light-headed. Patient also had his first HPV Vaccine, laid out flat for a week and had no problems with the meningitis. On 07May2021, after second dose of vaccine administration, the patient had pain but it did not go across chest like after first dose vaccine, numbness down arms and legs, really bad vertigo, was very hot, no fever, but radiating heat, muscle pain, dizziness, mind numbing migraine pain in head, body was hot allover, skin turned red and right hand started twitching uncontrollably. On an unspecified date in May2021, the patient had periodic pins and needles with the numbness, difficulty sleeping, chest tightness periodically, but not consistently, chest pain, severe fatigue, ear ringing, general malaise, can't walk to the end of the block without coming back in pain, found it hard to concentrate and cloudy head. It was reported that the caller's son had the pain but it did not go across his chest like after the first dose Pfizer Covid 19 vaccination. The caller's son had numbness down his arms and legs and her son's legs were real heavy. The caller's son had to help life his legs to get his legs to move. The caller's son had vertigo really bad. The vertigo was so bad the caller's son had to lay down on the stretcher as the vaccination site. Even sitting up, the caller's son's world was spinning. The caller's son had to lay down. It was very hot, no fever, but radiating heat: The caller's son was very hot, no fever, but radiating heat. Part of that was the vaccination centre was not air conditioned and the caller's son was already a little uncomfortably warm when he went in. Dry ice packs were placed on the caller's son's head, went through three dry ice packs melting on the caller's son. The dry ice packs were on the caller's son's forehead and back of his neck and the injection site. The caller was trying to give her son coolness the best she could. He stayed about 30 minutes at the vaccination site and nothing improved or got worse. He was still very heavily dizzy or whatever and got in the wheelchair and got home. The caller's son did nothing for the rest of the day or weekend. The caller's son was just in so much pain and so much dizziness, it was just too much to do anything. The caller's son's symptoms gradually improved but very minute. The amount of dizziness the caller's son had was a little less so he could sit up at the computer, but even that the caller's son had to take breaks and couldn't do it for more than 30 minutes before laying back down. Had pain but it did not go across chest like after first dose vaccine: The caller's son's pain was a little less intense. The caller's son's numbness by Monday, 10May2021, had subsided for the most part. The caller's son is still having numbness down his arm, the opposite arm the caller's son received the second dose Pfizer COVID-19 Vaccine. The caller's son is also having numbness in his thighs sometimes, but not constantly. Clarifies the thighs or upper legs. The caller took her son to a Chiropractor and the Chiropractor gave her son a couple supplements to detoxify. That seemed to actually make things worse. The caller also took her son to the doctor's office. The caller took her son to a Chiropractor and the Chiropractor gave her son a couple supplements to detoxify: The caller states these were Charcoal and Magnesium combination and Turmeric root extract. Reporter made her son hydrate and use the generic Acetaminophen 500mg Caplets, along with a pain tea. The pain tea was loose herbs of valerian root, peppermint, and skull cap and pain tea seemed to help her son more for his pain, and mask some of the general malaise, and allowed her son to study for his AP Calculus exam. Patient's pain went from an 11-12 and was now at a 6 or 7. patient had a high tolerance for pain, and could cope with the pain, but the pain made it difficult for him to concentrate. Patient's migraine pain was unbearable at times and made it difficult for him. The generic Acetaminophen 500mg caplet with the pain tea helped to manage so his migraine pain was not so extreme. Therapeutic measures included Liposomal Resveratrol 38mg Curcumin from turmeric root extract 100mg, dietary supplement (Lot: 00728B or 007288). She has reported that she had been giving her tylenol for muscular pain and migraine. Other treatment included: alternating between Advil (Liqui-Gels) and Tylenol (generic acetaminophen 500mg caplets), Advil Liqui-Gels 200mg Ibuprofen (UPC Number: 0573176914, Lot Number: R77157, Expiration Date: Mar2022), Generic Acetaminophen 500mg Caplets, NDC Number: 21130-111-90, Lot Number: 1AV1505 and Expiration Date: Nov2022). Reported in the evenings her son would take Advil PM (200mg Ibuprofen with Diphenhydramine Citrate 38mg), NDC/UPC Number: Unknown, Lot Number: EG1024 and Expiration Date: Jun2023. Reporter said that Advil didn't seem to work on her son's migraine headache like the Advil usually does. Outcome of the events pain but it did not go across chest like after first dose vaccine, numbness down arms and legs and vertigo really bad, muscle pain, mind numbing migraine pain in the caller's son's head, periodic pins and needles with the numbness, right hand started twitching uncontrollably, chest tightness periodically, but not consistently, chest pain and ear ringing as recovering, outcome of the event body was hot all over, and his skin turned red was recovered, outcome of the event difficulty sleeping as not recovered and outcome of the events dizziness, severe fatigue, general malaise, can't walk to the end of the block without coming back in pain, found it hard to concentrate and cloudy head as unknown. Information on Lot/Batch number was available. Additional information has been requested.

Close
Approximately 5 minutes after receiving the vaccine, the patient passed out and his eyes rolled back (possible seizure activity). This activity lasted for approximately 1 minute. Patient also felt dizzy, sweaty, nauseous, and became pale. Patient was given a cold ice pack to lower his body temperature. Patient was also given crackers for nausea, and a bag just incase he had to vomit. Patient's mother was also here to tend to the patient. The mother also gave him clear fluids (sprite) to help with the nausea. After approximately 10 minutes, the patient was able to stand without feeling dizzy. He left the store with his mother to be watched closely (His mother is a nurse.) They also refused emergency medical services.

blackout; Shallow breathing; rapid heart rate; difficulty breathing or talking; dizziness; weakness; feeling unwell; nausea; numb arm; heat flash; chills; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer. An 18-years-old male patient received bnt162b2 (BNT162B2), dose 1 via an unspecified route of administration, administered in left arm on 30Apr2021 at 14:30 (Batch/Lot number was not reported) (at the age of 18 years-old) as a single dose, for COVID-19 immunisation. There was no medical history. Concomitant medication included ibuprofen (IBUPROFEN) taken for an unspecified indication, start and stop date were not reported. No other vaccinations given within last 4 weeks. On 30Apr2021 at 1445, the patient experienced Shallow breathing, rapid heart rate, difficulty breathing or talking, dizziness and blackout, weakness, feeling unwell, nausea, numb arm, heat flash and chills. The outcome of the events was recovering. The patient did not have COVID prior to vaccination and was not tested post vaccination.
18 2021-06-09 dizziness Patient became dizzy and heart began racing a few minutes after immunization. Increased dizziness an... Read more
Close
Patient became dizzy and heart began racing a few minutes after immunization. Increased dizziness and then patient began having rigors that continued for 1 hour and 20 minutes post vaccination. He also experienced numbness in his body as well as warmth in his stomach and extremities. He was given Benadryl soon after vaccination. He was sent to the ER of to be monitored. Vitals and labs were deemed to be OK. Rigors ceased 20 minutes after arriving at the ER. He was monitored for a couple of hours and subsequently discharged. He has had severe fatigue. The day following immunization, he had another episode of rigors and numbness. Paramedics were called and evaluated patient at home. Patient then began having panic attacks and losing vision, brain fog, dizziness, and body numbness that have continued since that time. He has also had recurrent episodes of paranoia that started 3-4 days post vaccination and continue today. Patient has seen immunologist and is seeing psychologist weekly for counseling and EDMR. He has seen ophthalmologist as well as his primary care physician.
18 2021-06-10 fall syncopal episode; syncopal episode at 16:05, he was sitting down and slid out of his chair; This is ... Read more
Close
syncopal episode; syncopal episode at 16:05, he was sitting down and slid out of his chair; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). An 18-year-old male patient received the second dose of BNT162B2 (Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine, lot number: EW0187), intramuscular on 26May2021 at 16:01 as a single dose for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history included syncope in the past while receiving other shots (unspecified). The patient's concomitant medications were not reported. The patient had a syncopal episode on 26May2021 at 16:05. He was sitting down and slid out of his chair with full extension of bilateral arms of legs, lasting about 30 seconds. Witnesses deny head strike or shaking during syncopal episode. The patient denies pain. He states that he only ate cereal the morning before and has experienced similar symptoms in the past while receiving other shots. The patient denies recent trauma or fall, HA, confusion, changes in vision/speech, changes in gait, fever, chills, n/v, abdominal pain, chest pain, SOB, palpitations, cough, hemoptysis, back pain, neck pain, dysuria, hematuria, recent sick contact or travel. Otherwise, the patient had no other complaints at the time of the report. The event required a visit to the emergency room. The patient underwent physical examination, vitals and 12 lead EKG all with unknown results. The patient was discharged at 16:54 and given educational materials on understanding vasovagal syncope. The outcome of the events was recovered.

Close
Shortly after this 2nd dose of vaccination, patient reported feeling light-headed. Gave patient water, which patient finished 1 bottle. As RPh was speaking to patient at the observation area, patient become profusely sweaty and eyes started fluttering. RPh removed patient's face mask and asked 911 to be called, RPh stayed with patient and held him securely while speaking to him stay awake. EMT arrive minutes later, and at that time patient was awake. EMT took patient's BP=117/73. Patient refused to go to ER.
18 2021-06-20 dizziness 18 year old male with no known history of allergies presented to covid-19 vaccine pod for first dose... Read more
Close
18 year old male with no known history of allergies presented to covid-19 vaccine pod for first dose of Pfizer. After vaccine administration patient sat during holding area and started to have dizziness, vision changes, tingles in left arm and hot flash. Patient appeared pale with no diaphoresis noted no change mental status. Alert and oriented x 3. Vitals BP 88/53 HR 88 Respirations 17 Pulse Ox 98% Patient admitted to eating only one bowl of cereal and one glass of water for the entire day. Patient denied any SOB, chest pain, swelling or tingling sensation around mouth or tongue however report heart racing. Patient observed for 15 minutes and given water and snack which patient noted to have improvement. Color returned to face. Vitals BP 110/67, HR 89, R 18, Pulse OX 98%. Notified family present of symptoms and at home education. Patient then started to feel cold, noted tremors of upper extremities and patient lips blue tinged. EMS called and spoke to mother on phone regarding patients status. EMS arrived on scene no visible improvements. Patient left via EMS to ED
18 2021-06-22 dizziness After receiving vaccine patient stated they did not feel well (complained of nausea/light headednes... Read more
Close
After receiving vaccine patient stated they did not feel well (complained of nausea/light headedness), before I could ask if the patient was okay the patients entire body stiffened, his eyes got very big/wide, and they started to roll back. At that point I stayed with the patient and called for my pharmacist. The patient lost consciousness, and by the time my pharmacist got there he was stable and coherent. Once my pharmacist assessed the situation she had me call 911 for paramedics. We had him lay on the floor with a pillow under his head, feet elevated. We provided ice water, nuts as a snack, and I dabbed sweat from his forehead while holding an ice pack to his forehead. I stayed with the patient and patients girlfriend until paramedics arrived for transport.

Approx 12 hours after second dose of Pfizer COVID vaccine, my son experienced severe chills (teeth chattering so bad he couldn?t talk) , heart palpitations, said his heart hurt so bad he was crying, rapid uncontrollable breathing, fever, headache (said his head felt like it was going to pop), aches and pains to the point he couldn?t walk.
18 2021-06-23 mobility decreased Allergy to red meat became prevalent again. Since becoming allergic to red meat in the summer of 202... Read more
Close
Allergy to red meat became prevalent again. Since becoming allergic to red meat in the summer of 2020, I had gained a tolerance to red meat to the point where I could consume as much as I wanted. This lasted between August 2020 and the date listed in this report. On that date I consumed red meat and had an allergic reaction to it. The reaction was a swelling of the fingers, hives on the arms and knees and wrist. As I didn?t have any reactions to red meat in the previous 10 months I didn?t make the connection that I was allergic to red meat again. The following Monday I consumed more red meat. That night I was very drowsy and went to bed at 1900. At around 0100 Tuesday morning I woke up with a terrible stomach ache and could feel my hands itching. I tried to go back to sleep. At around 0430 I woke up again with completely swollen hands to the point where I couldn?t bend any joint in them, hives on my wrists, knees, elbows, neck, forehead, back, and back of thighs. I went to the hospital for a severe allergic reaction. This is the exact same allergic reaction that I would have when I consumed red meat in June 2020 at the height of my allergy, but I had never had a reaction like it since then. Now I am sensitive to red meat again and I can?t think of any reason except that I received the vaccine. I have not consumed red meat since.

18 2021-06-29 fall The day of the second shot (07JUN2021@11AM), my son complained his arm was sore and was not feeling ... Read more
Close
The day of the second shot (07JUN2021@11AM), my son complained his arm was sore and was not feeling the best but was eating, drinking, and seemed fine. The next day (08JUN2021 @10AM) my son came down from his room to eat breakfast and still was not feeling the best but seemed fine after eating. Around 12PM my son came down the stairs to get some water in the kitchen and then shortly thereafter after passed out, fell against the wall and slid down to the floor. I was in the location and found him unresponsive, very cold, and eyes looking straight ahead -not moving. My older son and I then carried him to the couch where I laid him down and elevated his feet. He started coming around approx. two minutes later and broke out in a sweat but also had chills. At that point, I did not call an ambulance and started to hydrate. After an hour or so, he started feeling better and then ate some food but was weak most of day and rested. The next day he seemed fine.

19 2021-01-07 dizziness At time of vaccination ~5 minutes after the injection of the pfizer vaccine I developed a tightness ... Read more
Close
At time of vaccination ~5 minutes after the injection of the pfizer vaccine I developed a tightness in my throat, I was still waiting in line and I did not think much of it, therefore I did not alert the medical personnel about the reaction. Approximately @15mins after the injection I left the site and developed a sense of something wrong and did not feel "right", my chest became tight, hoarseness in my throat and speach, lightheaded, and I remember taking a sip of my coffee thinking it was more difficult to swallow than usual. May I note I was in the passenger seat and not driving the vehicle. I alerted my mother of the reaction, both sceptical because of my hx of no known allergies. We both figured as long as I can breath and I was still conscious, with no signs of cyanosis I would be fine. At around 10:45 I took my BP: which was 106/62 I typically run low. I then took two 25mg Benadryl capsules which did help the throat tightness to an extent, however the tightness in the chest, lightheaded and dizziness still persisted. I was aware of the potential for Bi-phasic anaphylaxis so we had an Epi-pen on stand by just in case. I was stable for the rest of the day. At approximately 10pm I did notice a small erythematous non-pruritic rash across my chest. The symptoms of the reaction did subside within 24hrs. I remained in stable condition and recovered with time.

Close
Patient ambulated to general observation, sat in chair and suddenly fell straight back and slammed back of head on floor. Patient was unconscious, pale. Immediately turned onto left side. within a few seconds began having generalized rigid jerking for approx 5 sec, then patient came too, sat straight up, disoriented looking around. Able to recall name. states he was here for covid vaccine. Assisted to w/c by 2 EMT's and taken to private observation area. Patient c/o nausea and head pain. Color pale. Has an almond size swollen area at posterior base of head. Initial VS - BP 90/p; HR 53; O2 91% on room air. Responding to questions, but states he feels disoriented. Bilateral pupils 3cm with right reacting sluggish. Patient states he is a student. EMT attempted to contact patient's father and LVM. Patient's step mother returned called. Informed her that patient is being transported to Hospital downtown FW for further eval. She asked him what did she need to do. Nurse informed that his vehicle will be left at the vaccine location and he will need assistance pending hospital eval. Patient then called his boss to notify him that he will not be at work tonight. Patient states that he had a reaction to his first HPV - states he fainted, but completed the series without further problems. Repeat VS at 1550 BP 90/p; HR 67, O2 98%. Color remains very pale. EMS activated. patient states he needs to lie down. Assisted to stretcher per EMT, elevated legs, cushion under head with ice packs on back of head. 1602 EMS arrived, BP 121/75; HR 69 O2 100% on room air. Transferred to stretcher 1605 Patient transported to Hospital

Patient was monitored until sister came to pick him up. Dr. recommended for patient get vaccine recumbrant in 3 wks for second dose.

19 2021-03-18 dizziness On Thursday, March 18, 2021 client received his first dose of Pfizer COVID vaccine (LOT # ER2613, E... Read more
Close
On Thursday, March 18, 2021 client received his first dose of Pfizer COVID vaccine (LOT # ER2613, EXP 7/2021) at approximately 2:45pm by vaccinator. During assessment of screening questions, client stated he has a history of anxiety when getting vaccinations. After vaccine was administered, client stated he "felt anxious and dizzy." Vaccinator took his pulse at this time: 88bpm. Client was given water and sat at vaccination table for approximately 15 minutes. At 3:00pm, client walked with a steady gait to the Observation Area and EMT performed the following vitals assessment: At 3:05pm, vitals: BP: 130/p, HR: 60, RR: 13, Skin: dry, pink, warm. Vitals at 3:10pm: BP: 128/p, HR: 58, RR: 13, skin: dry, pink, warm. Vitals at 3:15pm: BP: 132/p, HR: 60, RR: 14, skin: dry, pink, warm. (p= over palpation-cuff too small for client). Client was observed watching videos on his phone and stated to EMT his anxiety had significantly lowered. No further interventions indicated. Client was educated by Lead RN & EMT on signs and symptoms of adverse reactions and when to go to the ED/call MD. Client left vaccination site with a steady gait and was driven home by his mother.

Close
Pt reports generalized body aches, fatigue, fever 3/26, one day after receiving vaccine. Evaluated at ED 3/28, received Ketorolac and was discharged. While in parking lot, patient experienced blurring of vision, lightheadedness, nausea, SOB, and left-sided chest pain with return for re-evaluation. Pt treated for possible allergic reaction and concurrent EKG and blood work showed elevated troponin and transient ST elevation. Cardiology consulted and evaluated patient to have severe acute onset systolic heart failure, cardiogenic shock with pulmonary edema, Idiopathic fulminant myocarditis with myonecrosis, and hypoxic respiratory failure. Placed on furosemide, supplemental oxygen, and pending MRI.

Patient reports feeling better and would like to leave.

Close
19 year old male given 2nd dose of vaccine then suddenly became dizzy, lightheaded, diaphoretic and momentary loss of consciousness while seated in sun at vaccine clinic. His nearby family held him and he did not fall then regained consciousness and was lowered to ground with legs elevated by medical staff. Patient was assessed with normal vital signs. 911 was called and patient was reassessed. He was not transported to the hospital. Family was encouraged to monitor symptoms and call 911 if he worsens for further evaluation.

Rechecked in 10 mins and reports he felt normal

At approximately 1545 he got up from his chair and asked where the restroom was. When he turned to go to the restroom he fell to the floor without bracing his fall. His head hit the floor and then ?bounced? and hit again. He appeared to be unconscious for about 30 seconds but was A&O to date, place, name when he woke up. He did say that he thought he lost consciousness at some point because he ?woke up with everyone standing over him?. He also said his BG was 121 prior to eating- finger stick done at 1549- and was 88; which he states ?is not low for me?. Doctor out to assess him and advised he needed to be evaluated by ER. While waiting for EMS he had trouble keeping his eyes open and his eyelids were fluttering, c/o his head hurting and being tired, he continuously yawned and rolled his tongue asking for water. 1559 EMS arrived and took over care of patient at this time. developed chest pressure, taken to ED via ambulance. D-dimer and tropinin elevated. CT PE Angio = 5.0 x 3.4 cm soft tissue lesion in the anterior mediastinum which could represent residual thymic tissue although size and convex margins appear greater than expected for age. ECHO = There is mild left ventricular systolic dysfunction. There is mild global hypokinesis. The visually estimated LVEF is 46-51%. The quantitative LVEF based on modified Simpson's method is 51%. 19 2021-05-19 dizziness Patient DOB: 11/25/2001. Received his first dose Pfizer (LOT#: EW0185 EXP: 8/2021) at 0920on 5/18/21... Read more
Close
Patient DOB: 11/25/2001. Received his first dose Pfizer (LOT#: EW0185 EXP: 8/2021) at 0920on 5/18/21. Patient alerted EMT. Patient stated that he felt light headed and also felt anxious. Patient stated that he had not had not eaten in the morning. EMT took patients vital signs at 0928. BP: 138/82 pulse: 75, O2: 98%. Patient was given water, juice and food. Patient was placed in zero gravity chair. Patient was asked to stay an extra 30 minutes for further observation. EMT reassessed and re-took vital signs at 0945. BP: 132/74, pulse: 76, O2: 98%. Patient stated he was feeling better and only slightly felt the symptoms. Patient was educated on worsening signs and symptoms of vaccine and when to seek EMS or urgent care. Patient verbalized understanding of education. Patient left vaccination site at 0947 before the 30 minute observation was completed. PHN educated patient that he was leaving AMA. Patient insisted on leaving and was feeling better. Patient left vaccination site unassisted and with a steady gait.
19 2021-05-19 dizziness 19 y/o male with no past medical history who presents with dizziness post vaccination. Patient state... Read more
Close
19 y/o male with no past medical history who presents with dizziness post vaccination. Patient states that this is his first vaccination in a two-dose series. Patient denies previous reactions to vaccinations in the past. Patient denies headache, vision changes, sore throat, difficulty breathing, shortness of breath, itch or rash. NP and Paramedics at patient side. Patient states that he has not had anything to eat since 1 am and drank only a small amount of water. Patient provided with water and a protein bar. Glucose was obtained and measured 225. Patient denies increase thirst, hunger but states that he has lost some weight recently (patient pushes carts at the supermarket sometimes in the sun). Mother states that patient went for a physical today and pending blood work. Patient vitals within normal limits, 133/89 BP, 98% RA, 77 HR, Resp 12. Patient physician office called and notified of elevated glucose here at the vaccination site. The RN states that patient will be seen tomorrow am to obtain further labs. Prior to discharge patient glucose rechecked x2 and measured 99 and 98. NP still instructed patient to keep tomorrows appointment for labs. Patient was monitored for 30 mins with resolution of dizziness. Patient discharged home in stable condition.

19 2021-05-27 dizziness Patient is a 19yo male who experienced a near syncopal episode immediately after receiving his first... Read more
Close
Patient is a 19yo male who experienced a near syncopal episode immediately after receiving his first dose of Pfzier covid 19 vaccine. Patient c/o dizziness and tinnitus, patient then noted altered level of conciousness, w/o complete loss of consciousness. Upon assessment patient noted with significant diaphoresis, noted generalized clammy skin, no skin lesions, rash or hives noted. respiratory rate WNL, respirations even and unlabored. Within less that 60 seconds patient started to regain alertness and was able to respond and answer questions appropriately. Reported feeling some anxiety prior to getting vaccine but denied being diagnosed or treated with anxiety. reported prior episode with similar less severe symptoms associated with "shots" within >2 minutes patient was A&O x4, verbal and able to make needs known. Respiration remained even and unlabored. Skin pink warm and intact with significantly decreased clamminess and diaphoresis. No sx/sx of allergic reaction. Chest is non-tender, initially bradycardia @ 43 BPM, noted irregular heart rhythm, no murmur or extra sounds noted. Pt reports playing football with practicing at least 4 days weekly. Denies significant past medical HX. No HX of allergies. Patient was assisted to yoga mat on ground, in supine position with lower extremities elevated. Physical assessment completed then past medical HX obtained from PT. Initial VS 100/50. HR 43, o2 96% ECG obtained by EMTS WNL. Spontaneous resolution of symptoms after 1-2 minutes. Patient was assisted to sitting position, then standing w/o return of symptoms. VS @ 5 mins 114/63 HR 63 RR 18 o2 98%. Patient escorted to observation area and sitting in chair. Patient was observed for 30 mins in observation area. After 30 minutes no acute distresss noted, pt denied pain, dizziness, tinnitus or other symptoms. Advised patient to abstain from strenuous activity for the rest of the day and advised against football practice today and against being alone today. Advised patient to seek emergency treatment by calling 911 should symptoms return, experience SOB, or any sx/sx of an allergic reaction. Patient verbalized understanding before leaving vaccine site @ 1610
19 2021-05-27 dizziness Extreme dizziness, muscle pain especially at injection site, extreme hot and cold flashes
19 2021-05-27 dizziness Pt has syncopal episode 14-15 minutes after vaccine. Pt sitting in chair during observation and sudd... Read more
Close
Pt has syncopal episode 14-15 minutes after vaccine. Pt sitting in chair during observation and suddenly passed out. Pt was able to come out of syncopal episode within a few seconds (10-15 s) after RN approached him. Pt states he felt dizzy for 30 seconds and passed out. Pt was dazed /confused and pale when awaken. Pt states he did not have breakfast this morning and last had a meal yesterday evening. Pt denies having syncopal episode in the past related to blood draw or vaccines. Vital signs taken initially (at 1041) after syncopal episode were as followed: BP 84/47, HR57, SpO2 97%, pt given granola bar, ice water, and ice pack applied in back of head. After patient was able to regain skin color back, drink full cup of ice water, and eat whole granola bar, vital signs were taken again as followed at 1052 105/50BP, HR71, spO2 97%. Pt placed in gurney to be taken to treatment room. RN gave report to treatment room RN. Pt AOx4 when, able to follow commands.
19 2021-06-01 dizziness, balance disorder The following morning after I got my second COVID shot, I experienced extreme nausea, sweating, high... Read more
Close
The following morning after I got my second COVID shot, I experienced extreme nausea, sweating, high-fever, weakness in my legs, lack on night vision (everything was unusually dark), light headedness, trouble hearing, extreme ringing in both of my ears, and trouble balancing. I felt like I was blacking out. I was treated by laying back in bed and I felt much better after about 20 minutes. 4 days later on May 26th at about 3:00 am, I experienced severe diarrhea (15-20) bouts for an entire day, I vomited 3 times by 9:00 am, severe dehydration, sweating, nausea, and stomach cramps. I was treated with 2 full bags of Iv's and nausea medication.
19 2021-06-03 dizziness At 1034, vaccinator reported to learn nurse "I think the needle may be in the client because I canno... Read more
Close
At 1034, vaccinator reported to learn nurse "I think the needle may be in the client because I cannot find it." At 1034, co-lead nurse activated. Lead nurses assessed patient. Patient reported he felt 0/10 left arm pain and felt dizziness. Lead nurses examined syringe and confirmed that the needle was inside the syringe. Vaccinator confirmed that there was no spillage during administration of the vaccine and there was no vaccine left in the syringe. Patient reported no allergies, no medications, no medical conditions. At 1038, EMT assessed vitals: blood pressure 130/80 mmHg, pulse 85 beats/minute, and SpO2 99%. At 1046 paramedics arrived and assumed care. Paramedics confirmed there was no needle in patient's arm and patient refused to go to the hospital. Supervisor advised lead nurse to have patient wait in observation area for 30 minutes. Lead nurse was attending to vaccinator who stated she felt "traumatized" and "overwhelmed". Co-lead and EMT attended to another patient reaction in observation area. At approximately 1058, lead nurses realized patient already left observation area. Syringe used was 1mL Vanish Point syringe 25G x 1".

19 2021-06-08 fall The patient was given the vaccination and told to wait 15 minutes in the recovery area to observe fo... Read more
Close
The patient was given the vaccination and told to wait 15 minutes in the recovery area to observe for signs of adverse reactions. The patient had syncope about 2 minutes after sitting and fell from a seated position on his chair to the ground. He had a brief seizure (unresponsive, tense muscles, open eyes) for about 2-5 seconds. He then became responsive and was able to respond to prompts and questions. He was given water. an ice pack (for injured spot on forehead), and told to wait for 30 minutes for further observation. He arranged to have a friend pick him up to take him home from the pharmacy and was told that he could not drive himself home after this adverse reaction. The patient stated that he otherwise felt normal afterwards (aside from some ache from the forehead after falling).

Patient presented for his first dose of Pfizer Covid vaccine. Immediately after administering shot, patient lost consciousness, fell to the floor, and hit his head. Loss of consciousness lasted approximately 3-5 seconds. Upon waking, patient was alert and oriented x4. Vitals upon waking: BP 75/35, P: 62, O2 Sat: 90%. Water was administered orally. Patient c/o neckache 6/10 and headache immediately upon waking. Vitals continued to be monitored frequently and BP continued to be 80's/40's. Blood sugar 76. EMS called and arrived. Patient's blood pressure increased to 130/80 for approximately 10 minutes and then dropped again to 78/45. Patient taken to local hospital for further evaluation accompanied by parents.

Pt stated that he still felt same symptoms with no improvement. Pt was given epinepherine auto-injector for adults. BP taken at 1014 bp 175/82. stated that he was feeling a little better but still felt jittery, light headed and dizzy still. ems arrived at the scene at 1031 and took over. pt BP on right arm was 138/100. left arm was 135/83. ems asked pt if he wanted to go to hospital. pt stated no. pt determined that pt was stable and did not needed to go to hospital.

Patient is a 19 year old male admitted to emergency services 06/21/2021 for syncope 2 weeks ago and near syncope today. The patient's syncopal episode 2 weeks ago was after a physical fitness test and he stated that he felt everything going black and then fainted. The patient had also felt short of breath and had chest pain that day. Today the patient was participating in a run and had to keep falling out due to feeling like he was going to faint and had DOE/CP again. Upon having rest and coming to the ED the patient no longer had SOB or CP. However; he had positive Troponins. The patient denies any viral illness preceding his first event and denies tick, mosquito bites, new sexual partners or traveling anywhere. However; the patient did have his 2nd COVID-19 3 days prior to his first event. denies alcohol, tobacco or drug use

Headache; Fatigue; Dizziness; This is a spontaneous report received from a contactable consumer, the parent. A 19-year-old male patient received the first dose of BNT162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE; Lot no: EP6955), via an unspecified route of administration in the left arm on 20Mar2021 at 11:30 (at the age of 19-years-old), as a single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included autism spectrum disorder (Asperger's Syndrome). The patient did not have any allergies to medications, food, or other products. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within four weeks prior to the vaccination. The patient did not receive any other medications within 2 weeks of vaccination. On 21Mar2021 at 00:00, the patient experienced fatigue, dizziness and headache. The patient did not receive any treatment for the adverse events. The adverse event did not result in a visit to the doctors or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit, and emergency room/department or urgent care. The clinical outcome of the events fatigue, dizziness and headache were recovered on 21Mar2021. No follow-up attempts are needed. No further information is expected.
