Patient is completely at baseline at this time answering questions appropriately, however he still complains of having dizziness with sitting up or standing. Patient is answering all questions appropriately. He denies any numbness or tingling. He states he generally feels slightly weak but there is no focal weakness. 20 2021-04-06 dizziness Patient received vaccine around 1255 pm on 3/31. Upon standing after waiting the recommended 15 min... Read more
Close
Patient received vaccine around 1255 pm on 3/31. Upon standing after waiting the recommended 15 minute observation period, patient became dizzy, lightheaded. Patient's symptoms proceeded leading to brief loss of consciousness and pallor consistent with syncope. Patient was gently aided to the floor at 110pm. The patient's mother was present and accompanied the patient. Patient was given general supportive care from pharmacy and team members consisting of feet elevation water, and head support. At no point did the patient nor his mother request for emergency services to be contacted. A witness had EMS on the phone during supportive care. Before being able to inform EMS not to dispatch, they had arrived around 115pm. EMS took over care upon arrival. Blood pressure reading per EMS was 102/56. Patient was transported to hospital at 1325.

Close
Dizziness upon standing and walking, nausea, clamy and warm skin, sweaty, pale, tunnel vision, loss of acute memory, vision, and hearing. Patient was watched from 3pm (right after dose) to 3:30pm. 20 2021-04-07 fall Dose received at 6:05PM. Patient was seated in waiting area and around 6:10PM a loud noise was made ... Read more
Close
Dose received at 6:05PM. Patient was seated in waiting area and around 6:10PM a loud noise was made due to metal chairs moving in the waiting area; upon turning around patient was face down on the floor with his head turned to one side. I ran to offer assistance and cushioned his head with my hands. EMS was dispatched immediately. Patient was already starting to come to after losing consciousness for approximately 10-15 seconds, looked confused for about 15 seconds and then seemed to return to a normal mental state immediately after. He was able to give his name and info and knew exactly where he was, etc. and he stated he felt much better. He was able to confirm he hit the side of his head on the floor, however it was not bleeding. I asked if he wanted me to call anyone for him but refused the offer. His blood pressure was taken at 6:15PM by us then again when EMS arrived at approximately 6:20PM and was 140/100. He was checked out by EMS, including a blood glucose reading of 81 and seemed to be okay. They offered to take him via ambulance to the hospital, especially given him hitting his head, but he refused the offer. He explained a similar incident occurred when he received IV contrast dye in the past. He was able to sit up and then stand up without any issues. He continued to wait in the waiting area for about 10 more minutes before leaving to ensure he felt back to normal. I followed up with him at 8:20PM via telephone and he stated he was feeling normal and had no questions/concerns. I assured him he could reach back out to me personally or the store here if he had any questions/concerns in the future.

Close
20 y/o Male received Pfizer vaccine 1 dose at 1:45pm, while in the recovery area, @ 1:55 when standing to exit as his 15 minute wait period had completed, c/o dizziness, was assisted back to the chair by the recovery nurse, stated, "I don't feel right", noted to have a staring gaze, speech slow but responsive, diaphoretic, initial vitals 1:56: 109/87, 89,20, stat 99% on RA, skin color pale. Repeat vitals @ 1:58 : 122/80, 104, stats 94, awake, very slow responsively, continued w/staring gaze, 911 called. Arrived at 14:03, Engine #2 arrived, patient evaluated, vitals stable @ 116/79, HR 75-78, Resp: 16-20, BG 136, EKG WNL, AAOX4, Patient declined transportation to ED, AMR cancelled, remained in recovery for add'l 15 minutes for ongoing monitoring, DC vitals @ 2:19pm: 11/78, 68, sats 97% on RA, exited from recovery w/Father, stable, ambulating freely, in no further acute distress.

Close
Pt reported dizziness and shakiness after IM injection. Diaphoretic with (+) LOC, no head injury. Pt was found responsive laying down on floor, BLEs assisted onto chair. VS laying down 134/80, HR 90, sats 97% on RA. Water and snacks given, cold compress applied to forehead. Pt was then assisted to seated position on floor, VS sitting as follows: BP 138/66, HR 97, sats 98% on RA. Pt recovered within 15 mins, ambulated out of clinic in NAD and was escorted by staff to car, was driven home by friend.

Close
After IM injection pt became pale, diaphoretic and reported feeling dizzy. Pt was assisted from chair to floor to lay down and during transfer had positive LOC which resolved in less than 5 seconds. BLEs were elevated on a chair and VS were as follows: BP 86/55, HR 80. Pt was given water, snacks and cold compress was applied to forehead. After 5 mins pt was assisted to seated position and VS were as follows: BP 107/75, HR 85. Pt recovered within 10 mins and ambulated out of clinic in NAD. Was escorted to car by staff and was driven home by a friend.

20 2021-04-19 fall Patient was given dose 1 of the vaccine and instructed to wait at least 15 minutes in the chairs in ... Read more
Close
Patient was given dose 1 of the vaccine and instructed to wait at least 15 minutes in the chairs in front of the RPH for observation. He waived at us and sat down. We asked if he was ok and he waived again stating he didn't feel well. He sat back down and we proceeded to check on him. As we were coming to check on him, he fainted and fell face forward on to the floor. We called 911 and rolled him gently to his back. He had a laceration above his eye from the fall. EMT came and assessed the patient. After observation, he was allowed to be picked up from his friend and taken to a clinic for stitches.

20 2021-04-27 gait disturbance had absence seizure within 5 hours of vaccination, the next day he started to have more myoclonic tw... Read more
Close
had absence seizure within 5 hours of vaccination, the next day he started to have more myoclonic twitches. On April 27th morning he started having severe involuntary head shaking like "no" severe along with arms flailing causing shoulder dislocations, with arms flailing also accidentally punched own nose. The head shaking lasted all day through bed time despite normal doses of clonazepam 1mg given. At 1:15 a.m. had a tonic clonic seizure which was different than his "usual" ones. This morning he just woke up at 0715 and has started with the head/shoulder twitches. Yesterday his gait was much more unsteady than usual as well. Our entire family had the vaccine same day and we all only had mild side effects, brother and sister also have complex medical. Thank you for all you do.
20 2021-04-29 dizziness, fall Patient experienced syncope/fainting episode approx 15 mins after vaccination. Patient stood from ch... Read more
Close
Patient experienced syncope/fainting episode approx 15 mins after vaccination. Patient stood from chair and complained of nausea, asked for water. Legs buckled, patient fell to knees. Did not fall all the way to floor or experience head/body trauma. Patient was attended to by supervising pharmacist, and subsequently moved into chair with assistance. Pulse and respirations were normal, but patient was pale, diaphoretic, and complained of nausea and dizziness for another 15-20 minutes. No epinephrine or diphenhydramine was indicated or administered. Patient was observed until approximately 8:30pm, at which time he had made a full recovery. Patient left under his own power, and safely travelled to his home. Pharmacist called to check on patient and spoke with him twice (4/29, 9:50pm...4/30, 4:30pm). Patient reports feeling fine, no residual effects. Is eager to receive his second dose on 5/20/21.

20 2021-05-04 fall loss of conscientiousness; patient as he was falling; This is a spontaneous report from a contactabl... Read more
Close
loss of conscientiousness; patient as he was falling; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable other health professional (HCP). A 20-year-old male patient received bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE), dose 1 intramuscular, administered in Arm Left on 15Apr2021 (Batch/Lot Number: EW0164) as single dose for COVID-19 immunization. The patient medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. On 15Apr2021, the patient was brought to emergency department (ED) immediately after vaccination. The patient had two minutes of loss of conscientiousness. As per his father who caught the patient as he was falling. The patient did not hit his head and the patient was stable. The patient did not receive treatment for the events. The outcome of the events was recovered on an unspecified date. It was unknown if the patient had COVID prior to vaccination and was unknown if tested for COVID post vaccination.; Sender's Comments: Based on the information currently available, a possible contribution of the suspect drug administration to the reported event cannot be excluded, due to a plausible temporal relationship. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to Regulatory Authorities, Ethics Committees and Investigators, as appropriate.

Close
weakness under his shoulder; pain under his shoulder; Parson Turner Syndrome (neuritis); Parson Turner Syndrome (neuritis); experience arm pain; difficulty moving his arm; This is a spontaneous report received from a contactable physician. The physician reported similar events for two patients, this is the first of two reports. A 20-year-old male patient received bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE), dose 2 via an unspecified route of administration at 20 years old on 17Apr2021 (Batch/Lot number was not reported) at single dose for covid-19 immunization. The patient's medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. The patient previously received the first dose of bnt162b2 on an unspecified date for covid-19 immunization. Caller reported that he had a patient who received his Pfizer vaccine, second dose last Saturday (17Apr2021). He reported that on Monday (19Apr2021) he continued to experience arm pain followed by difficulty moving his arm. Now he was requiring a sling, had been prescribed Toradol and Steroids but was not doing any better. He was having continued weakness and pain under his shoulder. Caller was asking for documentation or studies that have been done to determine if the vaccine has any relationship with Parson Turner Syndrome (neuritis) and recommendations for management. He asked to speak with a Pfizer Neurologist. Caller reported that the patient was being seen by an orthopedist, MD. Caller was requesting urgent escalation of his inquiry for further investigation into a relationship between the covid vaccine and Parson Turner Syndrome (neuritis). The outcome of the events was unknown. No Follow-up attempts are needed. Information about lot/batch number cannot be obtained.; Sender's Comments: Linked Report(s) : US-PFIZER INC-2021441207 Same reporter/drug/AE, different patient

20 2021-05-14 fall, dizziness pt had been give the immunization and asked to wait in the waiting area, about 5 minutes later his s... Read more
Close
pt had been give the immunization and asked to wait in the waiting area, about 5 minutes later his sister yelled that they needed help. he had said he felt faint and then passed out falling to the side and out of the chair, she states that she saw him "seize" when he hit the ground, but stated that he did not hit his head. When I came upon him his eyes were open and he was able to answer questions. he stated that he did not have any problems breathing, but felt dizzy. He was very clammy so we took his bp and it was 142/65 pulse 64, gave him an ice pack and had him stay laying down. He sat up after awhile and took a few sips of water but started to feel light headed again so we had him lay back down. His bp went down to 105/58 pulse 61, but then came back up to 136/81 pulse 75 as he was starting to feel better. He started to get more color in his face and feel less clammy so I stayed sitting up. We put him in a chair eventually and the EMTs arrived shortly later. They did and evaluation, but as they were talking about whether or not to take him to the hospital he passed out again. The EMTs said he was probably having some anxiety to needles. He then said that he had passed out giving blood once. They took him to the hospital for further evaluation.

20 2021-05-16 dizziness Approximately three to four minutes after the second dose, he reported feeling dizzy. A few seconds ... Read more
Close
Approximately three to four minutes after the second dose, he reported feeling dizzy. A few seconds later he lost consciousness with eyes rolled to the back of his head. He was unresponsive to verbal communication or attempts to shake him awake. He then began grunting and struggling for breath. His body began to shake/convulse and he lost control of his bladder. This lasted about five to ten seconds. He regained consciousness and reported that he felt as if he was "dreaming". He also reported feeling very hot, and had sweat dripping down his face. Paramedics were called to the scene where his vital signs were checked. All signs including temperature were normal. His first dose on /26/21 had an almost exact reaction, minus losing control of bladder, although that time nobody was around to assist him.

20 2021-05-26 dizziness ~10 seconds after administering the shot into the left deltoid, patient's eyes started to roll back,... Read more
Close
~10 seconds after administering the shot into the left deltoid, patient's eyes started to roll back, became unresponsive, and started falling back in the chair. This lasted for ~15 seconds. After this, the patient immediately regained consciousness, had no issues breathing, and was able to talk. Patient reported light-headed. 911 was called immediately upon reaction, first responders came in and took patient's BP and glucose. Glucose 91 mg/dL, BP was low (forget exact value), but returned to normal (~117/80) after about 10 minutes. Patient seemed fully conscious and aware, opted to not go to the hospital and signed a declination form of transport. First responders deemed that the patient was aware and did not necessarily need transport to the ER. Patient requested a ride home from friend/family member and is going home to rest.

The patient received his COVID vaccine and about 5 minutes later reported feeling funny. The patient was nervous before getting the vaccine. After the immunization, the patient felt he needed to lay down on the floor. We had the patient lay on the floor and elevated his legs. I also took the patient's blood pressure which was 90/60, the patient stated his blood pressure always ran a bit low. We also gave the patient an ice pack. 10 minutes later the patient said he was feeling better and got back into his chair. 20 2021-06-02 vertigo, dizziness symptoms got worse and are just kind of staying the same now; throwing up; Vertigo; Dizziness; Nause... Read more
Close
symptoms got worse and are just kind of staying the same now; throwing up; Vertigo; Dizziness; Nausea; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer. A 20-year-old male patient received bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Formulation: Solution for injection, Lot Number: EW0175), via intramuscular, administered in arm left (shoulder) on 24May2021 at 16:00 (at the age of 20-years-old) as 2nd dose, single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included seasonal allergy. Family medical history included "his mom has Meniere's disease, it comes in rare spurts". Concomitant medication included fluticasone propionate (FLONASE [FLUTICASONE PROPIONATE]) 2 sprays per nostril daily in the morning and cetirizine hydrochloride (ZYRTEC [CETIRIZINE HYDROCHLORIDE]) 1 tablet by mouth every morning, both started on an unspecified date (been using them since he was like 12 years old), ongoing, taken for seasonal allergy. The patient previously received first dose of bnt162b2 (Lot Number: EW0176, Expiry date: unknown), administered in left shoulder on 03May2021 at about 16:00 for COVID-19 immunization and experienced soreness. The patient did not receive any additional vaccines on same date of the Pfizer suspect. The patient reported that he was having really bad side effects. He clarified that he had bad vertigo such that he could not do anything, but lay in the bed without getting dizzy. The dizziness was so bad that if he ate sitting up, he got nauseous and threw it all up. He reported that his symptoms all came on together. On 25May2021, after he ate, he felt like he could throw up but did not. On 26May2021, the patient ended up throwing up his dinner. He took Tylenol because it was recommended on 25May2021 and 26May2021. On 27May2021, his symptoms got worse and were just kind of staying the same. The nausea was if he moved his head around for a while like when walking, sitting up straight, or moving around for a while. Laying down was the only thing that did not make him feel sick. On the same day, he went to the emergency room and they diagnosed him with vertigo, but they did not know what was wrong. They prescribed him Meclizine for the dizziness. He was taking 1 tablet 3 times a day by mouth. The events dizziness and vertigo resulted in emergency room but not visited physician office. The patient did not undergo any relevant tests. The outcome of all the events was not recovered.

Nausea; headache; dizzy; warm hand; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable Nurse. This Nurse reported for a 20-year-old male patient. A 20-years-old male patient received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE; Solution for injection, Lot number: EN6201 and expiration dates were not reported), via intramuscular route of administration on 11Feb2021as first dose, single for COVID-19 immunisation. The patient medical history included known allergies from risperidone. Concomitant medication included citalopram. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. It was unknown if the patient was diagnosed with COVID-19 prior to vaccination. It was unknown if the patient was tested for covid post vaccination. On 11Feb2021 the patient experienced nausea, headache, dizzy and warm hand. Adverse Event treatment included juice and observation. Therapeutic measures were taken as a result of nausea, headache, dizzy and warm hand. The outcome of the events was resolved. No follow-up attempts are possible. No further information is expected.

PATIENTS STATED FEAR OF NEEDLES BEFORE RECIEVING THE VACCINE. AFTER RECIEVING THE VACCINATION, ABOUT 2 MIN LATER PT FELL FROM HIS CHAIR IN THE WAITING AREA AND WAS FEELING VERY LIGHT-HEADED, SWEATING PROFUSELY, WAS FEELING HOT AND WAS PALE. PHARMACY STAFF PROVIDED PT WITH WATER AND COLD ICE PACK TO HELP WITH THE SWEATING. PT ALSO DRANK 2 GLASSES OF ORANGE JUICE AND AFTER 10 MINUTES BEGAN TO FEEL BETTER. AFTER 20 MINUTES, PT'S FATHER CAME AND DROVE HIM BACK HOME.

20 2021-06-10 mobility decreased, dizziness Please see housestaff note for full details. In brief, 20-year-old neurologically normal man with hi... Read more
Close
Please see housestaff note for full details. In brief, 20-year-old neurologically normal man with history of asthma now presenting with new onset fever, headache and then status epilepticus. On 5/25 the patient received his second dose of COVID vaccine and then started to have intermittent fevers up to 102.5. This was associated with malaise, nausea, fever, headache, myalgias. He came to ED on 5/30 and had IVF, analgesics and a cardiac workup that was unremarkable and was discharged with diagnosis of possible pericarditis/myocarditis. He then had ongoing worsening headaches and increasing fevers and was unable to get out of his bed, and so his wife called 911 and he came to ED on 6/3. There he had vomiting and transaminitis and was diagnosed with gastroenteritis treated with flagyl. Headaches progressed and were associated with dizziness; he had HCT read as unremarkable but then while awaiting MRI had convulsion. He was returned to his room and had two more and thus was intubated, placed on propofol/versed, Keppra, dilantin, and broad-spectrum antibiotics and acyclovir before transfer to UCSF. on 6/5/2021 found to have reduced urine output, and serum creatinine found to be 1.72 and climbed >7 in days later normalized spontaneously with fluid support to 4.26 with continued improvement. LFTs were also found to be elevated. Was acutely encephalopathic. Seizures resolved on Keppra treatment though had acute agitation for several days. Slowly returning to neurologic baseline. with AKI and LFTs slowly normalizing.

Close
Patient got his vaccine and was instructed to sit in the waiting/observation area for 15 minutes. At approximately 3:10pm, I heard a loud bang and peeked my head out of the pharmacy and saw that there was a young man on the floor. He fell into the endcap. I immediately ran out to the customer. Upon talking to him, he did not pass out or hit his head but did severely scratch the left side of his cheek to his neck above is collar bone. I checked his blood pressure and it was 119/79. He initially said he felt very hot and was sweaty, then we gave the patient orange juice as he stated he hadn't had much to eat, and felt better after drinking the juice. He denied EMS and called his grandmother to come pick him up.

Close
After 5 mins of receiving 1 st Pfizer covid vaccine at 10:55am, pt felt nauseous and dizzy. Pharmacist on duty instructed the patient to lay down facing up and started taking his blood pressure every 3 mins while giving the patient the electrolyte Vitamin drink( similar to Gatorade). His blood pressure and pulse readings were 100/60 (60), 93/51 (54), 104/62(68); 101/68(62), 108/79(67),109/79(67). So his blood pressure and pusle went down for 1 reading then it went back to his normal reading of 109/79 within 10 mins. After laying down for 15 mins and drinking vitamin drink, pt felt better as his nausea/dizziness went away. He felt okay and left the pharmacy at 11:30am. Pt reported no reactions to any vaccines before. His girlfriend called the dad to report the incident and the dad told her that his twin brother experienced the same reaction earlier today when receiving his covid vaccine at another site. His brother felt fine after 30 mins monitoring

21 2021-04-05 dizziness Felt anxious about the shot and got it at 10:48, started feeling dizzy at around 10:55 during the 10... Read more
Close
Felt anxious about the shot and got it at 10:48, started feeling dizzy at around 10:55 during the 10 minute waiting period, then started to black out and I immediately told the nurse who's quick actions prevented me from fully fainting (laying me down and giving me food/water and elevating my legs). Blood pressure was fine she said along with O2 levels. Left around 11:25 after I felt able to. We both think this was likely related to the anxiety about getting the shot itself (I have anxiety in general so it was not paired with a mistrust or anything about the vaccine) and began fainting 7 minutes after getting the vaccine. I was anxious about any possible symptoms and needles/shots/blood draws make me feel uneasy. However, this issue was not present with the first shot.
21 2021-04-06 dizziness, vertigo First dose: Dec 16 Symptoms spanning 36 hours after injection as well as occasional joint pain in le... Read more
Close
First dose: Dec 16 Symptoms spanning 36 hours after injection as well as occasional joint pain in left elbow, wrist and knuckles. 36hr symptoms included: Fever, fatigue, muscle and joint pain in legs and arms, chills. 2nd dose, jan 6: Symptoms spanning ~60 hours (two days following vaccination + day of vaccination)Symptoms included: headache, low grade fever, muscle and joint pain in legs and both arms, chills. Symptoms almost completely resolved after that period, occasionally had some very mild joint pain still.*Note after both doses, pain in left arm was more severe than right arm* Starting the night of Jan 22 (fri) started having light leg pain, which carried into the 22nd. Dismissed it as too much walking the next day.Jan 24: leg pain a bit more severe, from a 1-2 to a 2-3. Included joint pain in left knee and ankle. Jan 25: pain in both legs at a 3-4, also mild pain in left arm (1-2) as well as joint pain. Jan 26: pain in left arm more severe, leg pain similar in severe. Very mild pain in right arm starting that evening, though only in upper arm. No joint pain in right arm Jan 27: pain in left arm similar in severity, slight increase in right arm pain, would rate 2-3 in right arm, 3-4 in left arm, 3-4 in legs. Muscle weakness in legs (legs shaking when walking down stairs for example) Jan 28 (Thurs):Symptoms started fading. Arm pain lowered in severity in both arms, as did leg pain. By Saturday all that remained was mild leg pain (1-2 in severity)Since then, leg pain has persisted. Week of Feb 14, leg pain increased in severity back to a 3-4. Visited the doctor on the 17th and had blood-work done on the 23rd after severity didn't decrease. Blood-work was normal other than slightly elevated lymphocyte % (50.8%)Visited a specialty medicine doctor on 2/25 and had x-rays done of legs. Results normal. Thought to have developed Achilles tendinitis. Possibly attributed to inflammation in legs, doctor wasn't sure. Rough quote "could it be from the vaccine, possibly, we just don't know." Have been doing stretches since which has helped the leg pain. Starting on March 12, I began to have pain in my left arm again, and ended up getting vertigo that evening. The arm pain persisted on and off from then on out, as well as occasional dizziness, which I treated with Dramamine. I did get an appointment scheduled with a neurologist in May that I still have. On March 25, I began to feel unwell, with a fever, dizziness, and a headache. That worsened into the evening, and I woke up at around 3 am with a high fever, that ended up going to about 103 F, and began vomiting around 4:30am on Friday, which persisted into the evening. On Saturday evening I began to feel better. With that recovery, the constant leg pain and frequent arm pain seemed to be gone, and has yet to return to the degree that it had been prior to that bout of sickness. I do still occasionally get arm or leg pain, but it's minor and only lasts about 20-30 minutes at a time.

Close
Patient stood up a few minutes after receiving the vaccination and fell over. Patient got back up with assistance from pharmacist on duty and was advised to sit with head down for a few minutes. Pharmacy personnel called EMS to be safe. Patient recovered and started drinking some water given to him with no concerns. EMS walked out with patient after his 15 minute observation period was up, but he seemed stable at that time.

Close
Vaccine administrator (mother) was well aware of patient's vaso-vagel response. Patient sat in chair, Pfizer #1 vaccine given in LD. 5 minutes later patient stated he was about to pass out. Patient then passed out. Patient laid on the ground with 3 RN's assisting. Feet were elevated, cool cloth to forehead, and remained on the floor for 10 minutes. Recovered in the chair for 30 minutes of observation.

Close
Patient given Pfizer vaccine at 4:34 pm, several minutes later approximately 4:40 pm this provider was alerted by other staff member to report to waiting room where patient was waiting post-vaccination. Patient was being supported by other staff member and mother against the wall due to him not being able to support himself. Patient was semi-conscious but responsive at this time. With the help of this provider, mother and other staff member, patient was gently lowered to floor and laid in supine position, head was supported and assisted with elevating his legs. Shortly after patient responded that he was feeling much better then attempted to try and sit up but started to feel lightheaded and was then assisted with laying back in supine position. Patient's pulse and blood pressure was checked. At 4:45pm pulse was at 38 BPM and then at 4:47 pm 55 BPM and blood pressure at 90/60. This provider then alerted other staff member to call EMS due to abnormal vital signs. EMS did arrive shortly after and then patient was assessed per EMS. Patient was stabilized and elected to not go to hospital. Patient left with mother to go home at approximately 5:01 pm.

Close
Patient received second Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine at 1:55pm. Patient was told to stay in store for 15 minutes. Patient then reported feeling nausous and headed to the bathroom around 2:00pm. Patient reports passing out in the bathroom stall around 2:02pm. Pharmacist was notified by the patient of the incident at 2:04pm. Patient reports hitting his head. EMS was called via pharmacy clerk. Pharmacist took patient's blood pressure (148/62) and pulse (68) at 2:07pm. Patient reports to pharmacist that he had not eaten anything yet for the day and does have a fear of needles as well as history of passing out when getting blood drawn. Pharmacist provided a bottle of water and a plain chocolate bar for the patient to consume while waiting for EMS to arrive. EMS checked over patient since he complained of pain at the base of skull as a result from fall in the bathroom. EMS checked blood pressure (138/74) and blood sugar (78) at 2:18pm. EMS cleared the patient but did education the patient to report any signs or symptoms of concussion. Patient was then escorted home via his girl friend.

21 2021-04-12 dizziness Patient said he felt light-headed after his shot. He was advised to continue sitting in the vaccine ... Read more
Close
Patient said he felt light-headed after his shot. He was advised to continue sitting in the vaccine area. Since he was feeling light-headed, the immunizing pharmacist told me to get the blood pressure cuff. When I got back, the patient passed out. The pharmacist and I moved the chair from underneath him and he gently put him on the floor. He quickly woke up and the pharmacist began to ask him questions such as his name and where he was to make sure he was ok. He was able to answer those questions fine and we placed him in a chair so he can rest. When he was in the chair, he began to pass out again. He quickly woke up again but wasn't feeling good. The pharmacist checked his blood pressure and it was low. His temperature was at 93F. The pharmacist continued to stay with him and he made sure that someone else was able to come and pick him up. Once he felt ok, he had the patient go sit in the post-vaccination waiting area until he had his ride pick him up.

Patient was in the health COVID 19 clinic for his 1st dose Pfizer vaccine. Vaccine was administered and patient was sent to the observation area for a 15 minute wait. Upon arrival to the observation area he sat down in a chair and states that he " begin to feel dizzy and then blacked out". Patient was found on the floor by observation nursing staff. He was alert and oriented x4 and vitals were with in normal range. Vitals were as followed: BP 118/74, Heart rate: 79 and regular, 02 98 on room air. Patient was assisted to the emergency pod and he stated that "this happens all the time with needles, and plus I haven't had anything to eat this morning." Gave the patient crackers and a coke monitored for 35 Minutes.

21 2021-04-19 fall Patient received the COVID vaccine (Pfizer dose 1, lot #EW0171, expiration date 8/2021) in his left ... Read more
Close
Patient received the COVID vaccine (Pfizer dose 1, lot #EW0171, expiration date 8/2021) in his left deltoid at 1437. The client was observed to fall out of his chair in the observation area, fall to the ground, and hit his head. The client made no attempt to protect his head or break his fall. RN, PHN, RN, and RN responded at 1438. PHN called EMS at that time as well. The client was observed to jerk his arms twice. The client was unconscious for approximately 90 seconds, and was turned on his side at this time. When the client regained consciousness, he was alert and oriented, complained of no pain in his head or any dizziness or lightheadedness. No difficulty breathing. Pupils were equal and reactive to light. At 1439, the vital signs obtained were: blood pressure 130/90, heart rate 57, O2 98, respiratory rate 26. The client denied any history of seizures, epilepsy, or any other medical history. The client stated he has no allergies and that he takes no medications. Upon examination, there were no cuts observable on the client's head. The client denied any feelings of dizziness before his loss of consciousness but stated he did not eat any breakfast or lunch that day. At 1443, the repeat vitals were as follows: 128/94 blood pressure, heart rate 60, respiratory rate 22, temperature 98. A manual pulse was 88 and thready. At 1447, EMR responded to the scene and assumed care of the client. Client transported to hospital.

21 2021-04-29 dizziness started with soreness/stiffness in injection site, which I expected as it was how I reacted with the... Read more
Close
started with soreness/stiffness in injection site, which I expected as it was how I reacted with the first shot. however, I then started experiencing mild dizziness/visual impairment (feeling like my vision was shifting or "glitching") that started around two hours after the shot, slow onset of sore/achy back muscles that hit peak pain at around 3am, and intense chills/shivers that started around 11pm, getting progressively worse as the night went on. Attempted to stop the chills by wrapping in several blankets, but only continued to feel colder and colder. Despite the chills starting around 11pm, fever did not present itself until around 1am, hitting 99.8°F by 1:30am. It was around this time that I took an ibuprofen and acetaminophen, which did not kick in until around 2:30am. Once the chills stopped, my hands and feet only got hotter, keeping me awake for an additional 2 1/2 hours.

21 2021-05-09 balance disorder, dizziness 21yoM states that on 25 March 2021, he noted 25 minutes after his 1st dose of Pfizer vaccines, he no... Read more
Close
21yoM states that on 25 March 2021, he noted 25 minutes after his 1st dose of Pfizer vaccines, he noted a throat tightness, feels tight, scratchy, noted a hoarse throat with some voice changes. He felt throat tightness made it hard to breath, he had associated lightheadedness, felt anxious, almost like a wheezing sound when breathed in and out in his upper neck. When he stood up, he did feel like he needed to hold onto something to steady himself, had some tunnel vision, improved with sitting down and closing his yes and taking deep breaths. He felt warm at the time, not cold or clammy. His friend said he looked ghostly white, no flushing, no hives, no angioedema. No sense of impending doom. He did take Zyrtec the day that he received the vaccine. He waited the 15 minutes after vaccine without symptoms, and had walked back to class by the time it started. Between the vaccine and symptoms onset, he denies eating anything, being stung by anything. He told a friend about his symptoms, and he returned to the hospital via base taxi arrived at ER. Symptoms were still occurring about 60 minutes after vaccination when he arrived at the ER. In the ER, he underwent exam, was given oral Benadryl. His symptoms of scratchy throat lasted for 2 days afterwards with some associated fatigue, post-nasal drip. He denies other symptoms. No fevers or chills. Small amount of pain and a ?knot? at the injection site the next day, but minimal according to the paitent. Denies hives, angioedema, SOB, wheezing, nausea/vomiting, no diarrhea, abdominal pain, nasal pruritus/congestion, ocuarl itching/redness, no syncope. No h/o vaccine reactions before. No h/o passing out before at all, specifically not to needles, blood draws, or vaccines before. No h/o venom or drug allergy. He does report a history of apple allergic reaction 1 year previous when eating a raw apple, felt his throat close within 15-30 minutes, no hives or other systemic symptoms. He took oral Benadryl and went to ER. He was given oral Benadryl, no Epipen. He followed up with his PCM regarding possible apple allergy and was told to avoid apples, but was never tested for apple allergy. Since then, when he drinks apple juice, his throat will start hurting, but otherwise, he has avoided raw and cooked allergies. He does report seasonal rhinitis symptoms that are worse in the fall. He takes allegra as needed to treat these symptoms. He is not carrying an Epipen currently

Initial vitals: 100/55, 97,98% O2. Second set of vitals @05:05pm: 111/51, 73, 20, 98%. Reassessment @ 5:15pm: calm, breathing at 18 breaths per min. Remained for further observation sitting upright in chair for additional 15 minutes. Discharge set of vitals @ 5:36pm: 120/72, 16, 60 99%. Departed clinic on his own accord.

Pt mentioned prior history of fainting after IVs. Seemed apprehensive to receive vaccine but did want to receive it. Before being able to apply bandaid to injection site, pt wiped their arm (x2) and had blood on hand. Seemed uncomfortable with sight of blood. Pt was asked to take a seat and wait for 25-30 minutes to be monitored since having prior history of loss of consciousness. Was able to answer questions about his name/DOB/current date. Pt was immediately responsive and alert. 911 was called. Pt refused medical care other than cold compress and water. After Pfizer vaccination patient was being observed for 15 minutes for adverse reaction. Patient passed out and fell face first to the floor. Patients nose was bleeding. A rapid response was called. Patient was placed in a wheelchair and taken to the ER.Patient normal vitals on presentation. Not acutely toxic appearing. Exam with mild ecchymoses along the left maxilla and along the left neck concerning for possible head injury. EKG shows sinus bradycardia. Head CT shows no evidence of acute intracranial hemorrhage. It does note a posterior left orbital floor fracture with blood in the left maxillary sinus. He has no evidence of visual acuity changes or visual complaints. No signs of entrapment. Feel he is stable for discharge at this time. I spoke with on-call ophthalmology, doctor. He states that the patient walk-in tomorrow for follow-up.

21 2021-06-19 dizziness Overnight after shot just typical symptoms, some slight chills and next day just a little tired Day ... Read more
Close
Overnight after shot just typical symptoms, some slight chills and next day just a little tired Day 2 after shot, April 11th. Chest pain, squeezing in chest. Unusual but manageable and didn?t feel terrible otherwise,maybe slightly tired. Tried leaning forward to make feel better. Day 3 and 4 chest pain/heart squeezing continued and was bothersome and, went to Urgent Care this day April 13th. EKG was a little abnormal and told to follow up with a cardiologist and take Advil. The heart squeezing feeling continued. Early morning hours April 14th very sick, excessive shaking (no fever), extreme nausea, faint feeling, dry cough (laying on bathroom floor). Not much, if any chest pain at the time. Went to ER. Not much chest pain during ER visit but nauseous and shaking etc. Test were run. Told that the symptoms were a delayed reaction to the vaccine and to follow up with a cardiologist because possible abnormal EKG and to take Advil as needed. Overnight at home, no chest pain but an hour of the shaking and nausea returned but not as bad as before. Over next couple days the chest pain/squeezing, slightly shakes and light headedness would come and go and by 4-16 feeling pretty great. The heart feeling mildly at most in the background but not debilitating. Starting week of April 20th maybe 4-5 flare ups with chest pain and no pattern but not debilitating. Could happen at rest. April 27th bigger flare up more debilitating, had to lie down, heart squeezing pain and maybe some wheezing when breathed in but not tightness in throat. Lasted about 30 minutes. Was just doing schoolwork with friends at the time so not under any physical or emotional stress at the time. After this from April 20 to May 3rd feeling heart symptom mildly but not debilitating and could resume normal active life. Had cardiology appt. May 3rd with nurse practitioner. According to NP the 12 Lead EKG run that day correlated with abnormal EKG from ER. Normal sinus rhythm with sinus arrhythmia Rightward axis Pulmonary disease pattern. Incomplete right bundle branch block Abnormal ECG. Given 4 lead heart monitor to wear for a week. Also ordered a CV CT angiogram coronaries with calcium scoring. The test could not be scheduled through them until July. Also told could go on hiking trip out west and to stop and rest if felt pain. For parents reassurance about hiking trip, had a second opinion over teleconference call with Dr., myocarditis specialist to confirm would be safe on hiking trip. Dr. said he should be good to go. He said these heart symptoms related to the second vaccine could fade over time. Hiking trip May 20th to May 30th. Did fine with exertion and just a few small episodes of the chest pain, light headedness and maybe a little shaking but these were at rest. Also, 4 lead heart monitor report was good. Returned from trip May 30th and no chest pain or symptoms for approximately 3 weeks through June 17th. June 18th went to urgent care for sore throat and ear. Prescribed amoxycillin. Took the amoxycillin and one Advil sinus, that evening had a heart squeezing episode return. This was the first time in almost 3 weeks. Did not take any more Advil sinus in case that caused the episode. Had another slight episode that evening. Hiked next day June 19th and fine. Then felt it slightly again after eating that afternoon of the 19th, also chest did feel a little tight all day. Then felt it again that evening. Still taking Amoxycillin as of today.

21 2021-06-29 dizziness 21 year old male, received 1st dose of Pfizer COVID vaccine (Lot # EW0167 expiration 5/3/21 @ 1450)... Read more
Close
21 year old male, received 1st dose of Pfizer COVID vaccine (Lot # EW0167 expiration 5/3/21 @ 1450) on left deltoid at 1024. Patient sitting at vaccinator table and RN explained risks/benefits of vaccine and received verbal consent from patient to give vaccine. Patient told, RN that he is "scared of needles". RN offered for patient to be vaccinated in the zero gravity chair and patient declined. No past medical history, no allergies, no hx of fainting or seizures. Patient is taking the medication, doxycycline, for face acne. A few seconds after patient received vaccine, he had loss of consciousness, tensed up with a few jerky movements for about 10 seconds. 2 RNs moved patient down to floor and elevated lower extremities. Patient immediately regained consciousness and A&O x4. Patient was diaphoretic. Ice pack placed on back of neck. At 1024, EMS was called by a Ancillary. EMT took vitals and RN recorded vitals at 1026: BP 120/80, HR 56, Sp02 99%. Patient states he is "feeling much better". Patient placed in zero gravity chair. Patient reports he had breakfast (cereal and water) before arriving. Another set of vitals taken at 1031: BP 120/85, HR 60, Sp02 98%. At 1032, EMS arrived and assessed patient. Vital signs were stable. After EMS used lancet to obtain a blood glucose level, patient started feeling "hot" and dizzy again. Patient diaphoretic. At 1040, Vitals by EMS: BP 91/45 on right arm and HR 53 while in zero gravity chair. At 1042, EMS had patient stand up to assess his vitals: BP 89/43 on right arm and HR 57. At 1045, Vitals by EMS: BP 70/33 on right arm and HR 63, taken while standing up. Patient diaphoretic and feeling a little lightheaded. Patient sat back down in zero gravity chair and ice pack placed on back of neck. At 1047, Vitals by EMS: BP 96/56 on right arm and HR 55, taken while in zero gravity chair. Patient left with EMS at 1054 to Hospital. Patient was with his coworker and boss, who was notified of the situation by EMS.

I went to bed shortly after in hopes of sleeping it off (probably 10:45-11). Around 2 am the following morning, I woke up and had a hot flash (could have been a fever but I did not check my temperature). I was able to fall back asleep and felt normal when I woke up at 7:30 am.

He was given snacks and a drink, at 1307 bp was 107/71 HR 93 and he had no complaints of dizziness. Patient was taken to the exit via a wheelchair.

22 2021-03-27 dizziness Within 6 mins of receiving injection, Pt experienced hot flashes, dizzyness, ears ringing. Pt blood ... Read more
Close
Within 6 mins of receiving injection, Pt experienced hot flashes, dizzyness, ears ringing. Pt blood pressure was high at time of initial observation. Pt was clammy & noticeably pale. 12 hours after injection, patient was feverish with a high fever and inability to sleep. Pt had sore arm and chest pain along with fever. Patient experienced such issues until the 16 hour mark post injection. Patient took 2 tylenol at 14 hour post injection. Patient was considering going to emergency room from fear & severity of the fevers but was able to let subside. At 22 hours post injection, patient has sore arm but otherwise is feeling normal. This was only dose 1 for pt.

22 2021-04-05 dizziness Patient received dose 1 of the COVID vaccine (lot EW0150, exp 7/2021) at 1420. At 1425, patient appr... Read more
Close
Patient received dose 1 of the COVID vaccine (lot EW0150, exp 7/2021) at 1420. At 1425, patient approached EMT reporting he felt dizzy, nauseous, sweaty, and anxious. The patient reported having a similar reaction when getting previous injections due to a fear of needles and blood. PHN approached to assist. Vital signs: blood pressure 90/48, O2 97%, pulse 56, respirations 18. Patient denied allergies, medical conditions, or current medications. Patient reported not eating breakfast. At 1427, EMT offered patient water. PHN offered patient Benadryl but patient declined, also advised to contact provider and when to call 911. Patient reported he did not have a medical provider, PHN advised patient to contact 211 for assistance. At 1430, vital signs: blood pressure 102/58, pulse 74, O2 94%, respirations 18. Patient reported symptoms had resolved and he felt back to baseline. At 1445, vital signs: blood pressure 104/52, O2 94%, pulse 71, respirations 18. Patient denied anxiety at this point. At 1455, vital signs: blood pressure 98/58, pulse 74, O2 94%, respirations 16. Patient left walking with steady gait.
22 2021-04-06 dizziness The patient became pale and light headed within minutes of his vaccination. He also reported his vi... Read more
Close
The patient became pale and light headed within minutes of his vaccination. He also reported his vision dimmed. He reported he has a history of this reaction with any injection. We gave him water and took his blood pressure, it was initially 69/58 with a pulse of 46. Five minutes later it was 164/93 with a pulse rate of 41. Five minutes later it was back down to 82/50 with a pulse of 87. Five minutes later he was feeling better, his color and site normalized and his blood pressure was 117/70 with a pulse rate of 69. We let him sit for a while longer and when he was comfortable he got up, walked around, and left.

When arrived to the car, pt was awake and alert and responding appropriately. He stated he feels light headed. EMS called to tent. Pt given bottle of cold water. 22 2021-04-10 dizziness Patient got vaccine, then started experiencing dizziness, sweating, chills, and coldness of hands. ... Read more
Close
Patient got vaccine, then started experiencing dizziness, sweating, chills, and coldness of hands. I went to check in on him at 10:50a at which point he was eating a candy bar and stated he was already feeling better. He stated he has experienced symptoms of low blood sugar before and this was similar to what he had experienced in the past - even though it was worse. He said he was already feeling better, but he wanted to get something else to eat. I told him to stay put till 11a to make sure he wasn't still dizzy. At 11a, he was still feeling better and we went to grab him a pack of barbecue chips. He stayed till 11:20a and was still doing ok and left. I called him at 1:30p and has still doing ok.

Close
Client reported to EMT observer approx. 15 after receiving vaccine that he felt chills. Client was led to zero-gravity chair and stated he felt "light headed." After 5 mins. in chair, client reported light headedness decreased. Denied any prior reaction to vaccines. Was advised to remain for 30 mins. V/S @ 1130: BP 96/58, O2 96, RR 66, AOx3. V/S @ 1138: BP 112/72, HR 65, O2 98, RR 16. V/S @ 1148: BP 114/68, HR 60, O2 99, RR 16. At 11:50am client reported symptoms completely resolved. Client walked away unassisted and with a steady gait. He departed site in his partner's vehicle who drove him home.

Close
Patient was sitting in chair when he started feeling dizzy and noticed his vision was blurry. Patient fell to floor and hit back of head on the floor. Syncopal episode lasted for 5-10 sec. Patient awakened A/Ox3. Vitals obtained with BP 146/96, HR 75, O2 99%. Given water and cold compress to neck and head. Denies feeling bad at time. Vitals obtained again with BP 136/62, HR 68, O2 99%. Kept patient an additional 15 mins. Patient refused ambulance and EMS service. Patient left after sitting 30 mins total. Mentation still A/Ox3.

My arm felt sore for about a day and a half after receiving the vaccine. It was most comparable to the dull pain that I felt 1-2 weeks after breaking my arm. I had limited mobility due to the pain and the area around the vaccine hurt to touch. The pain gradually faded away after the first day and was completely gone by the end of the second day.

22 2021-04-15 fall, dizziness While in observation area, patient said he was feeling a little lightheaded and then fell. Patient s... Read more
Close
While in observation area, patient said he was feeling a little lightheaded and then fell. Patient slightly stabilized his fall by grabbing onto a chair, but still fell on floor, hit his head. Patient was unresponsive for a few seconds as more help arrived, then was asked where he was, what vaccine he got, what his name was, he answered all questions correctly. Blood pressure was taken 3 times with blood pressure cuff pharmacy staff had on hand, readings were 171/76, 166/79, 151/91. EMS arrived took additional blood pressure 141/89, blood glucose 117, performed EKG. EMS said BP, EKG looked good. Patient said he had one time passed out around needles as a kid. Today refused hospital, said he felt okay. He did say his head was a little sore still, EMS said he was looking okay, EMS left. Patient stayed for about a half hour after event, then felt fine and went home.
22 2021-04-15 fall Patient was sitting upright in chair looking down at phone. Had a syncopal episode, fell to floor, h... Read more
Close
Patient was sitting upright in chair looking down at phone. Had a syncopal episode, fell to floor, had seizure activity that lasted 5-10 secs. Patient awakened on his own, confused. Tried to get off of floor. Asked to stay on right side of floor. Vitals obtained. A/Ox2. Patient diaphoretic, pale, with shivering. Abrasions to right side of forehead and right posterior shoulder. BP 89/56, HR 56, O2 99% at 1257. Patient able to go from sitting to standing position to be sat in chair. Father notified of events. Father wanted patient to stay here at site for one hour. Within 5 mins of sitting in chair, patient became diaphoretic and pale again with focal stare. Per patient, "I can't hear or see you at the moment." EMS activated. BP obtained again, 78/52, HR 63, O2 at 99%. EMS arrived and assessed patient. Decided to take to Hospital. Father called and notified. Father will meet son at emergency dept.

Close
Patient received second Pfizer vaccine- no reaction to first vaccine. Patient placed on 30 minute observation for anaphylaxis to pistachio nuts. Received vaccine at 1440. At approximately 1450 patient complained of feeling bad and having a rapid heart rate; placed on pulse oximetry HR 103 (validated with radial pulse of 104/min) and O2 Sat 98%. Patient requested to void; patient stated he felt very anxious. Patient escorted to BR; became lightheaded enroute. Placed supine on sofa; legs elevated; encouraged slow deep breaths; with purse lips. VS- at 1455 = 184/80, 99%, 147 Reg/tachycardic. RR 24/min. Patient continued to feel more lightheaded with warm clammy skin. States his heart rate was worsening. VS at 1500 = 180/90, HR 145, RR 24 with unlabored breathing, o2Sat 98%. Arms tingling, lips pink, skin pale, no circumoral edema; no hives-speech controlled and unlabored. 911 called for further evaluation and clinical support. Patient agreed with plan of care. No LOC throughout event.

22 2021-04-28 joint stiffness severe blurred vision; shortness of breath; shaking; stiffness in his jaws; patient who fainted; Thi... Read more
Close
severe blurred vision; shortness of breath; shaking; stiffness in his jaws; patient who fainted; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable pharmacist. A 22-year-old male patient received the first dose of bnt162b2 (BNT162B2, Solution for injection, Lot number was not reported), via an unspecified route of administration on an unspecified date (received at the age of 22-years-old) as SINGLE DOSE for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history SVT (supraventricular tachycardia) (diagnosed with SVT by his cardiologist, however it was never confirmed), palpitation, and had fainted in two different situations in the past. Concomitant medications were not reported. The patient fainted after the first dose of COVID-19 vaccine as soon as he stood up. He was unconscious for about 5 seconds. He was experiencing severe blurred vision, shortness of breath, shaking and stiffness in his jaws. He was 22 years old, 170 pounds, and 6 feet tall. He has history of palpitation. In the past he was diagnosed with SVT by his cardiologist, however it was never confirmed. In addition, he had fainted in two different situations in the past. Based on what the patient says, his health issues and why he faints was never fully understood by medical doctors. Outcome of the events was unknown. Information about Lot/batch number is requested.; Sender's Comments: A possible contributory effect of suspect BNT162B2 on event syncope cannot be excluded. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to regulatory authorities, Ethics Committees, and Investigators, as appropriate.

Close
Pt was standing at check out when he became dizzy. He was sat in a chair and conversing with the nurse. His eyes rolled back and his head bent forward. Suddenly his head went back and his body was rigid and began to shake violently for approximately 20 seconds. He became conscious but disoriented about 45 secs after episode. EMS intervened and patient was assessed and monitored. Patient refused transport to hospital but said he would contact his physician.

22 2021-04-29 dizziness After client's Phizer immunization he c/o dizziness. Client was asked if he had eaten, he states, "I... Read more
Close
After client's Phizer immunization he c/o dizziness. Client was asked if he had eaten, he states, "I did not". Nurse offered apple juice and water. After drinking the fluids he still c/o dizziness. Skin color pallor and was assisted to the floor and feet elevated. Applied ice pack to of neck. Client taken via w/c to medical tent staff provided more care. Client was placed on cardiac monitor it showed sinus arrhythmia w/ PACs . Both parents at client's side and agreed to have client sent to local hospital via EMS for further evaluation. Mom did report that client has had dizziness after receiving influenza vaccinations but did not report this at time of registration nor to vaccinator prior to receiving his 1st Phizer dose.

22 2021-05-06 dizziness Client complained of "seeing black" numbness in right arm, feeling anxious, and was diaphoretic at 1... Read more
Close
Client complained of "seeing black" numbness in right arm, feeling anxious, and was diaphoretic at 1711. Vital signs were taken at 1715 (Heart rate 70, Oxygen 98, blood pressure was unable to attain). Client stated that he had not eaten anything all day and only drank "a little bit of water many hours ago." Blood pressure taken at 1717 (110/70). Client escorted to zero gravity chair at 1718. Client given water and two cookies. At 1724 client stated that he is feeling better. Blood pressure taken again at 1730 (118/75). Client left unassisted with a steady gate at 1731, and was driven home by his father.

22 2021-05-07 dizziness positive cardiac enzymes; myocarditis; hypotension 3 days post 2nd vaccination who was admitted; lef... Read more
Close
positive cardiac enzymes; myocarditis; hypotension 3 days post 2nd vaccination who was admitted; left-sided chest pain; sob; diaphoresis; dizziness; paresthesia's to his hands; transient fever; chills; headache; body aches; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable physician. A 22-year-old male patient received the second dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE; Lot Number: UNKNOWN) via an unspecified route of administration, in the left arm on 17Apr2021 (Batch/Lot Number: ER8731) (at the age of 22-years-old) as a single dose for COVID-19 immunisation as a single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included scoliosis from an unknown date and unknown if ongoing , depression from an unknown date and unknown if ongoing. There were no concomitant medications. The patient previously received the first dose of BNT162b2 on 22Mar2021ont at 08:45 in intramuscularly in the left arm (Lot Number: ER8727) for COVID-19 immunisation. The patient had not received any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID-19 vaccine. In Apr2021, the patient developed transient fever, chills, headache, and body aches which resolved 24 hours after his 2nd Pfizer vaccine, followed by left-sided chest pain, shortness of breath (SOB), diaphoresis, dizziness, paresthesias to his hands; hypotension 3 days post 2nd vaccination, on 20Apr2021, patient was admitted to hospital with positive cardiac enzymes, initially troponin T baseline at 663, 1 hour follow-up troponin T at 943 with troponin T delta at 42%. A 3-hour troponin T at 1913 with a troponin T3HR delta at 189% and CPK >1000 with the diagnosis of myocarditis. Covid screen was negative, Covid antibody was negative, HIV was negative, drug screen negative and rest of work up for other causes so far negative. On 20Apr2021, he was transferred to another hospital for further cardiac care. Treatments for the events included pressor, cardiac medications, cath, etc. Patient remains hospitalized. In Apr2021, the patient recovered from the events, body aches, headache, chills, transient fever. The patient had not recovered from the events, positive cardiac enzymes, myocarditis, hypotension, left-sided chest pain, SOB, diaphoresis, dizziness, and paresthesias to his hands.; Sender's Comments: A contributory role of BNT162B2 to the reported events cannot be fully excluded based on temporal relationship and lack of alternate explanation at this time. Case will be reassessed if additional information is received. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to regulatory authorities, Ethics Committees, and Investigators, as appropriate.

Vital signs obtained (BP 108/80, HR 80, SPO2 99%). Juice provided. PT education provided by safety officer/RN. PT plans to f/u with primary care. Outcome: PT reported s/s improved after juice. PT medically cleared by EMS, brother to drive PT home.

22 2021-05-10 dizziness Nearly immediately after vaccination, patient began to feel light-headed and to sweat profusely. In ... Read more
Close
Nearly immediately after vaccination, patient began to feel light-headed and to sweat profusely. In three minutes, the symptoms evolved to include trouble breathing and tingling in left and right arms. Patient had his rescue albuterol inhaler on-hand, and took one dose by inhalation. One minute following dose, the difficulty to breathe improved. He remained in store for further observation for 15 additional minutes. Prior to departure, he confirmed that he was able and willing to leave the premises and declined emergency care.

22 2021-05-13 dizziness Pericarditis; cardiac enzymes have continued to go up, not down; myocarditis; ST evaluation on the E... Read more
Close
Pericarditis; cardiac enzymes have continued to go up, not down; myocarditis; ST evaluation on the EKG; Increased troponins and enzymes, troponin levels were elevated; Severe Chest Pain; Chest tightness; Lightheadedness; didn't sleep at all and were uncomfortable all night and had pain; didn't sleep at all and were uncomfortable all night and had pain; feeling really crappy and they thought it was like the flu; feeling really crappy and they thought it was like the flu; Tiredness and Fatigue; Headache; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient's mother). A 22-year-old male patient received second dose BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, formulation Solution for injection, Lot number EW0170 and expiration date not reported) via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Arm Left on 26Apr2021 10:00 as single dose for covid-19 immunization. Medical history included ongoing incredibly rare metabolic disorder. Concomitant medications were not reported. The patient previously took first dose of BNT162B2 on 05Apr2021, lot number: ER8735, administered in left shoulder for covid-19 immunization. The patient experienced tiredness and fatigue and headache on 26Apr2021,severe chest pain, chest tightness, lightheadedness, didn't sleep at all and were uncomfortable all night and had pain, feeling really crappy and they thought it was like the flu on 27Apr2021, pericarditis and Increased troponins and enzymes, troponin levels were elevated on 28Apr2021, cardiac enzymes have continued to go up, not down, ST evaluation on the EKG and myocarditis on an unspecified date. The reporter stated that she has identical twin sons that are 22 years old and they received their second dose on Monday morning, 26APR2021. Reporter states all 5 member of the family have gotten the Pfizer vaccine. Reporter states the twins were hospitalized on Wednesday with myocarditis/pericarditis, inflammation around the heart. Reporter states she knows there have been incidents reported. Reporter states she saw in Israel there were 62 out of unknown amount of people and some members of the military. Reporter states that two identical males with the DNA same, that had the vaccine at the same time, had the reaction at the same length of time, and it would go a long way to help understand the complication. Reporter added, they have the same lifestyle and live at the same house. The reporter stated that they received the vaccine at 10:00a.m. on 26APR2021 and then that evening they were felling pretty tired and fatigued and a little headachy, but nothing anyone worried about because they all had that same reaction. Call states Tuesday morning they were feeling really crappy and they thought it was like the flu and it would pass. Tuesday evening they said they didn't sleep at all and were uncomfortable all night and had pain. Wednesday the pain didn't go away., and the twins had ST evaluation on the EKG that they have. Reporter sated they decided to take one in and said the other twin had the same symptoms but he kept saying his wasn't as bad as his brothers because he didn't want to go to the hospital. Reporter states the doctor advised her to come back home and bring the other one in. Reporter states they had the same echo cardiogram, and their troponin levels were elevated. Caller states their cardiac enzymes have continued to go up, not down. Treatment: States they have them on Ibuprofen and Colchicine, which is the therapy for Pericarditis and they are using Toradol for breakthrough pain and severe chest pain. The seriousness of the event pericarditis was reported as (hospitalization, medically significant), cardiac enzymes have continued to go up, not down, myocarditis and ST evaluation on the EKG reported as medically significant and other events was reported as non-serious. The event pericarditis was resulted in emergency room visit. The outcome of the events pericarditis, cardiac enzymes have continued to go up, not down, severe chest pain, chest tightness, increased troponins and enzymes, troponin levels were elevated, tiredness and fatigue, was reported as not recovered feeling really crappy and they thought it was like the flu was reported as recovered on 27Apr2021, headache and lightheadedness recovered on 28Apr2021 myocarditis, ST evaluation on the EKG, didn't sleep at all and were uncomfortable all night and had pain was reported as unknown. No follow-up attempts are needed. No further information is expected.

22 2021-05-17 dizziness Client received his vaccination successfully without incident. However, as he stood by to observe hi... Read more
Close
Client received his vaccination successfully without incident. However, as he stood by to observe his friend receive his injection, client became dizzy and nauseous. Client walked over to trash can and threw up. Dr. present for assessment client. Client appeared pale and confirmed SOB, denied dizziness and nausea. VS: #1 BP: 83/45, P: 58, O2: 98%; #2 BP: 103/59; #3 BP: 122/86, P: 96. Dr. encouraged client to drink a bottle of water and a bottle of Gatorade. Client was compliant. After-which, client denied SOB, dizziness and nausea. Color returned to his face. Dr. released client to be observed for 15 more minutes under the observation tent. Client denied discomfort, dizziness and nausea at time of departure. Client was stable when he exited the premises.

Close
Having trouble moving arm in any position and trouble turning neck; Intense aches and pains from left shoulder to left scapula to left side of neck.; This is a spontaneous report from a non-contactable consumer. A 22-years-old male patient received first dose of bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, solution for injection, Lot Number: EL3247 and expiration date was not reported), via an unspecified route of administration, administered in left arm on 27Jan2021 at 13:15 as first dose single for COVID-19 immunization. The patient did not have any allergies. The patient had no other vaccine within four weeks. Prior to the vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. Since the vaccination, the patient had not been tested for COVID-19. The patient's medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. On 27Jan2021 at 16:00, the patient experienced having trouble moving arm in any position and trouble turning neck and intense aches and pains from left shoulder to left scapula to left side of neck. The patient received treatment for events with Tylenol 2 tablets. The outcome of the events was not recovered. No follow-up attempts are possible. No further information is expected.

22 2021-05-26 dizziness Client received 1st COVID vaccine of Pfizer (Lot# EW0185 expiration date 05/27/2021). Client reporte... Read more
Close
Client received 1st COVID vaccine of Pfizer (Lot# EW0185 expiration date 05/27/2021). Client reported lightheaded. EMT responded at 1521. RN notified and responded to this event. At 1521, vital signs are blood pressure 120/69, heart rate 69, oxygen saturation 97%. Client reports history of asthma, no current use of any medication, allergies to Keflex. Client reports he ate today and felt "nervous coming today". Client was offered supplemental nutrition and fluids. Client denied nutrition, but accepted fluids. At 1528, vital signs are blood pressure 125/74, heart rate 73, oxygen saturation 97%. Client states "tight throat", no shortness of breath, headache in the occipital area, no nausea, no chest pain. RN offered 50mg of Benadryl by mouth. Client denied. RN educated Client about ED precaution and common adverse effects of COVID vaccine. At 1532, vital signs are blood pressure 125/67, heart rate 71, oxygen saturation 98%. Client reports tightness in the throat is the same. RN offered 50mg of Benadryl by mouth and paramedic services. Client accepted 50mg of Benadryl by mouth, but denied paramedic services. RN advised Client that Benadryl will result in fatigue and drowsiness. Client states his mother is driving him home. At 1534, 50mg of Benadryl was administered by mouth. At 1535, Client reports the tightness in the throat is improving, no shortness of breath, no chest pain, no nausea. At 1538, vital signs are blood pressure 123/77, heart rate 81, oxygen saturation 97%. Client reports headache is improving, no shortness of breath, tightness in the throat is improving. Client is accompanied by grandmother and reports mother is driving them home. At 1544, vital signs are blood pressure 123/77, heart rate 82, oxygen saturation 97%. Client reports headache is present but improving, tightness in throat is improving, no blurred vision, no chest pain, no nausea. RN offered paramedic services in regards to the tightness of the throat, but Client denied offer. At 1550, Client stood up with no complaints. Client left facility with grandmother and picked up by mother at 1553. Client walked out with a steady gait.

pt received the vaccine and was sat waiting for the required 15 minutes after the shot., then he got up proceeding toward the pharmacy before the 15 minutes was up. Fell forward and hit his head on the wall and landed on the ground. an ambulance was called to scene. but pt refused the be taken.

Close
Client received his first dose of the Pfizer Covid-19 vaccine (Lot # EW0185 Exp. 08/2021) on 5/27/21 at 1036 AM. At approximately 1045 the client walked up to the EMT asking for water and stating that he felt lightheaded. " Client was a 22-year-old male alert and tracking with his eyes and beginning to stumble. The client had a chief complaint of syncope. EMT managed to assist the client to the observation bed while an additional EMT and RN arrived for further assistance. The client was positioned supine on the cot and proceeded to lose consciousness. The client did not fall or injure himself in any way. He regained consciousness after approximately 15 seconds. He was alert and oriented to person, place, time, and situation immediately upon regaining consciousness. Client stated that he did not have anything to eat or drink before arriving at the vaccination site. The client had no known allergies and denied any medical history. The client was negative for hives, swelling, discoloration, signs or symptoms of shortness of breath, or other signs of anaphylaxis. The client's airway, breathing, and circulation were intact. The first set of vital signs were taken at 1045 and are as follows: blood pressure 110/76, pulse 52, O2 saturation 96%, skin pale, sweaty and hot. The client consented to stay an additional 30 minutes after his initial vitals were taken and his vitals were reassessed every five minutes until his symptoms resolved. After approximately 10 minutes, the client was fully pink in his face and denied any further lightheadedness. At 1051 the second set of vital signs were: bp 122/82, p 56, O2 96%, skins pink, normal, and warm. Client was assisted to an upright seated position and was given Pringles and juice. At 1059 clients vitals were - 124/84 BP, 74HR O2 99%, Resp 16. At 1109 vitals: bp 122/82, p 68, O2 97%, skins pink, normal and warm. At the completion of his additional 30-minute observation, the client stated that he was feeling better. All pertinent information was given to client by EMT and RN and he was encouraged to follow up with his primary before his next dose. The client was also instructed to call 911 if a severe allergic reaction occurred later in the evening and was reminded to eat before his next vaccination. RN educated client about the possible signs and symptoms of an allergic reaction. The client at 1115 in positive disposition with his mother.
22 2021-05-27 dizziness A few days after being vaccinated, I had experienced dizziness, fainting while at physical therapy. ... Read more
Close
A few days after being vaccinated, I had experienced dizziness, fainting while at physical therapy. When laid on the table, I noticed I had tightness in my chest, like I couldn't catch my breath. They took my blood pressure, and It was 136/88 pulse rate of 88. These issues continued to persist. I went to the doctors to discuss the issue with a PA. She took an EKG, and found no abnormalities, although I wasn't having an episode at the time. I later felt palpitations in my chest. (my heart would race spontaneously at times for no longer than a few seconds.) The PA as well as my Doctor, had confirmed I had high blood pressure. I began to eat healthier and lose weight in order to change the blood pressure issues. The first appointment, I was 284. The second appointment which was in late April, I was 264, and my blood pressure was in the mid 120's over upper 70's, with my pulse rate in the 70's. The most recent appointment, I became more liberal with my diet and gained weight, weighing 268, but my heart rate continued to lower to a normal point, regardless (low 120's over 68, Pulse rate in the 60's.) Dr. and I had discussed possible causes, and I still have a cardiology appointment to follow up with, and we agreed that with the recent notice of myocarditis in vaccinated young adults and kids, it's a strong possibility the vaccine may have caused my issues, although I am to follow through with the cardiologist to confirm these suspicions.

A 22-years-old male patient received bnt162b2 (BNT162B2), dose 1 via an unspecified route of administration on 26Feb2021 08:30 (Batch/Lot number was not reported) as single dose for covid-19 immunisation . Medical history included covid-19 before the vaccine. The patient's concomitant medications were not reported. The patient experienced vomiting , fever and dizziness all on 26Feb2021 21:00 with outcome of recovering. No follow-up attempts are possible; information about lot/batch number cannot be obtained.

22 2021-06-01 dizziness, mobility decreased Within minutes of receiving covid-19 vaccine, I became very excessive sweaty (my shirt was wet), ... Read more
Close
Within minutes of receiving covid-19 vaccine, I became very excessive sweaty (my shirt was wet), felt eyesight was dimming, space perception was completely off, very pale, dizziness and unable to hear when being spoken too, felt faint. Both of my arms had a very tingly feeling and felt heavy and then became completely numb and I was unable to move to either arm for approximately 45 minutes. Movement slowly came back throughout the evening and over the next week. My legs felt tingly and heavy. I continue to have periodic tingly feeling in my joints through out my body. My chest felt heavy. I felt like I was doing to die. Large red swollen area where shot was given. I have COVID 19 in Feb, 2021. Health care profession suspects the reaction may have been related to having COVID-19, second dose not recommended. Likely to have antibodies. I have not felt 100 percent since receiving vaccine.

Left arm vac site benign. NP assessed surmised vasovagal reaction. Water given for hydration. monitored for 30 min. reassessment paleness and diaphoresis subsided. pt stated I feel much better I feel great. OK'd to exit after 30 min.
