22 2021-06-08 dizziness This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient's mother) and a contactable other ... Read more
Close
This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient's mother) and a contactable other healthcare professional. This consumer reported similar events for two patients (twins). This is the first of two reports. A 22-year-old male patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number: EW0170), via an unspecified route of administration, administered in the left arm, on 26Apr2021 10:00 (at the age of 22-year-old) as 2nd dose, single dose for COVID-19 immunization, at a pharmacy/drug store. Medical history included ongoing rare metabolic disorder. The patient's concomitant medications were not reported. Historical vaccine included the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number: ER8735) received at age 22 years, on 05Apr2021, for COVID-19 immunisation. On 26Apr2021, the patient received the second dose of BNT162B2. In the evening of the same day, 26Apr2021, the patient experienced tiredness/fatigue, and headache. In the morning of 27Apr2021, the patient was feeling really crappy and they though it was like the flu and it would pass. In the evening of 27Apr2021, the patient didn't sleep at all and was uncomfortable all night and pain. On the same day, 27Apr2021, the patient had severe chest pain, chest tightness, and lightheadedness. On 28Apr2021, the pain didn't go away, and the twins had elevated ST evaluation on the EKG (electrocardiograph). ST evaluation was done by the reporter's husband who is a retired firefighter emergency medical technician. The reporter decided to take the patient to hospital and said that the other twin had the same symptoms but kept saying his wasn't as bad as his brother's because he did not want to go to the hospital. The doctor advised the reporter to bring the other twin. The twins had the same echo cardiogram on 28Apr2021 (unknown results). On 28Apr2021, their troponin levels were elevated, and their cardiac enzymes continued to go up. On the same day, 28Apr2021, the patient had a strange weird bilateral wrist pain severe. It was reported that the twins were hospitalized on 28Apr2021 with myocarditis/pericarditis and inflammation around the heart. Treatment for myocarditis/pericarditis included ibuprofen and colchicine; and Toradol for breakthrough pain. The reporter stated that the twins are two identical males with the same DNA, had the vaccine at the same time, had the reactions at the same length of time, have the same lifestyle and live at the same house. The reporter said it would go a long way if they help her understand the complication. The patient recovered "strange weird bilateral wrist pain severe" on 29Apr2021. The outcome of the event myocarditis and pericarditis/inflammation around the heart was not recovered. Follow-up (14May2021): New information received from a contactable other healthcare professional includes: reporter details (other hcp added as a new reporter). Follow-up attempts are needed. Further information is expected.
22 2021-06-10 dizziness Patient received PFIZER COVID19 booster. Patient complained of feeling dizzy and lightheaded. BP 1... Read more
Close
Patient received PFIZER COVID19 booster. Patient complained of feeling dizzy and lightheaded. BP 152/92 HR 97. Provided crackers, water and juice, as patient denied having eaten at all today. Continued to monitor and encouraged to deep breath. Patient complained of feeling nauseous and had visible tremors and difficulty speaking. BP 155/89 HR 79. Mother notified of patient condition and status, advised EMS contacted to transport patient to hospital for further evaluation and monitoring. Discharged from ED with albuterol inhaler PRN.
22 2021-06-11 dizziness Patient experienced Myocarditis-like symptoms beginning 05/20/2021, 3 days after Dose 2 vaccination.... Read more
Close
Patient experienced Myocarditis-like symptoms beginning 05/20/2021, 3 days after Dose 2 vaccination. See Continuation Page for Item 18 information details. Additional information for Item 18: Day 1 (5/18) Patient had typical dose 2 reactions of low fever (100-101 degF), headache, soreness at injection site, mild dizziness. Day 2 (5/19) he felt much better. On Day 3 (20 May 2021 9:00AM) Patient experienced notable chest pain (level 5-6 on scale of 10) lasting about 30 minutes. Pain then decreased to level 1-2 for the next several hours. Patient said this felt exactly like the pain he experienced when he had Myocarditis in Nov 2017, only less severe. (The 2017 event required 4 days of hospitalization and temporarily left patient with heart failure in one ventricle (Ejection Fraction <40%) although EJ returned to normal after a few months). patient was seeing his Primary Care Physician on another matter later this same morning (5/20) and mentioned the pain. PCP listened to his heart and did not note any irregularities. Patient had no additional pain episodes for the next 3 days so we did not worry. But daily chest pain episodes resumed 5/24, 1 to 3 times a day, mostly level 1-2, sometimes level 3, typically lasting 30 min to 2 hrs, through 6/3. From 6/4 and on episodes have been less frequent. On 5/25 patient contacted his 2017 Cardiologist who ordered a Troponin-I lab. Labs were done 5/26 and were normal so we were advised to monitor but go to the ER if severe chest pain occurred. Patient has an office visit scheduled with his Cardiologist July 2. As of 6/12 (date of report) episodes tend to occur after moderate physical activity but clear after rest. This pattern is similar to what patient experienced during the first 3 months following his 2017 illness. Accordingly patient has reduced his physical activity, using chest pain episodes as an indicator of too much activity. The 2017 illness appeared to be completely resolved after April 2018 with normal ECG, Echo, EJ and no further reports of chest pain even with normal activity levels. May 20, 2021 was the first time this type of chest pain reoccurred.

Systemic: Confusion-Severe, Systemic: Dizziness / Lightheadness-Medium, Systemic: Exhaustion / Lethargy-Medium, Systemic: Fainting / Unresponsive-Severe, Systemic: Flushed / Sweating-Severe, Systemic: Hypotension-Medium
22 2021-06-19 dizziness The side effects didn't all occur simultaneously. Friday evening I noticed severe arm soreness. Late... Read more
Close
The side effects didn't all occur simultaneously. Friday evening I noticed severe arm soreness. Later Friday night (about 10 hours after getting the vaccine) I developed gradual onset chills, body aches, and fatigue. Saturday I woke up with a severe headache, body aches, fatigue, and fever. The headache became severe by mid-day, with fatigue also worsening throughout the day. Sunday was more of the same, though I believe the fever started inching down and the headache lessened. What developed Sunday afternoon/evening took me off guard though. I noticed a sudden drop in heart rate, a feeling of pressure and discomfort in the chest, nausea, and shortness of breath with exertion (consistently - not just once). (I'm a long-distance runner, so this is unusual for me.) At first I debated going to the emergency room, but since I'm so young and in otherwise good condition I thought nothing of it. I had similar symptoms the following day, but I avoided exerting myself until all of my symptoms from the vaccine had ended. I felt groggy and fatigued for several additional days, but by Saturday (8 days after getting the first dose of Pfizer) everything had resolved. I also developed swollen lymph nodes, which returned to normal size within about 3 weeks (before swelling again after the second vaccine). The second dose of the vaccine caused a more sudden and intense reaction, though I never developed chest pain/slow heart rate with it. Instead I developed sudden onset severe chills, fatigue, and body aches about 9 hours after getting the shot. A fast heart rate, shortness of breath, and sudden onset fever (temperature jumped nearly five degrees in about 90 minutes) quickly followed. My fever stabilized around 102.2 around 3 a.m. that morning, and slowly crept down throughout the afternoon/evening. Overall, with dizziness, body aches, extreme fatigue, etc., this was the sickest I've been since I had a severe case of the Flu in high school. The fatigue, shortness of breath, and fast heart rate continued for about a week - getting slightly better each day.

Pt feeling better, advised to call PCP is anything changes. Pt left in stable condition. BP-128/70, P-78, R-16, O2 Sat 98, @ 1150a...

body aches; Dizziness; Nausea; loss of appetite; chills; fatigue; itching; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer or other non hcp. A 22-year-old male patient received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Batch/Lot Number: unknown; Expiration Date: unknown), via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Arm Right on 28Jan2021 (22-year-old at the time of vaccination), as a single dose for covid-19 immunization. The patient's medical history included non-sustained ventricular tachycardia diagnosed at birth, pacemaker and defibrillator. The reporter stated that her son has a serious heart condition, pacemaker/defibrillator- first was in 6th grade, currently on his fourth and drug hypersensitivity states they monitored them both longer than the 15 minutes because they have a history of serious allergic reactions to ACE inhibitors. The patient's concomitant medications were not reported. The patient continues taking his low dose aspirin prior to the vaccine but did not take any Tylenol. On 28Jan2021, the patient experienced dizziness, nausea, loss of appetite, chills, body aches, fatigue, and itching. The outcome of all the events was recovered on 29Jan2021. Information about lot/batch number has been requested. Follow-up attempts are completed. No further information is expected.

On Sunday I had blurred vision, had nausea and had trouble breathing. These symptoms lasted one month. I had vertigo, nausea and had trouble breathing. As of today, I still have difficulty breathing, the nausea and dizziness are not present today. I will not get my second vaccine due to my symptoms to my first vaccine.

Close
Client received COVID vaccine Pfizer (Lot# EW0187 expiration 07/15/21) at 1316. Client was sitting in the vaccination chair at 1320 when RN noticed Client was pale and fatigued. RN asked for help by a neighboring Ancillary, but RN and Ancillary responded at 1322. RN, RN, and Ancillary aided Client to zero-gravity chair. Student Nurse notified PHN, PHN, and PHN at 1326. At 1327, vital signs are blood pressure 116/60, heart rate 60, oxygen saturation 96%. Client reports being nausea at the start of intervention, but reports nausea been resolved, vision is non-blurry, slight headache, and feels dizzy. Client was offered water and accepted. Client reports a history of fainting, deaf in the left ear, and allergies to sulfa. Client's mother is present at the time of adverse effect. At 1331, vital signs are blood pressure 122/62, heart rate 63, oxygen saturation 98%. Client reports headache has improved, no nausea, no blurred vision, and dizziness has improved. PHN gave Client and the client's mother education on common adverse effects of COVID vaccine and ED precautions. At 1336, vital signs are blood pressure 118/62, heart rate 73, oxygen saturation 96%. Client reports no new symptoms, skin tone has returned to appropriate coloration related to ethnicity. Client remains in the zero-gravity chair drinking water. At 1341, vital signs are blood pressure 112/64, heart rate 66, oxygen saturation 99%. Client reports all symptoms had resolved. At 1346, vital signs are blood pressure 110/60, heart rate 68, oxygen saturation 97%. Client reports no complaints. At 1356, vital signs are blood pressure 112/62, heart rate 65, oxygen saturation 96%. Client reports no complaints. Client stood up with no complaints and left facility at 1357 and was accompanied by his family.

Medical history (including chronic or long-standing conditions) included COVID-19 (mostly asymptomatic) from Feb2021 to an unknown date. It was unknown if the patient received prescriptions over the counter medications, dietary supplements or herbal remedies at the time of vaccination. Allergies to medications, food or other products, other illness at time of vaccination and up to one month prior were reported as none. It was unknown if the patient had an adverse event following previous vaccine. The patient concomitant medications were not reported. It was reported that the patient was very nervous when checking in for vaccine. On 20May2021 at 14:23, after administration he experienced sweating and became increasingly pale. He then reported discomfort bilaterally in his hands and forearms. He described it as weakness, tingling and inability to move his hands. This lasted for 30-45 minutes and then seem to start to ease. Patient was released to his mother. At 20:30 his mother reported that he felt weak but seemed ok otherwise. Adverse reactions to the vaccine, especially after a recent case of COVID were discussed in detail with the patient and mother. Due to the reaction, it was recommended that they talk to patient's doctor before getting second dose. Medical tests and laboratory results related to the adverse events were not reported. The outcome of the events was unknown. Follow up attempts needed. Further information is expected.

Close
light headed; heart was racing; itchy in one part of my right arm (back of the shoulder)/Itching like all over my body; abdomen were itchy and bumps/rashes and some bumps in my body; some rashes; it is like an allergy/like the allergic reaction the medication that causes it; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable Nurse reporting for himself. A 23-years-old male patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number: EK5730), via an unspecified route of administration in left deltoid on 28Dec2020 15:00 at single dose for prevention for Covid-19. The patient medical history included electrolyte imbalance. Concomitant medications included ascorbic acid, rosa canina (VITAMIN C WITH ROSE HIPS), zinc, vitamin D3, all started from Dec2020 (18 or 19Dec2020) and ongoing for "immune system". At 3pm yesterday (28Dec2020) he received the vaccine. He experienced feeling light headed and his heart was racing a minute after receiving the vaccine. Around 11-12pm he was itching on his arm, abdomen and back. He took an allergy pill and rubbed hydrocortisone cream on his back, arm and armpit. After taking the medication and rubbing the cream the bumps went down 30 minutes to an hour later. He woke today and everything was clearing. These symptoms usually hit him from having an electrolyte imbalance. He had missed the past 2 doses of Vitamin C, Zinc and Vitamin D3. He had 2 Covid test prior to getting the vaccine. His height was 6 feet 3 or 6 feet 4. He started like itching like all over his body. He noticed some rashes and some bumps in his body, it was like an allergy. He was just wondering if this was like the allergic reaction the medication that causes it. The outcome of the events light headed and heart was racing was recovered on 28Dec2020 15:01 and the outcome of the other events was recovered on an unknown date in Dec2020.

I feel better after throwing up and proceeded to get rest before going to work at 6:00am. By 8:00am I had developed a severe headache, severe nausea, muscle fatigue and overall felt bad. When I got home I had become extremely nauseous and developed severe muscle fatigue and severe arthralgia and my headache had increased and became sweaty and dizzy. I slept from 9:00am to 2:00pm where the symptoms had gotten no better and the headache had gotten worse. I slept from 3:00pm to around 6:00pm with the same symptoms but managed to eat some soup and kept it down. I slept from 10pm to 12pm the next day 12/10/20. My fatigue and joint pain had somewhat dissipated but I was still experiencing severe nausea and a severe headache. By the end of 12/10/20 around 8pm my joint pain and muscle fatigue had gotten better but the nausea and headache were still there. 12/11/20 I was well enough to drive and receive a covid test. My nausea and headache did not go away until the end of day 12/11/20

Severity is moderate. Quality dull pain. Currently invo 1/11/21 COVID Pfizer vaccine #1 = no issues (given at Clinic = screening form marked all no but had a 30 min watch post vaccine 1/29/21 Covid Pfizer vaccine #2 EL0261 left arm at Clinic - no c/o reported 2/20/2021: medical sent to local ER on 2/20 for 2 day c/o worsening left hand/forearm numbness, coldness, discoloration to left hand and pain (purple appearance). Was seen at clinic with negative DVT r/o US, nl imaging and labs. 2/21 sent to ER c/o UE pain and weakness x 5 days (woke up with bicep pain that progressed to numbness, tingling, swelling and discoloration of hand (cyanosis pallor and cold LUE x 3 days). Severity is moderate. Quality dull pain. Currently involves entire left arm (arm, elbow forearm wrist hand).. Did have some swelling and motor loss, NO CP, SOB or sensory loss, no redness, no injury, no fever, chills, ha, depression sore throat, cough, rash, lymphadenopathy, abd pain, GI distress, no trauma or recent illnesses. 2/21: admitted clinic w/rhabdomyolysis: no preceding workouts, increased activity on ship, back sleeper, no alcohol, no trauma,. nsp: skin intact, no erythema. Mild edema to upper arm around triceps. Mild purple discoloration to dorsum of hand. Palp: TTP about triceps. TTP anterior shoulder. TTP biceps. Able to palpate triceps tendon and biceps tendon. NTTP throughout the rest of hand and forearm. Hand is cooler relative to contralateral side. NTTP cervical spine. ROM: Full passive ROM of the shoulder and elbow with pain. No micromotion pain with any joint in the upper extremity. Painless cervical spine ROM. Motor: 3/5 strength to OP/FPL/2nd FDP, EIP/EPL, 1st and 2nd DIO. 3/5 deltoid, biceps, triceps, wrist extensors, wrist flexors. Sens: Decreased sensation throughout entirety of forearm and hand distal to the elbow. Above the elbow, sensation is intact. Vasc: 2+ radial pulse, symmetric to contralateral side. BCR <3 sec. Hand is cooler than contralateral side. Lab: CRP <5, ESR 4, CK 31,924, PT 14, INR 1.1, D-dimer 0.46, AST 610, ALT 186, Cr 0.94, WBC 6.3 Imaging: Radiographs of the chest, shoulder, elbow, wrist, and hand demonstrate no fracture. The shoulder is well located. CTA starting at the heart demonstrate no vascular abnormalities. Assessment: unlikely that he has compartment syndrome or a cervical spine pathology. His exam does not localize to one specific innervation or muscle group. His paresthesias and diffuse 3/5 weakness on exam may be related to parsonage turner syndrome (post viral neuritis) versus edema. While he does have a cool hand and mild/moderate edema on exam, his CTA is normal and his exam is very reassuring that this is not compartment syndrome. He likely has rhabdomyolysis based on upper arm swelling in the setting of CK of 31924. Discharge 2/22/2021: He received a total of 3 liters of IV fluids and was encouraged to drink large amounts of water. Repeat CK levels showed to be down trending as were his AST and ALT enzymes. Plain radiographs of his left arm and shoulder were unremarkable as was CT angiography of his chest. Electrolytes and renal lab work was within normal limits throughout the hospitalization.On the day of discharge, he was tolerating a PO diet, ambulating without difficulty, and hemodynamically stable. LUE w/ minimal swelling, no erythema. TTP over L triceps belly, No TTP over the distal LUE. Somewhat decreased sensation to light touch over distal LUE. 2+ radial pulses b/l. LUE ROM somewhat limited 2/2 pain, but intact. ---- to f/u with HCP in 2 weeks, sooner if worse (medical officer) CK 2/22/21 was down to 14653

Family Medicine Cosigned by: MD at 2/28/2021 7:35 AM Expand AllCollapse All COVID VACCINE CLINIC 2/24/2021 Date: 2/24/2021 Subjective Patient is a 23 y.o. male who was seen at COVID Vaccine Clinic today for his first dose of the COVID 19 vaccination. He was given the Pfizer vaccination. During his 15 minute waiting period after the injection, the patient began to experience lightheadedness. He denied difficulty breathing, difficulty swallowing, throat tightness and nausea. He states he always gets lightheaded when he gets a shot. He denies any episodes of syncope in the past. This provider was notified of patient reaction and he was then assessed in the emergency bay area. Monitored patient for severe reaction symptoms, including but not limited to collapse, hypotension and rapid progression of symptoms. ALLERGY REVIEW OF SYSTEMS: Patient denies chills, facial swelling, chest tightness, shortness of breath, wheezing, vomiting and headaches +lightheaded: Previous Reactions: Always gets lightheaded after getting a shot. Denies other symptoms or syncope. Objective Vitals Vitals: 02/24/21 1406 BP: 119/67 Pulse: 58 SpO2: 100% Physical Exam Constitutional: Appearance: Normal appearance. HENT: Head: Normocephalic and atraumatic. Cardiovascular: Rate and Rhythm: Normal rate and regular rhythm. Pulmonary: Effort: Pulmonary effort is normal. No respiratory distress. Breath sounds: Normal breath sounds. No wheezing or rales. Skin: General: Skin is warm and dry. Neurological: General: No focal deficit present. Mental Status: He is alert and oriented to person, place, and time. Assessment/Plan Treatment included: no therapy Follow up response to treatment: Good. Lightheadedness resolved prior to discharge. Patient discharge: Stable to go home and follow up with PCP. Differential Diagnosis: Vaccine-Related Anxiety (include misc mental health) PA-C Electronically Signed 2/24/2021 2:07 PM

A 23-year-old male patient received the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number: EL3247, expiry date: unknown), via an unspecified route of administration, on 19Jan2021 10:00, at single dose, for COVID-19 immunization. At approximately 3:28 pm, Patient reported feelings of nausea, skin color was grey and clammy to touch within minutes of receiving dose 1 Pfizer. Moved to the adverse reaction area via wheelchair with girlfriend by his side. Patient denies any medical history. Girlfriend reported that he had a fear of needles. Initially vitals were taken, O2 sat was 90 and his heart was in the 40's. PA was present and felt patient needed to be sent to the ED for further evaluation. Close
Patient became weak and lightheaded. I found him pale, diaphoretic and tachypneic. He reported, "This always happens when I get a shot. I just need some sugar like juice." He denied difficulty breathing or chest pain. He was not nauseous nor did he vomit. I transported him to a private holding room via wheelchair and gave him a 12 oz can of Coca-Cola. He took sips and immediately reported feeling better. The initial vital signs I took were as follows: Temp 98.6 F, HR 67, BP 84/48 mmHg, RR 24/min, and SpO2 97%. After recheck in 15 min BP improved to 106/62 mmHg, his became more pink and no more diaphoresis. I observed him for 30 minutes total and he was stable to go home. He drove himself home.

Per pt he asked multiple physicians regarding receiving the covid vaccine and was given the permission to proceed. Also took 20mg hydrocortisone in the morning, then 10mg this afternoon for Addison's disease. 1603 - Pt received 1st dose of Pzifer covid-19 vaccine and during the first 5 minutes of observation complained of feeling itchy and wheezing, light headed, nauseous. 1608 - 0.3mg epi given at - self administered right thigh. 1613 - 90 mg of hydrocortisone (solu-cortef), patient's own medication, given by RN through pt's PICC line RUE; line was flushed with NS before and after and cleaned with alcohol swab. 1615 - Self-administered 4 mg Zofran (patient's own medication) at 1615 into the RUE PICC; cleaned with alcohol swab. 1615- Second 0.3mg of epi given- self administered left thigh. 1617 - Fire department arrived. 1621- pt complains of itchiness still but wheezing is reduced. 23 2021-03-24 dizziness, movement disorder Passed out /Lost all awareness; Light-headed; Hyperventilating; He caught his breath; Elevated heart... Read more
Close
Passed out /Lost all awareness; Light-headed; Hyperventilating; He caught his breath; Elevated heart rate; Tingling sensation; He was unable to form cohesive sentences; Muscles movements were impeded; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 23-year-old male patient received the first dose of BNT162B2 (Pfizer-Biontech Covid-19 Vaccine, Lot. EN6206) single dose, in the left arm, on 08Mar2021, at 11:45 AM, for COVID-19 immunisation. The patient had not received any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the BNT162B2 vaccine. The patient had not received any other medications within 2 weeks. Relevant medical history and concomitant medications were unknown. No known allergies were reported. The patient had not experienced COVID-19 prior vaccination. On 08Mar2021, at 12:00 PM, 5 minutes after vaccination, the patient became very light-headed. In a few seconds his vision went dark and he passed out. After an unknown amount of time, he became semiconscious and was hyperventilating. While hyperventilating, his eyes were open, but he could not see anything. Once he caught his breath, after about 15 seconds, his vision came back and he lost all awareness of where he was. After about 30 seconds, the patient realized he was in the observation area for the facility and alerted the medical professionals near his vehicle he was sitting in. Medical professionals checked his vitals, which were fine other than an elevated heart rate, and he had a tingling sensation over his body for the next two minutes. In this time, he was unable to form cohesive sentences, and his muscles movements were impeded. It took another 40 minutes to return to a relatively normal state. No treatment was received. The patient recovered from the adverse events. Post the vaccination, the patient has not been tested for COVID-19. No follow up attempts are possible. No further information is expected.

23 2021-04-06 dizziness About 6 hours post injection, with only a small amount of muscle soreness in the injected arm, I was... Read more
Close
About 6 hours post injection, with only a small amount of muscle soreness in the injected arm, I was suddenly very very dizzy. I ran from my living room to my bedroom and got under the sheets, I was very very cold. My whole body was twitching violently, and I had extreme muscle pain. Joints popped like knuckles cracking that I wouldn't normally be able to pop. This lasted for about 10 minutes very violently and then calmed down over another 10, and I just felt very very feverish. I felt numb all over but I was shivering a little. Moving was very hard and my whole back was very sore, with the injection arm in a little extra pain. Fell asleep until about 7:30 am, woke up still a little feverish. I have had waves of extreme dizziness and muscle aches continuing even to today a couple days later. I am also experiencing a rather persistent headache in the very center of my head, making it hard to think. I lose track of my thoughts and it feels like I can't focus, this seems to be improving gradually over time. treatment only included extra fluid intake and over the counter pain killers

Close
Vasovagal syncope in the 15 minute waiting period. Response by staff was great: laid me down, brought a cot, regularly checked my heart rate, blood oxygen, and blood pressure until it returned to normal and waited to make sure the symptoms did not return. Later that night, I started experiencing some of the typical COVID vaccine side effects: sore arm, chills, nausea, and fever-like symptoms; in addition to the symptoms I was warned was possible, I also experienced periods of dizziness and an uncomfortable sense of balance. Three days later, the dizziness and other common symptoms have gone away, but my sense of balance still feels off, although I do not know if related to the vaccine. It?s not so bad that I?m at risk of falling over, but I have a semi-regular feeling of unsteadiness which I cannot explain.

23 2021-04-11 dizziness 23 y/o male with no PMH c/o dizziness ~10 min post pfizer vaccine 1st dose assoc with blurry vision.... Read more
Close
23 y/o male with no PMH c/o dizziness ~10 min post pfizer vaccine 1st dose assoc with blurry vision. Pt was assessed by clinical leads/EMS. Pt never LOC, was attached to monitor, VS monitor, placed on stretcher, given H2O x 5 (250mL) + ice packs + cookies. Pt reported complete resolution of symptoms within ~4min. 3 lead showed irregular sinus arrythmia w/ peaked T waves. Pt was started on 20g IV on left hand 1L NS bolus with no change in EKG. Based on clinical judgement EKG changes dont appear to be a vaccine related adverse RXN, most likely a benign finding or electrolyte abnormality. Pt was advised to go to ER for further evaluation and management, pt agreed to transport to ER. Pt was advised to drink water and ea

not feeling well; he felt really terrible yesterday; Fatigue; on the left side of his throat, it hurt to swallow/throat pain; on the left side of his throat, it hurt to swallow/throat pain; last night (07Apr2021), he had a really bad headache; Sensation of pressure in ear; Sensation of pressure in eye; Dizzy on standing; at one point, he had a little bit of nausea with the dizziness; he was really weak; he didn't eat yesterday because he had no appetite; Chills/Teeth chattering; Shaking; Hot feeling generalized; Sweating; Feeling hot and cold; on Tuesday night (06Apr2021) he didn't sleep well, and he could barely sleep last night (07Apr2021); his head felt heavy on Tuesday night (06Apr2021), and his head felt super heavy last night (07Apr2021); This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient) via a Pfizer-sponsored Program COVAX US Support. A 23-year-old male patient received the second dose of bnt162b2 via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Left arm on 27Mar2021 (between 11:55AM and 12:00PM) (Lot Number: ER8732; Expiration Date: Jul2021) as single dose for covid-19 immunisation. The patient medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. The patient previously received the first dose of bnt162b2 via Intramuscular, at the age of 23-year-old, administered in right arm on 06Mar2021 (Lot Number: EN6206, Expiry: 30Jun2021) as single dose for covid-19 immunisation. He felt really terrible yesterday (07Apr2021). On Tuesday night (06Apr2021) he didn't sleep well, and he could barely sleep last night (07Apr2021). His head felt heavy on Tuesday night (06Apr2021), and his head felt super heavy last night (07Apr2021). On 07Apr2021, the patient experienced fatigue, on the left side of his throat, it hurt to swallow/throat pain, really bad headache, sensation of pressure in ear, sensation of pressure in eye, dizzy on standing, a little bit of nausea with the dizziness, really weak, he didn't eat yesterday because he had no appetite, chills/teeth chattering, shaking, hot feeling generalized, sweating, feeling hot and cold. The patient experienced not feeling well on an unspecified date. Patient started developing symptoms that were very bad, he thought he had COVID. Patient had a PCR test that was negative. Patient would like to know if a delayed response after second dose is normal. Reported he had received his second COVID-19 Vaccine dose about 2 weeks ago (27Mar2021). He said he felt really terrible yesterday. He said he felt so bad that he thought he had the COVID-19 Virus, and went to get tested. He clarified he had a real time COVID-19 Virus PCR test yesterday (07Apr2021), and received a negative result today (08Apr2021), less than 24 hours after having the test performed. He said it could be something else that was making him feel terrible. He said he had a (telehealth) appointment with a doctor tomorrow (09Apr2021). Caller asked if Pfizer had any data with the second COVID-19 Vaccine for people that had a really delayed immune response with their immune system. He said he had no symptoms after his second COVID-19 Vaccine, and was wondering if what he was experiencing now was a delayed immune response. Reported last night was the worst for his symptoms, saying it was awful. He said he felt better this morning. He clarified that on Tuesday night (06Apr2021) he didn't sleep well. He said his head felt heavy, but when he woke up, he did not feel too bad. He said he had fatigue, and on the left side of his throat, it hurt to swallow. He said last night (07Apr2021), he had a really bad headache, and his head felt super heavy. He said he had ear and eye pressure. He said he got dizzy on standing, and at one point, had a little bit of nausea with the dizziness. He said he wasn't sure if the nausea was caused by the dizziness. He said he was really weak, and didn't eat yesterday because he had no appetite. He said he took his temperature at around 8:00PM-9:00PM last night, and had no fever. He said he still had his sense of taste and smell. He said he had chills, he was shaking, and his teeth were chattering. He said he was also hot and sweating at times, like he was alternating between hot and cold. He said he tried to drink water yesterday, and would take a few sips of water when he turned over in bed. He said he could barely sleep. Treatment: Reported he took Ibuprofen 200mg tablets, off and on, to treat his headache because his headache was preventing him from sleeping. He said he would take 2 Ibuprofen 200mg tablets at a time. He said he took his first Ibuprofen dose in the middle of the night on Tuesday, and then took 2 more doses of 2 Ibuprofen 200mg tablets last night. He said he did not have the Ibuprofen 200mg tablet NDC, Lot, and Expiration Date because he had taken Ibuprofen from a different Ibuprofen 200mg bottle and put it in the Ibuprofen 200mg he was taking from. Reported he felt he had gained strength back today (08Apr2021) because he had showered this morning, and didn't fall over. He said he was so weak yesterday, even trying to text for his work was bad. He said his headache was a little worse today, and his left-sided throat pain was persisting, but everything else had subsided for now. Caller said he was wondering if what he had experienced was a delayed immune response, or a false negative COVID-19 Virus test, or something else, like Mono. Patient was not feeling well. Did test negative covid. The outcome of the event headache, Swallowing painful and Throat pain was not recovered, other events was recovering. No follow-up attempts are needed. No further information is expected.

Close
Per Client on 3/10/2021 received a Pfrizer COVID 19 vaccine in left arm, at Walgreen location. Per Client, vaccine was given into "my rotor cuff", and pain started immediately after vaccine. One week later, mid-day, pain worsen in left arm, and unable to have full use of left arm. 2-3 weeks later seen at Clinic, and was instructed to follow up with PCP. Client able to be seen by PCP six weeks after 3/10/2021, which was 5 days after the 2nd vaccines, and pain in left arm, along with other concerns in arm still present. Per Client, PCP prescribed five days of steroids, and Meloxicam for pain. Per Client one week after completing the steriods, in to see an Orthopedic MD, and two or three weeks later started physical therapy on left shoulder and arm. Per Client, also have been taking Ibuprofen for pain, which seem to be helping to decrease the pain severity. Per Client, continuing to follow up with PCP, and has been in communication with the Walgreen, were the vaccine was administered. PHN suggested that Client continue to follow up with PCP, go into Urgent Care, ER, and to call 911 if having a medical emergency. Client verbalized understanding information provided.

Adverse Event: 1305: PT c/o feeling lightheaded, slightly nauseated. RNs on site responded, assessed, obtained vital signs (1309: BP 100/60, HR 69, SPO2 96% on RA). PT presented with diaphoresis and pallor. Aid was called at 1305, EMTs responded at 1315 after completing another call. RNs mentioned above provided care to PT until their arrival; PT remained stable with no LOC during encounter. EMTs obtained VS at 1315: (BP 118/P, HR 80, SPO298% RA). Treatment: Provided juice and water, assessed PT, obtained vital signs. Outcome: PT reported "I feel fine now. I can walk fine." PT appeared to be at baseline and was medically cleared by EMS.

Denies dizziness with standing. 1432- BP: 140/75 HR:64 RR: 18. Assisted to passenger seat. Relative to drive home. 23 2021-05-14 fall, dizziness Sore joints; his butt is still a little sore from falling; dizziness/ light headed; fainting; pain i... Read more
Close
Sore joints; his butt is still a little sore from falling; dizziness/ light headed; fainting; pain in upper abdomen area; Sweating; Nausea; falling; This is spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 23-year-old male patient received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE) via an unspecified route of administration on 29Apr2021 at 1 pm (around 12:20ish as reported) (Lot Number: FN6206) (at 23-year-old) at single dose in arm right for COVID-19 immunisation. The patient's medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. No history of all previous immunization with the Pfizer vaccine considered as suspect, no additional vaccines administered on same date of the Pfizer suspect, no prior vaccinations within 4 weeks, no family medical history relevant to AEs. The patient stated he is a pretty healthy guy. All day after getting the vaccine he was fine. He got the shot at like 1 came home took a nap, ate some dinner, and was playing XBOX with the boys when this happened. At around 10:30 pm on 29Apr2021 he went to rub, his stomach just above his belly button and it hurt. He said that he read on line that that area is called the pancreas or liver, it has a lot of names for that area when looking online. He stated it's the left upper abdomen area he felt pain when he pressed on it. It radiated really fast across his abdomen while he was on the phone with mother. The more he pressed the more the pain got sharper, and it radiated right across the abdomen, mainly above belly button not too much in lower abdomen, not much in upper abdomen. It was very sensitive. He didn't have to press hard to trigger the pain. It was almost like the area was inflamed. It happened really fast and that it was his upper stomach not so much the lower part of his abdomen. He felt dizziness and nauseous and like a silly boy he tried to run to the bathroom. He stated that he fell and fainted. His butt was still a little sore from falling. He said when he woke up, he was sweating like he had been out side all day. He did not recall sweating any time he fainted in the past. The side effects were gone after about ten minutes. He was really light headed and had the crazy sharp pain in abdomen for about ten minutes and then it was gone. He had never had that kind of pain. He was laying on the floor for a couple minutes. He went to get his phone, and then sat back down and was sweating. He still had pain at that time but it only lasted about 10 minutes at most. He was still a little bit sore in some joints which was not unexpected. He confirmed that he had a little bit of sweating, and he fainted a little bit. Since the episode he hasn't felt any symptoms like that before, he has not had any pain like gastritis but he has had some random gastrointestinal things before. It's also reported nausea on 29Apr2021. No required to emergency room and physician office. He was on the verge of going to the ER while the pain was there. He was going to go until it stopped and to get checked out. No relevant test. The outcome of the events sore joints, dizziness and butt sore was unknown; for other events was resolved on 29Apr2021. No follow-up attempts are needed. No further information is expected.

Close
PATIENT RECEIVED PFIZER VACCINE AND THEN STATED HE WAS LIGHT HEADED AFTERWARDS. WHEN HE TRIED TO STAND UP HE PASSED OUT AND HIT HIS HEAD ON THE FLOOR. NURSE TOOK BLOOD PRESSURE (88/47) AND HR (43). NURSE ADVISED PATIENT TO SLOWLY GET UP AND SIT DOWN. NURSE SUGGESTED CALLING 911 BUT PATIENT REFUSED TO PAY FOR AMBULANCE FEE. PATIENT CALLED PCP AND WAS ADVISED TO WAIT FOR 15 MIN FOR OBSERVATION AND THEN GO TO ER. NURSE TOOK READINGS AGAIN AND GOT BP 92/54 AND HR 53. PATIENT SAT DOWN AND WAITED IN WAITING ROOM FOR AWHILE LONGER. NURSE TOOK READING AGAIN AND GOT 119/73. PATIENT GOING TO ER AND WILL CONTACT US WITH ANY UPDATES.

23 2021-05-20 dizziness Directly after receiving the vaccination the patient felt lightheaded and then 'blacked out' for a c... Read more
Close
Directly after receiving the vaccination the patient felt lightheaded and then 'blacked out' for a couple of seconds. He was sitting in a chair and slowly slid down the chair to the floor, but he did not hit his head; his head was supported by the vaccinator. The episode was witnessed and no seizure activity or signs of anaphylaxis were present. Patient appeared to have a short syncopal episode. The patient was placed on the floor with his legs up by me, and the patient states he felt much improved in that position. The patient reports that he did not eat or drink anything that day and that he had been working outside until the time of his vaccination. The patient was given Gatorade here to rehydrate; within a couple minutes the patient states that he felt completely normal. EMS was not called. Patient will follow-up with is PCP and has a ride from his mother who was present during the event.

Close
I got my shot on a Friday afternoon. The following Tuesday afternoon, I was out running sprints with a friend. After a couple, I felt super winded, like I was gonna pass out. This was concerning since I run at least 30 miles a week. Early the next morning, I woke up with my heart racing and shortness of breath. This persisted for a couple of hours. I woke up with a stiff chest, pain and aches around my body, and struggling to breathe. I went to urgent care and they did an EKG on me that came out abnormal. They referred me to a cardiologist where I got an appointment the next day. The cardiologist runs another ekg this time it?s worse. She sends me straight to the ER. They run a bunch of tests but nothing is conclusive. I?m released the next evening. The following Monday I had a checkup with my cardiologist and she referred me to someone she knows at a HCF. My appointment is not until the end of June

23 2021-05-26 fall Patient was administed the pfizer covid-19 vaccine 1:24pm. After the vaccine was administered patien... Read more
Close
Patient was administed the pfizer covid-19 vaccine 1:24pm. After the vaccine was administered patient went to a designated chair to wait for 15 minutes post-vaccine. Pharmacist monitored patient, noticed patient sitting talking on the phone shortly after vaccine. However, after a couple minutes patient passed out and fell off of chair. After yelling patient's name he came to and did not lose consciousness again. Patient suffered injury on head with a substantial laceration on forehead above eye. Code white was called and patient was given an ice pack and advised to sit for 30 minutes following incident. Asked patient if he would like us to call 911, he refused. He sat with management while an incident report was filled out and while he didn't want us to call an ambulance it did seem as though his mom was going to take him to urgent care to have his cut examined.

Attendee was noted to be sleeping in the observation area at 12:42 pm. Staff member went over and tapped his on the shoulder when he did not immediately rouse to her asking if he was ok. He woke up and was alert and oriented, by stated that he was lightheaded. He was escorted to the cot and place on his left side. No tachypnea or dyspnea. HR 84 BP 136/98 O2Sat 99%. Two RN's stayed in attendance with him. At 13:24 he stated that he was feeling much better and denied any further lightheadedness. HR 86 BP 128/82 O2Sat 98%. He was assisted to a sitting position and then a standing position without any lightheadedness. At 1:30 pm he was discharge to home with his friends in attendance.

Close
Patient received the first dose of the Pfizer Vaccine. About 5 to 10 minutes after the vaccine, patient complained of dizziness and some shortness of breath. I did not see any swelling or noticeable difficulty in breathing. Patient also complained of numbness and tingling on this hands. Patient was told to be very relaxed on the chair in order to recover. Patient then complained of losing sensation on his hands. Also, patient said that he was going to pass out at any time. Girlfriend was present with patient. I told patient that I can call 911 immediately if they like. We called 911 and within 5 minutes EMT ARRIVED. EMT arrived and ran some tests on patient. They said that patient 's respiration was getting back to normal capacity and confirmed that patient was having an anxiety attack. EMT asked if he has been taking medication for his anxiety. Patient said that he isn't on any medication for his anxiety. Patient was then taken to the ER.

Patient just needed a moment to calm down. patient is fine at the time of report. When confirmed if the consumer wanted to report this, patient stated, so sleepiness is a side effect, right, he is fine at the time of report, he dont have anything to report. When probed if the consumer has any medical query, patient stated, Well, he does have one, he was feeling bit dizzy but at the time of report he felt its almost kind of like being high or drunk like you just took a sip or something, started to feel something. 23 2021-06-08 fall Patient fainted and fell to the ground after receiving vaccine.
23 2021-06-10 dizziness I am healthy 23 year old male. I have never suffered from any sort of illness or conditions. After m... Read more
Close
I am healthy 23 year old male. I have never suffered from any sort of illness or conditions. After massive push by the goverment and incentivization to take the New Covid-19 Vaccines deemed safe , I went ahead and received the Pfizer shot on 05/24/2021. A day after I felt headache and dizziness. This stopped on the third day. Later I would have episodes of blurred vision. That stopped. But what has really affected me and continues to affect me , is that a week after I have developed major difficulty breathing. I never , ever not even once in my life have suffered from breathing problems. It all started on an afternoon a week after the shot randomly with really fast heart palpitations and after those palpitations stopped I was choking, I could not breathe at all. After this , I am having trouble breathing normally or getting enough air in along with tightness in the chest area. For instance, I struggle with two breaths and then the third I will likely get more air in. I have felt incredible tightness in my chest. There has been nights where I cannot sleep because I am unable to breathe , and feel like I am choking. So , I need to get up and walk around the house to catch my breath. I am having shortness of breath and my breathing is not like it used to be. I do not have any fever or any other symptoms , the persisting problem is the tightness and difficulty breathing. I already went to the Pulmonary doctor a couple days ago and underwent testing that are pending. I do not understand why this happened to me , I am not sure if it is a coincidence or if there is a relation between me having taken that Pfizer shot . But prior to taking that vaccine I never once had trouble with my breathing and never felt tightness around my chest. This is new to me and it scares me to think this might stay with me forever, whatever it is. I pray it goes away. I am still having trouble . and the fact that in the past I never thought about my breathing because it was normal, and now it is a constant issue throughout the day, moments when I can get air and others when it is very difficult. I am reporting this to leave a record of this incident because prior to me taking this vaccine , I was in fact a fully healthy person free of any sort of health issues.
23 2021-06-11 dizziness Client reported feeling like he was going to "pass out" and had blurry vision. Client lost conscious... Read more
Close
Client reported feeling like he was going to "pass out" and had blurry vision. Client lost consciousness for approximately 5 seconds and was assisted into gravity chair for observation. Client was provided bottled water and education on vaccine side-effects. Client was advised to seek emergency medical attention, but refused. Client was advised to follow-up with primary care provider. Client left site unassisted with steady gaitafter approximately 40 minutes observation with mother, who advised she will take client to urgent care or emergency room if symptoms persist.
23 2021-06-16 dizziness At 6:46 pm on 06/16/2021, 23 year old male patient was vaccinated for his first COVID vaccine by Pfi... Read more
Close
At 6:46 pm on 06/16/2021, 23 year old male patient was vaccinated for his first COVID vaccine by Pfizer. Within 30 seconds, while getting up, he felt dizzy and sat back down. Cool towel was provided, and head was supported. He turned extremely pale. Store PIC arrived. We helped patient lay on the floor of the clinic room. He had a pulse, 911 was called and paramedics arrived. They checked vitals and performed EKG, determined he was alright. Patient waited in waiting area for 45 minutes, was provided a Gatorade drink and glucose tablet after he was fully conscious. Then he drove home (called at 8:45pm) to check on patient, he was fine.

Close
Had a night fever at 3am on June 19. Felt hot, dehydrated, and weak. Took 200mg ibuprofen pill with water and slept again but was uncomfortable. Also felt dizzy and fatigue at night. My heart was also beating fast. When I woke up at 10am the symptoms seem to be less intense and better. I didn't feel hot. However, I still felt weak in my body. At 1pm when I started earing lunch I felt hot, tired and dizzy again, I was really sleepy, didn't feel like eating, and felt like vomiting. I drank coke soda instead and slept until 4pm and I took another 200mg ibuprofen pill with water, after which I felt better.

23 2021-06-27 fall, dizziness Immunization prep and administration were normal per protocol with no issues. Approximately 5 minute... Read more
Close
Immunization prep and administration were normal per protocol with no issues. Approximately 5 minutes after exiting the immunization room the patient approached the consultation window and stated he felt as if he were going to pass out. The pharmacist asked the patient to stay where he was and attempted to run around to the waiting area to help him sit. Before the pharmacist could make it to the patient he collapsed. The patient was in a seated position slumped against the wall, very pale, and profusely sweating. Pharmacist helped him to sit up straight and the patient started responding to questions. Other team members alerted EMS and got a water bottle for the patient. We moved him up to a chair and to the immunization area when he was able and waited for EMS to arrive. Patient was treated by EMS and left the building with them under his own power.
23 2021-06-29 fall Patient walked to th chair for observation, within a minute patient leans forward then fell over cha... Read more
Close
Patient walked to th chair for observation, within a minute patient leans forward then fell over chair to his right and landed on face. I(pharmacist) ran to his side, I though he was having a seizure ,yelled to my technician to call 911 , but with further assesment I knew he didnt have a seizure, he fell on his face and his arms tucked under his abdomen, so he couldn't lift himself up properly. I sat him up,he was responsive to my questions, pulse was very faint and he started to sweat,pale,clammy . His nose was bleeding from the fall. Within 9 minutes paramedic showed up , took blood pressure and glucose check. After assesment they didn't feel it was necessary to go to emergency room. Patient didn't eat breakfast,got him apple juice and chocolate. This never happened to him before. His friend came to meet him and make sure he was ok, he left voluntarily ,and back to himself.

Close
ONCE VACCINE WAS ADMINISTERED, THE PATIENT IMMEDIATELY STATED THAT HE FELT DIZZY. SKIN WAS CLAMMY, PULSE WAS ELEVATED. HE FELT LIGHTHEADED AND HE DESCRIBED HIS VISION AS "WHITE". I GAVE HIM AN ICE PACK, AND THEN WAS PREPARING TO LAY HIM ON THE GROUND. HE PASSED OUT, BUT DID NOT FALL AS WE LEANED HIM BACKWARD IN THE CHAIR.HE WAS UNCONSCIOUS FOR ABOUT 30 SECONDS. HE THEN BEGAN TO REGAIN CONSIOUSNESS AND WAS RESPONSIVE AND ANSWERED QUESTIONS APPROPRIATELY. WE GAVE HIM ORANGE JUICE AND BOTTLED WATER AND OBSERVED HIM FOR 40 MINUTES. HE REFUSED MEDICAL TRANSPORT, BUT REMAINED IN THE VICINITY FOR ABOUT 30 MINUTES LONGER. PULSE RETURNED TO 78bpm, AND COLOR WAS NORMAL BEFORE PATIENT LEFT THE PHARMAC AREA.

24 2021-01-07 posture abnormal Patient walked out fine after receiving the vaccine. Was able to walk up to the registration desk an... Read more
Close
Patient walked out fine after receiving the vaccine. Was able to walk up to the registration desk and carried a conversation with the staffs. He sits down in the waiting area to be monitored. We heard his phone dropped, looked up and saw him tilting over on the right side was about to fall off the chair. Staff grabbed him and held him back onto the seat, proceeded to picked up his right arm and held him in place. He looked unconscious while staff held him. He came back to his senses approximately 10 seconds later. After he regained consciousness, staff took his blood pressure which was 111/44, SpO2 was 100%, and heart rate 58. Patient looked pale but not critical. Conversed with our staff and stated that this has happened before when he receives other vaccinations. Patient's father is a physician and reported that the patient is scared of needles and did not need any medications from anaphylaxis kit or crash cart. We gave him water and he left after sitting for a while.

24 2021-01-27 dizziness I got my second pfizer vaccine 0n 1/27/21 at 10 am. I had no reactions at all after the injection w... Read more
Close
I got my second pfizer vaccine 0n 1/27/21 at 10 am. I had no reactions at all after the injection was given. I waited for 30 minutes and was perfectly fine. Around 5 pm I started to feel symptoms. I got the worst aches in my entire body i've ever felt before, along with chills. I felt extremely hot, I took my temperature and had a fever of 102.3. I felt dizzy, lightheaded, and nauseas . My head was throbbing. I ended up taking 1000mg of tylenol to help reduce the fever, which seemed to really help. I fell asleep and woke up the next morning drenched in sweat. My fever was gone, but I still had a horrible headache and threw up from the nausea I was having. It felt like I had a horrible hangover.

24 2021-02-24 dizziness, gait inability unable to bear weight on legs/could not walk or bear weight; shortness of breath; fever; nausea/naus... Read more
Close
unable to bear weight on legs/could not walk or bear weight; shortness of breath; fever; nausea/nauseous; pain in left shoulder radiating to left chest 4/10; Chest pain at the side 5/10; tried to get up to walk but was very shaky and could not get up to walk/unable to walk/could not walk or bear weight; dizzy/light headed; almost instantly was sharp stinging in injection site; tried to get up to walk but was very shaky and could not get up to walk; WBC 14000, no unit of measurement, normal was 11000; This is a spontaneous report received from a contactable pharmacist and consumer (patient). A 24-year-old male patient received second dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE; Solution for injection; lot number: EL3302 and expiry date: May2021), via intramuscular route on deltoid left on 25Jan2021 15:57 at 0.3 ml single for COVID-19 immunization at hospital. Patient did not receive other vaccine in four weeks and in last two weeks. Patient's medical history, family medical history and concomitant medications were reported as none. Patient had no known allergies. Historical vaccine included BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE; lot number; EL1284; expiry date: Apr2021) via intramuscular route on left deltoid on 04Jan2021 at 10:45 AM for COVID-19 immunization; Hep B Adult Energix-BPFS (HEPATITIS B VACCINE, lot number; 2793Z) on left deltoid on 12Jan2021. Patient received 3 previous doses of HEPATITIS B VACCINE. It was reported that, the patient complained of pain in left shoulder radiating to left chest 4/10 and nausea immediately following injection, Chest pain at the side 5/10 (on 25Jan2021 at 14;00, after second dose of COVID vaccine). Taken to the ED (emergency department) via wheelchair at 1700. No rash, no swelling of lips/tongue or throat. No treatment was given for the events nausea and pain in left shoulder. No COVID was presented prior vaccination and post vaccination. Patient stated almost instantly was sharp stinging in injection site, he felt nauseous, dizzy, light headed, and had chest pains, he tried to get up to walk but was very shaky and could not get up to walk on25Jan2021 at 14:00. Stated that he was wheeled to the emergency room, he was admitted to the emergency room for almost 8 hours. Clarified he was not admitted to the hospital that he did leave that night. He was able to stumble out of the emergency room to go home. Clarified he got the vaccine on 25Jan2021 (his second dose). Stated he woke up next morning on 26Jan2021, unable to bear weight on legs, chest pain, and shortness of breath, fever. HCP prescribed Arnuity for the chest pain. WBC 14000, no unit of measurement, normal was 11000. Patient was unable to walk, nausea, dizzy, lightheaded and having some chest pain and patient was not hospitalized, spent 8 hours in Emergency Room. Outcome of the event fever was recovered on 27Jan2021; nausea, dizziness, was recovered on 31Jan2021; Unable to walk, lower extremities weakness of, shortness of breath was recovering; the event chest pain was not recovered; and for remaining events it was unknown.

After previously feeling no side effects, at 3am the day following the vaccine I awoke with chills, dizziness, fatigue, whole body arthralgias that I can only describe as feeling like my bedsheets felt like broken glass. Around 6am I measured my axillary temperature to be 100.9 F and took 650 Tylenol once which broke the fever. I was unable to go in to work that day. Now, two days after the vaccine, my other symptoms have resolved aside from a painful, and visibly noticable, lymph adenopathy in my left arm pit the same side as the vaccine.

24 2021-03-29 dizziness Lightheadedness
24 2021-03-29 mobility decreased got up about 5:15AM to use the restroom, parents heard a huge crash and we came running - he had col... Read more
Close
got up about 5:15AM to use the restroom, parents heard a huge crash and we came running - he had collapsed and fainted in the bathroom, against the toilet, (with shelves and glass crashing down him - he grabbed the shelves and had a few cuts and bruises), was unresponsive, no color in his face, could not stand or move, could barely speak - slumped against the toilet. Parents called 911 and tried to get him to respond, he was listless but opened his eyes - we lifted him and moved him to recliner in living room. Fire Dept./EMT's arrived within a few minutes, blood pressure was 87/43, glucose was normal. EMT's determined it was a reaction to the vaccine and asked if he wanted an ambulance or if parents should drive him for further care - he opted for us to drive him (his Mom called the Dr. on staff first - Dr. said it was a reaction to the vaccine and he should not get a 2nd dose). Patient's Dad took him to Urgent Care - they ran an EKG (normal), and stayed there until his blood pressure showed (although still low) normal/acceptable again. I looked at the CDC website for covid anaphylaxis and it appears it was an allergic reaction (cardiovascular), on the site, he had these symptoms: "Cardiovascular: fainting; hypotension (abnormally low blood pressure); pallor. ... Symptoms of anaphylaxis often occur within 15-30 minutes of vaccination, though it can sometimes take several hours for symptoms to appear."

24 2021-04-01 dizziness 24-year-old white male visited the vaccine clinic this morning. At 09:36 Am patient received the fir... Read more
Close
24-year-old white male visited the vaccine clinic this morning. At 09:36 Am patient received the first dose 0.3ml of Pfizer vaccine lot #ER8734 to his left Deltoid . At 09:46 AM While patient in the observation area, he complained of feeling light headed and not feeling to well. While assessing the patient, he had a syncopial episode with eyes fixed, jerking body movement for 5-10 seconds. Patient immediately assisted the floor , all safety measure provided. Oxygen applied. VS: BP 100/60, o2 sat 98% . Pulse 78, resp 18. Patient denies any medical condition. However, he sated" I usually pass out when I take shots" . 10:00 Am sitting Blood pressure 110/72. Patient condition improved, and assisted back to chair. At 10:05AM still complaining of light headedness and requested to lay back to floor. Blood Pressure supinely 100/80. Patient stated " i feel much better when I am laying down. Water provided as requested. Pos t po fluid patient voiced feel much better. Sitting blood pressure rechecked at 10:14 am BP 110/80. Patient assisted back to chair. Closed observation maintained. 10:29 am Patient stated " I am feeling 100% of myself now, standing blood pressure 130/80. Patient denies any further light headed. Patient instructed to follow with his Primary Physician also his was referred for his second dose of vaccine . Patient left clinic in stable condition.
24 2021-04-01 fall On Friday, April 4, 2021 client (DOB 5/3/1996) received his first dose of Pfizer COVID vaccine (LOT... Read more
Close
On Friday, April 4, 2021 client (DOB 5/3/1996) received his first dose of Pfizer COVID vaccine (LOT # EW0150, EXP 7/2021) at approximately 12:56pm. Per EMT report: at 1:06pm, client fell out of chair, landed on his left knee and regained consciousness immediately. Upon assessment, client stated his left knee pain was a 3 out of 10 scale. At 1:07pm, client was sat in the zero-gravity chair in supine position and given a bottle of water. Client stated he "felt pressure in ears-mainly right ear." EMT & 2nd EMT coached client to breathe normally. At 1:09pm vitals were taken: BP: 120/70, HR: 52, RR: 10, O2 sat: 95%, skin: pale, moist, cool, eyes: PERRLA, LOC: A&O x4. Lead RN was notified and advised vitals be taken every 5 minutes for an additional 30 minutes. At 1:13pm vitals were retaken: BP: 120/70, HR: 69, RR: 12, O2 sat: 94%, eyes: PERRLA, skin, pale, moist, cool, LOC: A&O x4. On assessment, client stated he has no history of fainting, no allergies, and not taking any medication. Client stated he had a small amount of food and water intake and was not currently experiencing nausea. At 1:20pm, client stated the pressure in his ear subsided and was experiencing no headache, light-headedness or dizziness. At 1:25pm vitals were retaken: BP: 120/70, HR: 69, O2: 98%, skin: warm, pink, dry, LOC: A&Ox4. At 1:35pm, vitals: BP: 120/78, HR: 72, RR: 12, O2: 96%. Client was lowered to sitting position in gravity chair. No changes in vital signs were assessed by EMTs. At 1:40pm one final set of vitals were taken: BP: 120/76, HR: 66, RR: 13, O2 sat: 97%, eyes: PERRLA, A&O x4, skin: pink, warm & dry. At 2:15pm, client was able to safely stand up. No further interventions indicated. Client was educated by Lead RN & EMT on signs and symptoms of adverse reactions and when to go to the ED/call MD. Client was also encouraged to sign-up. Client left vaccination site at approximately 2:15pm with a steady gait. A family member was able to pick him up and drive him home.

24 2021-04-17 dizziness Significant fogginess of brain which has only worsened and is still lingering to now (4/18/21). Simu... Read more
Close
Significant fogginess of brain which has only worsened and is still lingering to now (4/18/21). Simultaneously this is mixed with fatigue regardless of how much sleep I get or water that I drink. Less frequently I have symptoms like eyes burning (similar to bad allergies), slight dizziness, minor headaches, and minor body aches. The fatigue and brain fog are by far the worst and still persist, the others listed are minor but still come and go in small amounts. On Wednesday (4/14) I took Zyrtec (10mg tablet) to help focus throughout the day then one ibuprofen tablet (200mg) at night, and on Friday (4/16) I only took the Zyrtec. Since then I have not taken any medications. The symptoms were alleviated by the medication but without them all symptoms come and go to varying degrees throughout the day and worsen by night time.

Close

A 24-years-old male patient received bnt162b2 (BNT162B2, PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE; Formulation: Solution for injection, Lot number: Batch/Lot Number: ER2613; Expiration Date: unknown), dose 1 intramuscular, administered in Arm Left on 30Mar2021 14:30 as SINGLE DOSE for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history included syncope, High blood pressure, Prone to fainting during medical procedures, Bell's palsy on 25Mar2021 with the outcome of not recovered. The patient didn't receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. Since the vaccination, the patient was tested for Covid-19 was unknown. The patient was not diagnosed with covid-19 prior to vaccination. The patient's concomitant medications were not reported. No allergies to medications, food, or other products. On 30Mar2021 14:45 the patient experienced light headedness and proceeds to faint onto the floor while pharmacy tech assists to prevent harm. The outcome of the event light headedness and proceeds to faint onto the floor was recovered. No follow-up attempts are needed. No further information is expected.

Patient received first vaccination dose and immediately reported feeling faint and "blacking out" to nurse administrating vaccination. Nurse instructed patient to lay down and prop legs on chair. Per Fire Rescue no further evaluation needed at scene. Client released at 10:45am.

Close
Pt was found on floor after falling from chair. Pt was shaking and jerking while on the floor with possible seizure activity that lasted approx. 3-5 seconds. Patient sat up on his own and was confused and alert. Once patient became more coherent, he was able to answer questions. Alert and oriented x3. Abrasion noted to left side of face. Vital signs obtained with BP 110/78, HR57, 02 100% on room air. Patient was warm to touch. Cool compresses applied to neck and back areas. Patient stated he, "thought he fell asleep and when he awoke all the people around startled him." Patient refused EMS care and transportation to hospital. 2nd set of vital signs obtained with BP 106/78, HR 70, O2 100% on room air. Mother was contacted about incident. Patient was monitored for an additional 30 mins. After the additional monitoring, patient insisted that he felt better and ambulated to lobby to self. At time of exit, patient was alert and oriented x3.
24 2021-04-28 dizziness fell out completely; passed out/fell off at the store; feeling dizzy; had terrible headache; chills;... Read more
Close
fell out completely; passed out/fell off at the store; feeling dizzy; had terrible headache; chills; weak with shilling; i started sweating; I'm still feeling very sick; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 24-year-old male patient received first dose of bnt162b2 ((PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE; lot EW0158; Expiration Date: Jul2021), via an unspecified route of administration, administered in left arm on 14Apr2021 12:00 as single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included eye allergy. Concomitant medication included amoxicillin sodium, clavulanate potassium (AMOXICILINA CLAV) taken for eye allergy from 12Apr2021. On 14Apr2021, he received the first dose of the vaccine about an hour ago and waited five minutes and went to the bathroom. He had a severe reaction while patient was in the bathroom, he started to feel dizzy, had a terrible headache and chills. He walked out of the bathroom at the store and fell out completely in front of the pharmacists. The patient also experienced weak with shilling (as reported) and started sweating. The pharmacists called 911 and the responders checked his vitals and blood pressure and all of that and everything was fine. Patient clarified he passed out completely for almost 5 minutes. Patient stayed there with everyone until, they were waiting to see how he was doing. He reported he was feeling much better now, still feel a bit dizzy, not 100% but not as bad as when it happened. It has improved and he definitely felt terrible at the time. He was monitoring himself at home to see if he notices something weird going on. He does not have a headache right now and was feeling much better. When he was having the effect, he was mentally sharp, and knew what was going on. He thought about letting himself walk outside the bathroom so he could be seen. He didn't lose track of what was going on and body reacted adversely. He remembered stuff and everything and he felt good. Patient stated the chills went away; however, would not say they went away completely, he was recovering. The events did not require a visit to emergency room or physician office and the paramedic said it was not necessary right now because all the vitals and everything else seemed fine. There was no therapy received for the events. There were no additional vaccines administered on same date of the vaccine and no other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to vaccination. Prior to vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19 and since the vaccination, the patient had not been tested for COVID-19. Outcome of events feeling dizzy, terrible headache, chills was recovering; still feeling very sick was unknown; outcome of the rest of events was not recovered.

24 2021-05-04 fall Around 12:05pm on 5/5/21, Five minutes after receiving the vaccine, the patient fainted while in the... Read more
Close
Around 12:05pm on 5/5/21, Five minutes after receiving the vaccine, the patient fainted while in the waiting room. We came out to assist and at that point the patient was already sitting up, but on the floor. We were able to speak to him and gave him some water to drink. We called 911, when we were aware he had fainted. I was the pharmacist on duty, but not the one that vaccinated him. So I stayed with him. There was a moment when he took his sweater off saying he was hot, and I saw sweat bullets on his forehead. So I got some paper towels for him and took his temperature, which read around 98 degrees. A few seconds later he turned pale and fell over, hitting his head on one of the shelves. I quickly got him off the shelf and held his head in my arms . He opened his eyes and started talking and wanting to sit up, but we kept him laying down and continued to ask him questions to keep him alert. He was able to answer the questions, knew where he was, who he was, who he was with . The paramedics then arrived and he was taken out of the store on a stretcher. We provided a copy of the report he filled out to the paramedics .
24 2021-05-04 mobility decreased, balance disorder He states he had the first Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine in the series on 4/13/2021. He states that two d... Read more
Close
He states he had the first Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine in the series on 4/13/2021. He states that two days later on 4/15/2021 he felt like his feet were heavy. He continues to experience that sensation in his feet, and even feeling like his feet are asleep at nighttime and when he first gets up in the morning. The asleep feeling in the feet gets better when he gets up and moves around but the heavy sensation in the legs does not get better. He states that his mobility is affected though that his legs feel heavy and he is not as easily mobile as he used to be. He feels his balance is off. Patient later reported that he did have and episode of syncope about 5 minutes after he got the vaccine but otherwise was doing okay until 4/15/2021. He presented to the ED with these symptoms on 5/3/2021 at approximately 7:14pm and was admitted to the hospital for evaluation. Patient states that he normally exercises regularly and has been having a great deal of difficulty especially with squatting and now has difficulty walking up stairs, feels very weak and his legs feel heavy. He reports that the numbness and tingling sensation of his feet when sleeping is new and he has never had it in the past. Symptoms get worse with exertion and prolonged activity. Neurologist was consulted and several tests were ordered. Neurology consult noted that patient had a prior COVID 19 infection in November 2020. Per neurologist notes: His symptoms first started about two days after he received Pfizer COVID vaccine on April 13, 2021. He recalled feeling his feet heaviness and it was hard to pick them up. He also had some calf pain. He also had difficulty with doing his stretches and yoga positioning. A week ago, he began to have difficulty with picking up a ball or anything from the ground. He also developed pins and needles at the fingertips at the same time he developed tingling sensation of his feet. He also has lower back pain. He tested positive for SARS-COV-2 antigen on November 12, 2020. He recalled having symptoms lasting for a few days consisting of diaphoresis, cough, and flu-like symptoms. Per neurologist, symptoms seem to resemble acute inflammatory demyelinating polyneuropathy (AIDP). Patient was treated with IVIG for 5 days.

24 2021-05-13 dizziness On Thursday May 13th, 2021, patient arrived to receive his first Pfizer vaccination. Patient was va... Read more
Close
On Thursday May 13th, 2021, patient arrived to receive his first Pfizer vaccination. Patient was vaccinated and sent to the observation area. At 1342, the patient stated," I feel dizzy, like I might pass out," to EMT observer. EMT observer immediately assisted the patient to the gravity chair. The patient's vital signs were taken: BP 110/72, HR 84, RR 15, oxygen saturation at 96% . The patient was alert and oriented to person, place, time, and situation. The patient was given water and stated, " I feel so much better after sitting in this chair." No loss of consciousness or syncope occurred. The patient was given a bottle of water. Co-lead, assessed the patient, who was alert and oriented to person, place, time, and situation, was in no apparent distress, and was speaking in full sentences. No pallor or diaphoresis was observed. Vitals were taken at 1347: BP 108/70, HR 63, RR 14, oxygen saturation at 99%. The patient took off his mask to reduce anxiety. Denied any history of fainting. or having any known drug allergies. Vitals were retaken at 1352: BP 120/68, HR 63, RR 14 ,oxygen saturation at 98%. The patient was offered a granola bar but denied it, as he ate around 1230. Patient denied any shortness of breath, blurry vision, lightheadedness, dizziness, itching, nausea, or facial flushing. The patient stated, " I feel totally fine." Vitals were retaken at 1357, BP 120/70, RR: 14, HR 63, and oxygen saturation at 98%. Notified patient to inform the vaccinator about his reaction when returning for his second Pfizer dose. Vital retaken at 1402, BP 125/ 68, RR 14, HR 63, 98% oxygen saturation. The patient felt comfortable to drive home and left the site at 1405. The patient left the site with an even and steady gait.

24 2021-05-16 fall, dizziness Client received vaccine at 9:35am. Client was immediately syncopal and fell and hit head on floor. R... Read more
Close
Client received vaccine at 9:35am. Client was immediately syncopal and fell and hit head on floor. RN who administered vaccine noted possible brief tonic clonic activity during syncope. Patient pale and sweating. Client awoke within seconds after fall and was panicked and trying to stand back up. RNs reassured patient and helped patient back into safe lying position. Legs were elevated, VS assessed, ice applied to back of head. No bleeding noted. When patient felt ready and was alert/oriented, nurse raised patient to sitting position and moved into wheelchair. Patient still pale and sweating. Lead RN called EMS due to concern for potential head injury with fall. Patient states that he is lightheaded again and loses consciousness again in wheelchair as RN and EMT are wheeling patient out to be received by EMS squad. EMT supporting patient airway during second LOC - RN notes that airway support (with EMT hands) may be too tight as patient red faced and some throat gurgling. EMT adjusts grip. Patient regains consciousness within 1-2 minutes after second LOC. Patient disoriented - is able to say why he is there and what his name was but cannot remember his age. EMS arrives and takes over care. EMS assessed patient and recommended to transport patient to ED for further assessment. Patient refuses transport to the hospital. EMS squad waits with patient until family member arrives. Patient states family member will transport to hospital. Patient leaves clinic site with family member in car. First set of vitals/assessment after first LOC at 0940 142/96 BP; 74 pulse; 16 respirations; 97% spO2; 97.7 temp; PERRLA. No bleeding on head; scrape noted L elbow. EMS was called at 9:49am. EMS arrived at 9:54am. Patient states no major medical history, not on any meds. Patient has fainted one time previously after broken thumb.
