Pt complained of dizziness, racing heart rate, face swelling/numbness and throat tightness. Zyrtec 10mg given. MD recommended epinephrine injection. Patient refused. EMT called to bedside for EKG. MD recommends transfer via ambulance to ER. Patient declined after thorough education of importance of going to ER. Patient declined and signed to leave Against Medical Advise.
24 2021-05-19 decreased mobility 24-year-old male with no prior medical problems presents for evaluation of chest pain. Patient comp... Read more
Close
24-year-old male with no prior medical problems presents for evaluation of chest pain. Patient complains of midsternal chest pain that started approximately an hour ago. He states that it woke him up from sleep. Pain is sharp without any radiation or other associated symptoms including diaphoresis presyncopal symptoms or palpitations. He denies any significant air hunger or shortness of breath. He otherwise had been feeling better after what he tall was post COVID vaccine symptoms. Patient received a 2nd dose of pfizer vaccine 3 days ago. He states that within 24 hours he had symptoms of myalgia fever and feeling unwell. That has been resolving patient has been feeling better until the chest pain today. Patient otherwise denies any other medical problems in. He denies any history of drug use including any recent cocaine or other drug abuse. Elevated cardiac enzymes and chest discomfort are likely secondary to myocarditis and secondary to vaccination/ inflammatory reaction. Although there is low likelihood of obstructive coronary artery disease as well. I recommended cardiac catheterization for clarification. He does not want to have the procedure done, understands the risk of undiagnosed coronary artery disease and risk of MI. He would like to be discharged home. I reviewed the images of echocardiogram and it seems that he has a small area of hypokinesis in infero basal segment. Recommended to take aspirin and be seen in Cardiology office in 2 weeks. Advised to abstain from exercise and significant physical activity till that time and return to the hospital if any symptoms. Subjective: I saw patient in consultation for evaluation of chest pain and elevated cardiac enzymes. Patient is a 24-year-old healthy male who had COVID-19 vaccination with his second Pfizer shot 4/14/21. He developed fever, chills, nausea and vomiting 1 day after vaccination. He did not have any reaction to the 1st dose. He presented to the hospital with substernal chest discomfort which woke him up from sleep, radiated to throat and had a throbbing feeling. This lasted for 1 to 2 hours and subsided completely in the hospital. He smokes 5 cigarettes a day, is physically very active and exercises regularly. He is not on any medication at home.
24 2021-05-20 dizziness, fall Patient received the COVID vaccine (Pfizer dose 1, lot #EW0182, expiration date 05/22/2021) in his l... Read more
Close
Patient received the COVID vaccine (Pfizer dose 1, lot #EW0182, expiration date 05/22/2021) in his left deltoid at 1425. At 1428, as the pt was walking to the observation area, he was observed falling to the ground. The pt?s girlfriend, protected his head from hitting the ground. EMT staff, Lead RN, and Co-Lead RN responded at 1429. The pt?s girlfriend, told the staff that he was passed out for about 10-15 seconds. Upon arrival from staff, the pt was responsive and alert and oriented x4. The pt denied any pain in his head, difficulty breathing or SOB. Pupils were equal and reactive to light and the client was very diaphoretic (sweaty). At 1430, vital signs were BP: 122/58, P: 55, O2: 97%, and RR: 20. The pt denied history of seizures, any other medical history, allergies and takes no medications. The pt stated ?I am afraid of needles but have never fainted after a vaccine or blood draw?. The pt mentioned the last time he ate was breakfast at 0930. At 1435, the pt no longer felt dizzy or lightheaded and walked over to the observation area to sit in the anti-gravity chair. At 1435, the pt finished a granola bar and juice. Vital signs were taken again at 1445, BP: 128/75, P: 85, O2: 98%, and RR: 16. Lead RN and Co-Lead RN educated the pt on signs and symptoms of adverse reactions and when to go to the ED/call MD. Pt was also educated on sitting in the anti-gravity chair for his second dose of Pfizer. Pt left facility at 1447 walking with a steady gait with girlfriend, pt?s mother picked them up.

Close
Systemic: Dizziness / Lightheadness-Medium, Systemic: Fainting / Unresponsive-Severe, Additional Details: patient felt normal immediately after vaccine, remained sitting for about 3 minutes and then stood up and told me he felt like he was going to faint. i told him to sit back down and as soon as he sat, he fainted and head went back. patient was unresponsive for about 60 seconds and then came to and felt ok. i did call 911 and EMS assessed patient and gave him the OK to leave. patient told me after the incident that this occurs regularly when he sees needles.
24 2021-05-25 fall MYOCARDITIS. I experienced extreme chest pain, tightness, shortness of breath, painful heart beats,... Read more
Close
MYOCARDITIS. I experienced extreme chest pain, tightness, shortness of breath, painful heart beats, I could feel each beat. I hunched over in my bed groom grabbing my abdomen and fell onto my bed and almost passed out from whack I?d assume is lack of oxygen. I could barely breathe for about five minutes and felt relatively severe pain particularly in the right side of my chest. I could feel every muscle, tendon, and artery inflamed, enlarged, and hurting. My chest felt like it filled up with a balloon. Heart rate went up too. I have NEVER EVER felt ANYTHING like this in my LIFE. Not even close. It was a brand new sensation to me first time I?ve ever felt anything like this at all, and very intense and frustrating. Keeping in mind I am in perfect health. I am a body builder with a perfect physique. I work at a high end restaurant and have an extremely good diet. I have a normal sleep and sexual routine, I don?t use any medications whatsoever even Tylenol or ibuprofen. I have no pre existing conditions. I have no history of heart or cardio problems. My family has a history of low blood pressure. I have next to no stress or anxiety in my life. I am 24 years old I work out and run miles, five to six days a week. I don?t use nicotine, tobacco, and I haven?t had a drink of alcohol in ten years (14yrs old). I smoke marijuana on a daily basis. After about ten minutes the incident went down and I was able to breathe a little better but still had pain and tightness in my chest. I have had shortness of breath ever since. This is being written the day after the event about 26 hours later. I ran a mile last night and went to the gym it seemed to help both my breathing and the pain and tightness but it has not fully gone away. I feel my heart straining somehow as I am typing this. One thing to note is I did not want to get vaccinated but was pressured to do so, and before getting it I was very nervous and honestly upset. The woman administering it was not helpful at all and actually mocked my unsureness and was very rude and unprofessional. She didn?t answer any technical questions I had. During my interaction with her between my nerves and her behavior I?m absolutely certain my heart rate was elevated at the time of getting the shot. I have only had one shot. The episode of myocarditis occurred two weeks after my first shot. Two days after my scheduled second shot, which I missed because of work and was going to reschedule before this occurred. I am not going to be getting the second shot. Will be following up with my primary care doctor as soon as possible. Haven?t had time.

Close
Patient received the vaccine around 9:38 AM and was placed in a chair for observation. Within 3 minutes the patient had fallen onto the floor on his side out of the chair. The pharmacist on duty at the time myself ran over and asked patient if he was ok and touched his shoulder. The patient regained consciousness and was moved to the vaccination room and put feet up for evaluation. The patient loss consciousness for 10 more seconds. Vitals were taken immediately (see below) and patient was interviewed for adr's. Patient had extreme diaphoresis, said he had no diplopia but did have blurred vision . Patient said his head hurt and was given 500 mg apap for one dose. He said his ears were hot. Patient said he had no pain other than his head hurting. Patient had no uticaria or redness . Patient appeared pale. He was given extensive amounts of water and a snack. He said that sounds were slightly muted. He said he had senstivity to lights.

A 24-year-old male patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE), dose 1 via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Arm Left on 20May2021 10:30 at age of 24 years old, (Lot Number: W01768721) as 1st dose, single for covid-19 immunisation. Medical history included known allergies: Augmentin. Any other medications the patient received within 2 weeks of vaccination was none. Clinical course reported that: Passed out roughly 4 minutes after injection. Woke up after 2 minutes sweating. Low bpm afterwards when paramedic showed up (30-40). 2 IV bags administered. EKG showed PVC of heart. Still have dizziness and disorientation as well as low energy and weakness 4 days later. Adverse events onset date reported as 20May2021 10:30 AM. Events resulted in Doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit, Emergency room/department or urgent care. Outcome for events was not recovered. The patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19 prior to vaccination, and since the vaccination, the patient has not been tested for COVID-19. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. Information on Lot/Batch number was available. Additional information has been requested.

Close
Days following dose 2, I began having fluid retention and elevated blood pressure. Over time, it has worsened. I am now having dizzy spells that can last 10 minutes to 6 hours up to twice a day, confusion/brain fog and heart flutters/elevated heart rate usually accompanied with fatigue. My previous doctor treated me by increasing the metoprolol and adding hydrochlorothiazide for fluid retention. I saw a new healthcare provider who is sending me to a cardiologist, neurologist, lipidologist and endocrinologist to figure out what is going on. I can not function in daily life. I cannot stand when dizzy and cannot drive. Symptoms appear to be worsening. In the meantime, he prescribed Ubrelvy to rule out migraines. None of this appeared until after dose 2 of Pfizer.

passed out; feeling dizzy; fell out of his chair on to the ground; B/P 136/90; BGL 148; feeling nauseous; tingly feeling in arm and chest; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable Hcp. A 24-years-old male patient received bnt162b2 (BNT162B2), dose 1 intramuscular on 31May2021 11:45 (Lot Number: EW0171) at 24-years-old as 1st dose, single for covid-19 immunisation. The patient medical history was not reported. The patient's concomitant medications were not reported. On 31May2021, the patient waiting in observation and started feeling dizzy then passed out and fell out of his chair on to the ground. Obtained baseline vitals B/P 136/90, BGL 148, O2 96% pulse 69 PT was alert immediately after falling we gave water and observed further got another set of vitals B/P 120/78 02 started feeling nauseous and called 911. overall felt nauseous and tingly feeling in arm and chest no pain, and passed out. The patient received first aid for events. The outcome of events was recovered on 31May2021.; Sender's Comments: Based on known drug safety profile, there is reasonable possibility of causal association between the events Loss of consciousness, Dizziness, Fall, Blood pressure increased, Blood glucose increased, Nausea, Paraesthesia and the suspect drug BNT162B2. Based on known drug safety profile, there is reasonable possibility of causal association between the event Loss of consciousness, Dizziness, Fall, Blood pressure increased, Blood glucose increased, Nausea and Paresthesia the suspect drug BNT162B2. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to regulatory authorities, Ethics Committees, and Investigators, as appropriate.

24 2021-06-21 dizziness At 1620, pt. received Pfizer vaccine administered by RN at clinic. Pt. was sent to observation area,... Read more
Close
At 1620, pt. received Pfizer vaccine administered by RN at clinic. Pt. was sent to observation area, which is in the cafeteria. At 1625, Support staff checked on pt. and pt. reported he felt dizzy and immediately informed RNs. Pt. was sitting on the chair and drinking water when this incident occurred. During assessment, pt. was found diaphoretic, pale in skin color, pt. reported blurry vision, and trouble breathing. Pt. respirations rate was 16 breaths per minute, non-labored, no signs of any distress. Pt. stated no prior medical history. After a few minutes, pt. started to recover. Pt. skin color started to improve and less diaphoretic. At 1629, EMS called by RN. Pt was moved to another area away from other patients. Pt. was able to ambulate, follow commands/ directions without any deficits. At 1637, EMS arrived, pt. vitals was taken BP=100/50's and stable. Pt. refused to go to the hospital for further observation. RN stayed with pt. until 1700. Pt. was given some snacks and drinks (gatorade and water). Pt. was moved across the nurses' vaccination table for further monitoring. Pt. fully recovered and left to go home at 1732.
24 2021-06-21 dizziness approximately 2 minutes after patient received vaccine he yelled out "I'm going to faint" and he lai... Read more
Close
approximately 2 minutes after patient received vaccine he yelled out "I'm going to faint" and he laid down in supine position on floor and went unconscious. 2 staff members responded and positioned head to maintain his airway. He was breathing and had pulse and was very pale. EMS was called. It took approximately 90 seconds for patient to become conscious again. Cool cloth applied to head and verbal reassurance given to patient. Pt denied any injury. Pt stated he has fainted before with blood draws. EMS arrived and evaluated pt and found his vital signs and heart rhythm stable. Pt declined transport to hospital. Pts girlfriend came to drive him home. He remained sitting in pharmacy waiting area for approximately 1 hour. He had food and water before leaving.

Close
At 1348 client approached EMT to ask if neck tension was normal. EMT did first set of vitals and assessment. Vitals at 1348: blood pressure 148/100, pulse 79, oxygen sat 99%. Per client "slight dizziness" and headache. EMT gave client water. PHN arrived at 1353. Client sitting upright in chair, alert and oriented x4. Medical history of TMJ and headaches, no daily medications and no known allergies. At 1355 client states "slight pressure on chest". Client denied shortness of breath, blurry vision, chest pain. Per client headache 1/10 pain, chest pressure also 1-2/10. PHN offered client paramedics for further assessment and client declined. Vitals at 1400: blood pressure 150/102, pulse 84, oxygen sat 98%. Client reported dizziness and headache improving. Chest pressure 1/10. Client alert and oriented x4. Vitals at 1407: blood pressure 146/92, pulse 77, oxygen sat 98%. Per client headache, dizziness and chest pressure improving. Client described chest pressure as "anything mild". Vitals at 1414: blood pressure 150/98, pulse 74, oxygen sat 98%. Client reported to PHN feeling stressed due to work. Per client headaches are common for him. At 1417 client stated chest pressure "back to normal". Client denied chest pain, blurry vision, shortness of breath, or dizziness. PHN advised client to follow up with provider and gave ER precautions. Last vitals at 1424: blood pressure 142/99, pulse 72, oxygen sat 99%. PHN asked client if someone could drive him home. Client stated he "felt fine to drive". Client left facility with steady gait at 1428.

patient passed out approximately 9 minutes after receiving his 1st dose of Pfizer vaccine. he left his 15 minute observation period and became light headed as he passed out while on his walk to the bathroom in the facility he received his vaccine in. he did not hit his head or otherwise injure himself during the fall. patient stated that he has a history of passing out after receiving dental work novocaine injections but did not tell this to the vaccine administrator when prompted to detail his "unsure" response to the question, "have you ever had an allergic reaction or fainted after receiving a vaccine or an injectable medication" on the vaccine consent questionnaire. This information was provided to me by the patient after he passed out and we were asking him questions. He felt fine and was taken back to the pharmacy for an additional 20 minutes of observation and provided him with a bottle of water. he felt fine and left without incident after this observation period.

General Malaise; fatigue; light nausea; light headache; dizziness on and off; blotchy red itchy rash on neck, chest, sides, and back; blotchy red itchy rash on neck, chest, sides, and back; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable other healthcare professional (HCP) (patient). A 25-year-old male patient received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE), intramuscularly on right arm on 29Dec2020 at 01:45 PM at single dose for COVID-19 immunization. The relevant medical history included asthma and COVID-19 (Prior to vaccination, was the patient diagnosed with COVID-19?: Yes). Concomitant medications included emtricitabine, tenofovir alafenamide fumarate (DESCOVY), fish oil, vitamin b complex, lisdexamfetamine mesilate (VYVANSE), cetirizine hydrochloride (ZYRTEC), all from Dec2020. The patient experienced general malaise, fatigue, light nausea, light headache, dizziness on and off, several hours later blotchy red itchy rash on neck, chest, sides, and back, lasted for 3-4 hours, all on 29Dec2020 at 07:00 PM. The patient had the most recent COVID-19 vaccine administered at nursing home/senior living facility. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. The patient did not receive treatment for the events. The patient had nasal swab test with unknown results on 30Dec2020. The outcome of the events was recovered with sequel. Information on the lot/batch number has been requested.
25 2021-01-07 dizziness Patient fainted in the ICU setting.; dizziness; hypotension; This is a spontaneous report from a con... Read more
Close
Patient fainted in the ICU setting.; dizziness; hypotension; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable Other HCP. A 25-year-old male patient received BNT162B2 (Lot number: eh9899) via an unspecified route of administration on 24Dec2020 13:00 at single dose for covid-19 immunisation. The patient did not have any known allergies or medical history. Prior to vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. There were no concomitant medications. On 24Dec2020, patient experienced dizziness and hypotension. Patient's blood pressure (BP) was 50/30 and heart rate (HR) 45. Patient fainted in the intensive care unit (ICU) setting. This happened during work hours while treating a patient. Patient was treated in the emergency department (ED). The adverse events resulted in emergency room/department or urgent care. It was unknown if treatment was received for the adverse event. Since the vaccination, the patient has not been tested for COVID-19. The outcome of events was recovered.; Sender's Comments: A possible contributory effect of suspect BNT162B2 on reported events cannot be excluded. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to regulatory authorities, Ethics Committees, and Investigators, as appropriate.

Close

On 12/25/2020 my doctor wanted to send me to the ER but I didn't go and on 12/26/20 everything went away I felt better.

Close
faint; Dizziness; tachycardia; BP sys: 160; HR 120+,; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient himself). A 25-year-old male patient received the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number: EL3249), via an unspecified route of administration on 22Jan2021 10:00 at single dose in left arm for COVID-19 immunization. The patient previously took diphtheria vaccine toxoid, pertussis vaccine acellular, tetanus vaccine toxoid (TDAP) on an unspecified date for immunization and had had reaction to this vaccine with swelling of arm and surrounding lymph nodes. The patient had no other medical history was reported. The patient's concomitant medications were none. The patient had no other vaccine in four weeks and no other medications in two weeks. The patient experienced dizziness, tachycardia, BP sys (systolic blood pressure): 160, HR 120+, and faint on 22Jan2021 10:30 and events result in Emergency room/department or urgent care. The outcome of the events was recovering.

Close
About 5 minutes after getting the vaccine, patient started to have tunnel vision, loss of hearing, change in LOC unable to answer where he was, he was pale, diaphoretic and unable to respond to signals patient stated he was going to pass out he was removed from the chair and placed on the floor with his legs in the air, his pulse via palpation was slow, he stated that he does not like needles and he had a similar reaction to the H1n1 vaccine . He was placed on a back board and lifted to a litter and taken to the medical obs, vital signs on arrival were 134/75, pulse72 and oxygen 100 in the right arm, @ 1830 , and at 1834 vital 148/88 HR 75 pulse ox 99 on room air. patients skin was now warm and dry, he reported that he was feeling better, at 6:35 bp 133/81, patient was then placed in a sitting position and blood pressure with position change was :143/92, pulse 68 and 99% on room air, standing after 1 minute patient was 145/87 and heart rate 78 and pulse ox 99%. Patient reported feeling better. His color had returned, he was given water and monitored for another 5 minutes.

Had some food and water, which he stated helped. He felt he was dehydrated, hungry, and fearful. Never had episode of fainting or dizziness in the past.

He was taken by EMS to a private section of the arena monitored. HR was 60, BP 85/42. Three minutes later, his heart rate was 89 beats per minute and his and BP was 105/64. Blurry vision and bilateral tinnitus resolve within 2 to 3 minutes, and his lightheadedness had resolved by 20 minutes after onset. He subsequently developed a headache after 20 minutes of monitoring.

He denies loss of consciousness also he stated ?I did not eat anything since this morning?. 25 2021-03-24 exercise tolerance decreased, mobility decreased Around 6 pm the same day of first pfizer vaccine (3/18/21), i woke up from a nap and my back hurt so... Read more
Close
Around 6 pm the same day of first pfizer vaccine (3/18/21), i woke up from a nap and my back hurt so bad that i couldn't leave the bed without falling out. My parents came and helped me out and gave me painkillers but really nothing helped. Next day, it started down my right arm (the arm NOT injected with the shot) and it started to hurt in my muscles everywhere and hasn't stopped to this day (3/25/21). Numbness and pins and needles feeling have occurred in my pinky and ring finger of right arm. Pain has now started in my knees as well after a few days from the shot. No pain killers work and I'm unable to write or type properly, or even work at my job frankly. I can't hold an object without it falling out of my hand, and when i am able to hold something, after about 2 seconds pain fills my arm. Nothing helps the pain. I saw my primary care physician on 3/25/21 and the PA said there wasn't anything to do for the intense pain i was having except take tylenol arthritis, melatonin (to help me sleep through the pain), exercise (even though it may cause me even worse pain), and a stress ball for my arm. I don't know what else to do with this pain and this was only the first round of shots.
25 2021-03-29 fall I administered the vaccine to Jake and he sat down. About two minutes later, he slumped in his chair... Read more
Close
I administered the vaccine to Jake and he sat down. About two minutes later, he slumped in his chair. My manager rushed to catch him from falling and I assisted in steadying him. He was breathing erratically, excessively diaphoretic, and his muscles were twitching frequently. His eyes were dilated and he became unresponsive. Fearing a seizure, we lowered him to the floor and turned him on his side. He became responsive and coherent again approximately one minute later and was speaking to us normally. Paramedics arrived several minutes later and took over care. He was taken to the hospital due to abnormal vital signs.

25 2021-03-31 dizziness Headache, fatigue, low grade fever, arm soreness, nausea, light headedness
25 2021-03-31 fall Patient reported to clinic for Pfizer Covid-19 vaccination. Patient did not indicate on questionnai... Read more
Close
Patient reported to clinic for Pfizer Covid-19 vaccination. Patient did not indicate on questionnaire that he had experienced fainting or severe reactions from receiving vaccinations before. About 5 seconds after receiving vaccination patient said he would like to sit for just a minute. The clinic had a designated waiting area about 25 feet away where patients sit for 15 minutes after receiving vaccination. My technician and I agreed that patient should stay seated in the same chair he was receiving the vaccination in so we would be right next to him. After 2-3 minutes I noticed the patient had his eyes closed and then his head began to nod and he started to slump down in the chair. As I went to patient's side to stabilize him he pushed his chair backwards away from me about 5 feet which caused him to roll to the right side of the chair and fall off hitting his head on the floor. My technician immediately called 911 and EMTs arrived in about 5 minutes. A bystander who was a nurse helped me roll him onto his back and we propped his legs up with 2 cushions. We took his blood pressure and pulse. Patient regained consciousness in about 30 seconds and the EMTs cleared him to stand up after about 15 minutes. After patient had recovered, patient's mother who was there with patient and other siblings stated that the whole family has fainting episodes when receiving vaccinations. I informed patient's mother and patient to please inform any future vaccinators of these fainting episodes so they can be prepared.

tunnel vision; Drop in blood pressure and heart rate; Drop in blood pressure and heart rate; dizzy; nauseous; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 25-year-old male patient received the first dose of bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE), via an unspecified route of administration administered in arm left on 19Mar2021 12:45 (Batch/Lot Number: Ep6955) as SINGLE DOSE for COVID-19 immunization. The patient had no medical history and no known allergies. Concomitant medications were not reported. He had no COVID prior vaccination and not tested post vaccination. On 19Mar2021, the patient had drop in blood pressure and heart rate, tunnel vision, dizzy, and nauseous. The patient did not receive any treatment for the events. The patient recovered from the events in Mar2021. No follow-up attempts are possible. No further information is expected.

25 2021-04-05 dizziness Patient began feeling a tightness in their throat shortly after leaving the observation area at the ... Read more
Close
Patient began feeling a tightness in their throat shortly after leaving the observation area at the vaccination clinic at 4:30 pm, but was not noticing any difficulty breathing or swallowing. After two hours, the patient was experiencing some lightheadedness as well, and requested assistance from a local urgent care clinic, where it was advised the patient should come in and be checked out. At 7:30 pm, the patient's vitals were tested and all appeared in the standard range. The patient was administered some Benadryl, Pepcid, and Decadron, all orally. An Epipen was prescribed in case of a flare-up over the next 24 hours, however after an overnight rest the symptoms have disappeared.

BP initially 87/47, HR 66. Offered water. BP recheck 104/58, 76. Lungs clear. HRR. No chest tightness, chest pain or SOB. Symptoms completely resolved. He reports episode like this in 7th grade which he think was secondary to anxiety. EMS offered to take to ED for further evaluation but he declined. His father took him home.

Shortly after receiving first vaccine, patient was waiting in line to schedule second dose. During this time, became syncopal and fell. Transported to urgent care for monitoring, and discharged in stable condition. Provider conclusion is that patient experienced a vasovagal event secondary to injection. Vaccine itself does not appear to have any correlation to the event, but given that patient was transferred to a higher level of care, will submit a VAERS report.

Pt came to in 5-10 seconds and was treated by ER team and taken to the ER for evaluation d/t being hypotensive. Pt was doing well when transferred.

He gained consciousness within seconds and was responsive. Patient reported feeling dizzy but no signs of trouble breathing or any other symptoms. EMS arrived shortly and assessed the patient. According to the EMS, patient's vitals were all normal and patient refused to go to the hospital with them because he was feeling fine.

Close
Shortly after receiving vaccination patient had a witnessed syncopal event while in a seated position. Pt fell forward from the chair sustaining a nasal injury resulting in epistaxis. EMS was called to the scene. Initial VS prior to EMS arrival was: BP138/80, HR 74, RR 16. When EMS arrived patient was moved into a seated position on the floor. Within 1 minute patient stated that they didn't feel well like they were going to pass out again, became nauseous and pale. Patient placed in supine position and repeat VS of BP: 95/53, HR 72 and RR 16. Patient was placed on EMS stretcher and transported to Hospital Emergency Department for further evaluation/treatment. *Of note, patient stated afterwards that he has passed out with prior lab draws/immunizations.*

25 2021-04-17 fall, dizziness Client received their vaccine in the vaccination room. Client ambulated independently to the observa... Read more
Close
Client received their vaccine in the vaccination room. Client ambulated independently to the observation room. Observation staff approached client and greeted them. Observation staff seated client and instructed them to notify staff if they are experiencing any symptoms. Client began to feel faint and lost consciousness before they could alert staff. Client fell forward resulting in a contusion and abrasion on their forehead and nose. EMS and Safety officer notified via radio. EMS arrived to the scene and placed client in supine position. Client regained consciousness. EMS began assessment. Vitals taken 1st BP: 98/45 Safety officer arrived to the scene. Client transferred to wheelchair and taken to EMS area. Vitals taken 2nd BP: 103/56 Client refused to be transferred to hospital. Client completed observation time in EMS area. Client able to ambulate independently to exit. Client transported home by friend. Time course, approximately 1 hour from start to finish.

25 2021-04-20 dizziness Patient is a 25 year-old Male with past medical history of nothing. Patient presented to the Center ... Read more
Close
Patient is a 25 year-old Male with past medical history of nothing. Patient presented to the Center vaccination site for their first Pfizer vaccination. Patient received vaccination at 11:02. Approximately 10 minutes after receiving vaccination patient began experiencing Dizziness. Patient did not lose consciousness. Patient did not fall, hit their head or sustain any injuries. On exam patient GENERAL: Does not appear to be in distress, is alert and fully oriented, following commands. RESP: Speaking in full sentences, no cough, no signs of respiratory distress, no audible wheezing SKIN: No visible rash or lesion. SKIN: Positive for: moist. Patient had no urticaria, angioedema, or other signs of severe allergic reaction/anaphylaxis. Patient was brought to vaccination observation area and vitals were as follows Blood pressure 95/.59 initial and now 102/64 Heart rate 69 bpm now 80 O2 saturation 100 % on room air Respiratory Rate 12 Patient was placed in supine position and legs were elevated. Patient showed rapid improvement towards complete resolution of symptoms. Patient was able to tolerate p.o. Patient was observed for at least 15 minutes after onset of symptoms. Patient reported significant improvement and was able to ambulate with steady gait. Patient requesting to return home. Patient is well appearing and repeat vital signs at time of discharge were stable.

25 2021-04-25 dizziness Nurse at clinic incorrectly diluted a Pfizer vaccine vial with 0.8 ml of sodium chloride instead of ... Read more
Close
Nurse at clinic incorrectly diluted a Pfizer vaccine vial with 0.8 ml of sodium chloride instead of 1.8 ml of sodium chloride and administered 0.3 ml to the patient. The patient experienced 104 degree fever with vomiting, dizziness and extreme muscle joint pain. We explained to him that we noticed the dose he was given had been diluted improperly and he had received a slightly higher than normal dose. I apologized for the incident and he said ?it?s ok?, and that now he knew why he was so sick. He was very pleasant and appreciative of us trying to contact him over the weekend. He was encouraged to contact us with any questions or if any new symptoms arise. We also offered to have one of our providers contact him to discuss further, but he declined.

25 2021-04-27 dizziness, fall The patient reported that they were experiencing tightness in their arm and believed it swelled init... Read more
Close
The patient reported that they were experiencing tightness in their arm and believed it swelled initially. They left the pharmacy area and went to get Tylenol that was recommended by the pharmacist. They then began to get lightheaded and had syncope, attempted to get back up and the cashier asked to if they wanted to sit, but fell again. It was not clear initially to the employee who was helping them they had received the vaccine. 911 was called and the employee helping them let the pharmacist know they had just gotten their vaccine. The immunizing pharmacist went to check on the patient. EMTs were already helping the patient and had taken his blood pressure which was normal the lightheadedness had stopped and both sitting and standing blood pressure was the same. He had an elevated heart rate per the patient but didn't know any of the numbers the EMTs had taken. His father was driving him. He was not experiencing any symptoms and the injection site had no swelling and was otherwise unremarkable.

25 2021-04-27 fall We had a patient today that passed out after his covid vaccine. It was his 2nd covid immunization. ... Read more
Close
We had a patient today that passed out after his covid vaccine. It was his 2nd covid immunization. He got his immunization at the pharmacy in the booth and then he sat down in one of the waiting chairs at the end of the cough and cold aisle. While he was sitting down, he began to feel unwell, he then got up off his chair and then was approaching the drop off window (he was going to let us know he didn't feel well) at that time he then passed out. He fell into the privacy screen of the imz booth. He did fall into the booth which did break some of his fall. He also knocked off one of the frames that we had on the wall, and then I think it fell on his nose. He did get a cut nose and he also bit his lip or mouth because his mouth was bleeding also. He reported that his nose did hurt, and he will have a prominent bruise on his nose. We did provide him with a couple of ice packs and a bottle of water. The patient (25 years old) and his mother both stated that he has passed out in the past when he has been around needles. He stated that he got to thinking about getting the shot and the needle going into his arm and that is when he started to feel unwell.
25 2021-04-27 gait inability On Wednesday April 14th I got my second vaccination shot. The following day I had a 103 F fever, bod... Read more
Close
On Wednesday April 14th I got my second vaccination shot. The following day I had a 103 F fever, body aches, chills, migraine, sore muscles, couldn't walk, excessive thirst. Those effects lasted all day and I felt better on Friday. Saturday night chest pain started along with sore arm getting worse. I took ibuprofen and melatonin to sleep. Woke up Sunday morning and pain came back and gradually got worse until I went into the ER around 9 am. They gave me Morphine to put the chest pain at bay. Then transferred me by ambulance to a different hospital with a cariology department. They treated me as if it was Myocarditis and also got an x-ray of my chest. The next morning I had an MRI and that is what confirmed it to be Myocarditis. I was then discharged with lots of medications to keep the inflammation down.

25-year-old Caucasian male with no significant past medical history, he was seen in the hospital on the 24th of March for right facial weakness, prescribed a week of steroid and antiviral, his symptoms started with an ear infection on the right side a month and a half ago, he did not have a rash in or around the ear but it was beet red, [he had the zoster vaccine as a child], 1 week later, he had drooping of the right side of the face, went to urgent care where he was given 3 days of amoxicillin, it did not help and he developed nausea, it was stopped, then he went to the hospital and was treated, there was no improvement, hence went to ENT where he was given a 12 day dose of tapering p.o. prednisone 60 mg and decreasing by 10 mg every 2 days to nothing and 14 days of repeat antiviral therapy, he finished them 3 days ago, right-sided facial weakness has not improved, there is no pain, when all this started, he had vertigo with spinning sensation all the time for about a week and a half with decreased balance, both have resolved, he had a brain MRI in the hospital that was unremarkable, his hearing is normal, denies any problems with speech, he thinks the right eye closes when he sleeps, he does not patch it or use artificial tears, no headache, no numbness or weakness reported, no facial pain, no prior history of similar problems, left side of the face is fine, 2 weeks prior to symptom onset, he had the first dose of the Pfizer Covid vaccine. 25 2021-05-04 dizziness Pt received vaccine and within minutes of receiving the vaccine, pt stated that he had dizziness and... Read more
Close
Pt received vaccine and within minutes of receiving the vaccine, pt stated that he had dizziness and felt light headed. Neuro assessment was performed by reporting nurse and neuro assessment WNL. Pt started hyper ventilating and pt was advised to slow down his breathing. Pt continued to complain of feeling dizzy and lightheaded. Pt had bilateral feet elevated on a chair and bilateral arms raised. Site was called to the patient and they assessed the patient. Pt was laid down on the floor and bilateral feet elevated. Pt had a 12 lead ECG performed showed 60 with a run of SVT with rate of 182. Pt had VS taken initally 80/40, 62, 24. continued treating patient, FSBS was 79. Pt was advised to go to the ER for further assessment and treatment. provided O2 2L via , 12 lead ECG monitoring, IV access to right AC, 20g secured with opsite, 0.9% NS bolus of 200ml. Pt was transported. Ship staff aware of incident and will f/u with patient status.

25 2021-05-05 fall 25yo male patient fainted about 5min after receiving the vaccine while sitting in an observation cha... Read more
Close
25yo male patient fainted about 5min after receiving the vaccine while sitting in an observation chair. He fell to the side off his chair and hit head on the concrete floor, with his body still on the chair. Patient had convulsion-like movements. It was unclear if it was seizure-type activity or if his body was struggling to sit up from the supine position laying on the chair. Patient was attended to immediately by pharmacist - he responded immediately to my talking to him and touching his shoulders. Patient was guided to an upright seated position, then helped to floor and asked to lie on floor with legs elevated. 911 was called and Seattle Fire Dept arrived about 5min later. Patient was fully aware of surroundings, his name, etc. Evaluated him and took multiple blood pressure readings with him laying on floor and eventually sitting up. His pressure was initially low but recovered to normal over 15-30 minutes. Ambulance was called but patient declined as his parents were on their way. Patient's blood pressure recovered to normal and he was able to sit and stand, was fully conversational throughout the episode. Patient left building of his own accord with his family to seek medical follow-up.

Close
The arm that I received the vaccine in (Right Arm) Has been falling asleep if I hold it still, in as little as 10 minutes. This hasn?t been too big of an issue while awake, But in my sleep last night I woke up around eight times with my arm completely dead limp and getting no blood circulation. I had to move it around with my left hand for a while to force blood circulation before I could move my right arm again. I would then do little blood circulating exercises with my right hand and arm until it felt normal again, Then I would go back to sleep. I was sleeping on the opposite side (on left arm or back) So there was nothing else that could?ve been cutting off circulation. This is not something that?s normal for me. I spoke to a nurse at the site that administered the dose, and she advised me to call back and get an appointment with a nurse if the problem continues in my sleep tonight.

9 hours after the shot I started to feel really groggy and sore with my left arm hurting. 12 hours in I started to feel like I had a fever so i checked it and it was 102 degree F, I was also unable to pick my left arm up due to the pain and my whole body hurt a lot. 13 hours in at about 10 pm that night I started full-body shaking violently and needed help from my parents into my room because I could not walk because my legs were wobbling so much. I felt lightheaded and the shaking continued for about 20 minutes. During this time I checked my temp again and it was 105 degrees F. Once the shaking stopped the fever and intense pain continued until 2 am when it dropped down to 102 degrees F and I was able to fall asleep. The next morning I woke at 8am with a temp of 100 degree F with the same all-over-body pain that lasted all day but the fever dropped until that night. That night it came back at 100 degrees F. This cycle lasted from when I got my shot on the 1st until 4th when the fever stopped. The pain has subsided around the 6th. But I am currently still having pain in my left shoulder where I got my shot today on the 8th.

Close
Vaccine administered to pt at 2:12pm on 5/11/21. Pt was recommended to wait in waiting area for 15 minutes post injection. After approximately 5 minutes, he stood up and walked near the counter reporting he was feeling dizzy. As the pharmacist was recommending him to sit down rather than stand and was attempting to assist him to his chair, he fainted. RPh and technician reached to hold him and help break his fall. The pt fell to the ground mainly falling on his buttocks and then to his back. After approx. 20-30 seconds, the pt awoke and sat up on his own. He then stated he was feeling better and drank some water. About 3-5 minutes later, he was able to get back to his chair where he sat coherent for another 30-40 minutes. After being assessed by paramedic/fire chief, it was recommended he go to the hospital to be further assessed. He left walking away with paramedics.

Client sitting post vaccine approx. 5 min. after, and looked to have a vagal vagus response. Fell side ways in chair- was unconscious for approx 10-15 sec. No injury. Came to Alert and oriented x 3 no memory of passing out. Did state he felt a flushing feeling and ears get muffled. 911 called by co worker. B/P stable @ 05:12 -96/42 HR 64 done by reporter. EMS arrived approx. 17:25- client awake and speaking. B/P by EMS- 120/80, HR 61, sats 99%. Client refused further treatment at hospital. Stayed another 1/2 hour and was picked up pt parents. Client walked out of site without further incident. Spoke to client next day stated he felt fine. Encouraged him to speak to PMD before next vaccine.

Pt stated that he wanted to check his blood pressure because he felt like it was high. Pt had no medical hx. Pt?s vitals were obtained. Pt stated that he felt much better and was comfortable walking to his car with his family.

Close
The patient was escorted to the waiting room post vaccine injection. He reported feeling light-headed. At 1220 while the NP was by his side, he became clammy, lost color, and became unresponsive with eyes rolled. He maintained his breathing and became conscious at 1225 with color returning and alert and oriented x 3. Pulse 65 BPM, O2 Sat 97-98% RA. He was escorted to the exam room table with the NP and PCT and placed in the supine position. He reports feeling light-headed and nauseous but alert and oriented x 3; BP 102/65, P 65 BPM, RR 16, O2 sat 97-98%. Notified at 1238. The patient was observed by the NP and remained with continuous pulse ox monitoring. At 1309, HOB raised to 30 degrees and patient given sips of water; BP 104/60, P 61 BPM, RR 16, O2 sat 97% RA. At 1323, HOB raised to 45 degrees. Patient c/o dizziness and nausea but tolerating sips of water; BP 110/75, P 63 BPM, RR 16, O2 sat 100% RA. At 1330, HOB raised to 90 degrees. Patient c/o dizziness and nausea, tolerating sips of water, BP 110/75, P 60 BPM, RR 16, O2 sat 98%. Patient escorted to waiting room chair at 1330 with NP and PCT. He c/o dizziness and nausea with position change, BP 110/75, P 60 BPM, RR 16, O2 sat 98% RA. He remains in the waiting room chair with PCT observation. At 1335, he begins with vomiting x 1 episode. He reports that he feels better and denies dizziness at this time. At 1353 he reports that he is feeling better. Denies dizziness or nausea; BP 104/60, P 65 BPM, RR 18, O2 sat 100% RA. He was discharged at 1410 with his boss from work. He is alert and oriented x 3, denies SOB, dizziness, lightheadedness, or N/V.

Close
Patient describes no immediate adverse event after vaccine receipt to suggest IgE reaction (e.g. oral/facial/throat/tongue edema, SOB, wheeze, CP, urticaria, pruritis, etc.) . He reports he felt ill the following day with weakness, cough, increased nasal drainage, decreased exercise tolerance resulting in SOB and elevated HR. He was seen in ER 29 APR (day 8) and diagnosis was URI vs. vaccine reaction. He states these symptoms have resolved. He reports 2 weeks ago (day 7) he was then in the field training and exposed to poison ivy. On day 14 he developed dermatitis to arms, abdomen and groin. He self treated with topical benadryl cream, which made symptoms much worse and produced a large plaque. He switched to calamine, and witch hazel. On day 17 he developed a targetoid erythematous dermatitis to his hands and arms. He was seen in ER and diagnosed with EM and contact dermatitis and treated with oral prednisone, and cetrizine and Bactroban for sites of secondary infection. He reports lesions to hands and arms are mostly resolved, and abdominal plaque is much improved. He is using cetrizine and pruritis is not significant. He had no oral lesions, oral pain, vesicles, vision changes.

I hope you stop misleading the public and communicate that myocarditis and severe inflammation IS 100% A SIDE EFFECT THAT IS CAUSED BY THE VACCINE RESPONSE. I know because I am experiencing it, and you've ruined the last 24 days of my life. Thank you.

Close
Sore arm; Felt light headed; left side of my face becoming numb; restricted breathing threw my nose; pain forming in the left side of my neck; left cheek on my face began to swell; top left part of my throat began to swell; tingling feeling on the left side of my face.; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer, the patient. A 25-year-old male patient received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE, Lot number: EP7534), via an unspecified route of administration in the left arm on 16Mar2021 at 03:15 PM as a single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. The patient's medical history included asthma. Concomitant medications included ZYRTEC D for unknown indication from an unspecified date. Prior to vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. Since the vaccination, the patient was not been tested for COVID-19. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. On 16Mar2021 at 03:30 PM the patient experienced pain in arm, light headed (waited the recommended 15 minutes and left), numbness in face, breathing difficulty, neck pain (immediately went back to the facility that administrated the shot, was put under observation), cheek swelling, throat swelling and tingling. Treatment received for the events included diphenhydramine and Tylenol. The clinical outcome of the events pain in arm, light headed, numbness in face, breathing difficulty, neck pain, cheek swelling, throat swelling and tingling was resolving. No follow-up attempts are possible. No further information is expected.

Close
chills occasionally; Fatigue; Has had more frequent headaches; While going to the bathroom, felt like the whole world was spinning; pain and aching in his groin; aches/ Has had a few more random aches and pains in the body; Fever; the joints in feet and knees are more sore than ever; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient) received via medical information team. A 25-year-old male patient received second dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, formulation: solution for injection, Lot Number: EN6201), via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Arm Left on 02May2021 09:30 as (age at vaccination 25) single for covid-19 immunisation. The patient medical history was reported as none. Concomitant medications were not reported. The patient's historical vaccine includes first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, formulation: solution for injection, Lot Number: EW0158) via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Arm Left on 11Apr2021 11:00 (age at vaccination 25) as single for COVID-19 immunisation. Patient was not received any other vaccine on same date of vaccination. No prior vaccinations within four weeks prior to the first administration date of the suspect vaccine. On 02May2021, the patient had fever, aches/ Has had a few more random aches and pains in the body, pain and aching in his groin, the joints in feet and knees are more sore than ever. On 03May2021, the patient While going to the bathroom, felt like the whole world was spinning. On 04May2021, the patient has had more frequent headaches. On an unspecified date, the patient had chills occasionally and fatigue. The caller stated that the fever started during the night. The caller received the second dose Pfizer Covid Vaccine at 09:30 on Sunday, 02May2021 and had a fever may be 15 hours after the caller would say. The caller stated this fever lasted 2 days, then clarifies it lasted a day and a half. The caller states he recovered completely. The caller states aches began right when the caller was going to bed, 12 hours after receiving second dose Pfizer Covid Vaccine. The caller had aches and fatigue. The caller stated he was super achy across entire body. The caller states this lasted the first two days after the Pfizer Covid Vaccine. Now the caller has achiness in goin area. The joints in feet and knees were more sore than ever, Now the caller has slight achiness in knee. The caller clarifies the aches felt better after three days. The achiness in groin is persisting. The joints in feet and knees were more sore than ever and were persisting. The aches across body everywhere went away. The caller stated he did not have chills, more fatigue and achy. Maybe the caller had chills occasionally, mostly not much of an issue. When asked when the callers pain began, the caller stated he doesn't know if he meant pain. The caller thought he meant aching and pain was the same thing. When using the word fatigue the patient was describing his issues still going on. The caller's localized fatigue with his feet and knees, nothing systemic. The caller stated Pain in groin began right when all the other aching in caller's body happened, so 12 hours after receiving the second dose Pfizer Covid Vaccine on 02May2021. The caller's body started aching and hasn't totally gone away since. The caller stated the pain in the groin is persisting. The caller stated the pain in the groin is better some days and worse some days. The joints in feet and knees were more sore than ever: The caller thought this has been ongoing since 12 hours after receiving the second dose Pfizer Covid Vaccine. For a week and a half there the caller didn't really use feet and knees very much. The caller started to run again. The caller stated this started probably 12 hours after receiving second dose Pfizer Covid Vaccine, but not entirely sure. The caller guessed he has had more frequent headaches and a few more random aches and pains in the body. Has had a few more random aches and pains in the body: The caller stated that the random aches and pains in the body were sporadic and come and go since receiving the second dose Pfizer Covid Vaccine. The caller doesn't think he was just noticing them, doesn't think it was just the caller hallucinating them. Has had more frequent headaches, the caller usually doesn't get headaches. The caller stated these began the second day after receiving the Pfizer Covid Vaccine on 04May2021. Has had a few more random aches and pains in the body: The caller stated that the aches and pains come and go and they began the same day the caller received the second dose Pfizer Covid Vaccine, 12 hours after on 02May2021. Has had more frequent headaches: The caller states the headaches come and go and it was hard to tell if they were ongoing, the caller thought but it was hard to tell. The caller states the headaches were not super frequent, more frequent than the caller had before. The caller does not think the headaches were lessening in frequency. Has had a few more random aches and pains in the body and the caller stated these were ongoing. The caller will have a pain in his back or somewhere the caller usually wouldn't feel pain. The caller stated the random aches and pains were persisting. After the second dose, the caller woke up in middle of night and had to go to bathroom. While going to the bathroom, the caller felt like suddenly the whole world was spinning. The caller tried to shake himself awake, shake himself out of it. For probably like two minutes, multiple minutes, the caller couldn't get out of this haze. The next thing the caller knew he was in his room bent over the garbage can. The caller did not throw up, but the caller felt like he was going to black out. If this had gotten worse, the caller would have gone to the hospital or done something. The caller stated it kind of went away after that. The caller stated this began on 03May2021, 18 hours after the caller received the second dose Pfizer Covid vaccine on 02May2021. The caller stated this went away. The episode lasted for about half an hour. The caller thought he recovered completely, but again isn't sure, still having issues and doesn't know. In Sep2020, the caller got an antibody test and it was negative. The caller doesn't think he had Covid, at least not until Oct2020 and was sure he did not have Covid from Oct2020 to Apr2021. The caller was pretty certain he has never had Covid, ever. The caller queried if there was anyone who has experienced something similar with the aching in their groin, The caller has read something about how women could experience menstrual issues, but stated he was not female. The outcome of the events fever was recovered on 04May2021; while going to the bathroom, felt like the whole world was spinning was recovered on 03May2021; the joints in feet and knees are more sore than ever, pain and aching in his groin, aches/Has had a few more random aches and pains in the body were not recovered; has had more frequent headaches, chills occasionally and fatigue was unknown.

Close
Patient received the 2nd COVID vaccine (Pfizer, lot # ER8736, use by 07/04/21) at 0950. The client told EMT, " am feeling a little light-headed and dizzy" at 1000. The client was immediately assisted to the anti-gravity chair and placed in a semi-fowler's position. The client appeared mildly diaphoretic. RN arrived on scene and assessed the client who was A & O x 4. The client was offered Benadryl and stated, " I think I will hold off on Benadryl and see how I feel in a few minutes." Vital signs were taken at 1003, BP- 132/84, HR-74, RR-14, oxygen saturation- 98%. The client was given juice and a granola bar. The client no longer appeared diaphoretic, denied feeling flushed, itchy, shortness of breath, difficulty breathing, angioedema, or chest pain. The client is currently taking Turmeric, denied any chronic medical conditions, or drug allergies. Vital signs taken at 1008, BP- 138/84, HR- 69, RR-14, oxygen saturation at 98%. The client stated, " I'm feeling better and the light-headedness is better." Vital signs taken at 1013, BP- 139/88, HR- 69, RR-14, oxygen saturation- 99%. The client was assisted to a Fowler's position by EMT. Vital signs taken at 1015, BP- 136/86, HR- 69, RR-14, oxygen saturation-98%. Patient stated " I'm just feeling tired", denied shortness of breath, difficulty swallowing, itching or swelling. Vital signs taken again at 1025 BP- 141/86, HR-66, RR-14, oxygen saturation 99%. Client stated, " The light-headedness and dizziness is gone, my mouth is just a little dry." The patient then drank water which relieved the mouth dryness. Last vitals taken at 1030 BP-139/82, HR-66, RR-14, oxygen saturation 99%. The client slowly stood up and denied any dizziness, headache, SOB, or chest pain. RN educated the client about follow-up precautions with his PCP, Emergency Room precautions, and educated the client about V-safe. The client had a steady and even gait when walking to his vehicle at 1034.

Client received his first Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine dose at 2:54pm. At 3:07pm, client raised his hand in the Vaccine Site Observation Area and was assisted by EMT on call. Client stated he felt "dizzy and lightheaded". EMT escorted client to a zero gravity chair and assessed his symptoms while a second EMT checked his vitals every 5 minutes. Vitals were within normal range. Client alert & oriented x4. Denied nausea or shortness of breath. Last intake at 12pm. Client stated he got his blood drawn at 1:30pm and had felt dizzy when he got his blood drawn as well. Client was given a bottle of water. At 3:14pm, client stated the dizziness had resolved. At 3:21pm, client stated he felt "completely normal" and walked with steady gait out of facility. Client stated he would be driven home by his sister. Information on V-Safe given.
25 2021-06-23 dizziness Over a month after receiving my second dose of Pfizer, I had an episode of lightheadedness, dizzines... Read more
Close
Over a month after receiving my second dose of Pfizer, I had an episode of lightheadedness, dizziness, shakiness, and fatigue. I attributed it to dehydration and laid down and ate a snack, I began to feel better after 1-2 hours. A week later I had another lightheadedness incident that sent me back to bed (this one being slightly worse). I experience slight chest pain in my upper right chest muscle. It took me a day to recover from this spell. I constantly felt weak and as if I was about to faint. I went to the doctor two days later and got blood work done and measured my blood pressure. Everything came back normal. On Saturday June 19th, I had another near-fainting experience in a public setting. My hearing changed, I couldn't think straight, I was very shaky and weak, and I tried to drink a lot of water. Nothing helped so I went home and once I got in bed I was aggressively shaking. Since then I have been bed-ridden for the week, and unable to do normal activities such as go for walks, exercise, or go to work. I am going to visit a cardiologist tomorrow.

Client received Pfizer vaccine at 1502 without any complications/client anxiety. Client was lead to lobby for CDC recommended 15 minutes of observation. At 1508, the client fell sideways in his chair but caught himself. Client reported having hazy vision for a second. Client's skin was pale and highly diaphoretic. Client then passed out for 20 seconds. Clinic RN grabbed under his armpits to hold him in chair to prevent him from falling over. Once client regained consciousness, (1510: BP 100/85, HR 60) Client was moved to the vaccination room to lie down on the floor with his feet elevated above his heart with a chair. BP taken at 1512, 110/80. Client given 4 cups cold water to drink and 3 fun sized candy bars to eat. At 1520 BP was 110/70, HR 70. Client monitored and assisted to chair. Ten minutes in chair he was allowed to try standing. Client was able to ambulate on own without assistance. Client was monitored for 45 minutes post vaccination, no obvious signs of distress, pruritus, apnea, hives/rashes, heart palpitations. Instructed to place family member on speaker phone while driving home/ leaving clinic.

I asked the patient how his first dose went-he stated it was fine. I counseled that his arm may be sore and he may have side effects such as fatigue, headache, chills after his second dose. I then administered the vaccine in the left deltoid and counseled him to have a seat in the waiting area for 15 minutes. His girlfriend came up to the window about 15 minutes later and said he wasn't feeling well. He was reporting pounding headache and fatigue as well as dizziness. I got him some water and suggested that he lie down until he felt better. It sounded like a typical syncope reaction. After lying down and drinking water for 15-20 minutes he still wasn't feeling better. He requested that we call paramedics, who arrive around 3:15pm and took over.

Immediate reaction of arms tingling; Nausea; Vomiting; Headache; Fever; Fatigue; Shortness of breath; Head pressure; Double vision; Cannot concentrate for any length of time; Dizziness; Unsteadiness; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer or other non hcp. This consumer (patient) reported for himself that a 25-years-old male patient received bnt162b2 (BNT162B2, Formulation: Solution for injection, Batch/Lot number: EW0171), dose 1 via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Arm Right on 02May2021 12:00 (Age at vaccination: 25) as DOSE 1, SINGLE for covid-19 immunisation. Medical history included seasonal allergy. The patient's concomitant medications were not reported. The patient previously took erythromycin and sulfa. On 02May2021 12:00, the patient experienced Immediate reaction of arms tingling; Nausea; Vomiting; Headache; Fever; Fatigue; Shortness of breath; Head pressure; Double vision; Cannot concentrate for any length of time; Dizziness and Unsteadiness . Patient was received steroids as treatment for events. No hospitalization prolonged. The patient underwent lab tests and procedures which included blood test: normal on, electrocardiogram: normal on, magnetic resonance imaging: normal on, sars-cov-2 test: negative on 06May2021, sars-cov-2 test: negative on 19May2021. It was reported that patient had basic vaccine symptoms the first week including headache, nausea, fever. After a week, COVID fog/fatigue symptoms began. It is currently 6 weeks later and patient had fatigue, shortness of breath, head pressure, double vision, cannot concentrate for any length of time and dizziness/unsteadiness. I have not been able to go to work since the vaccine and have people helping take care of me. I cannot take a shower without being short of breath. I have been put on 2 different rounds of steroids - the 2nd more aggressive, which did not make a difference. I have been to my general doctor several times, an allergist and a neurologist. I had no previous health problems. Symptoms had not improved in the past 3-4 weeks. Patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. Prior to vaccination, patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. Since the vaccination, patient has been not tested for COVID-19. The clinical outcome of all events were not recovered. Follow-up attempts are needed. Further information is requested.
25 2021-06-26 dizziness Symptoms include: chest pain, lightheadedness, headaches, blurry vision, difficulty focusing vision.... Read more
Close
Symptoms include: chest pain, lightheadedness, headaches, blurry vision, difficulty focusing vision. The only treatment I've received is I was prescribed Hydroxyzine as a sleep aid. Outcome: Still hindered by symptoms 2 months after both vaccine shots
25 2021-06-29 fall, dizziness The patient was given the Pfizer vaccine at 10:22 am. There were no complications with administratio... Read more
Close
The patient was given the Pfizer vaccine at 10:22 am. There were no complications with administration. The patient was then told to sit in the waiting area for 20 minutes. After about 1 minute he fell out of his chair in the waiting area and passed out. He was out for about 2 minutes until he came to. The pharmacist on duty tended to him and put a frozen water bottle on his neck. He was helped into his chair where he sat for about 5 minutes until he started to feel light headed again. At this point he went back to laying on the floor for about 15 minutes. Once he was feeling well enough again, he moved back up into the chair. After a total of 45 minutes the patient called a ride and left to return home.
25 2021-07-01 dizziness Patient received first dose of Pfizer vaccine in left arm at 1128 06/29/2021. Patient stated he was ... Read more
Close
Patient received first dose of Pfizer vaccine in left arm at 1128 06/29/2021. Patient stated he was very nervous to get his vaccine when he arrived. Patient was sitting in observation when he stood up to alert someone he was dizzy. Patient started to lose consciousness while a nurse was able to catch him and lower him to the ground safely. The patient's legs were elevated and patient regained consciousness. Blood pressure taken at 1130 and was 105/55 with a HR between 46/52 BPM. The second BP was taken after the patient sat up. At that time, he was 124/64. The patient verbalized that he hadn't eaten anything that day, so staff got him apple juice and crackers which he started to eat/drink immediately. The third blood pressure was 146/68. At this time, the patient verbalized he felt safe to sit in a chair. All blood pressures taken on left arm. Patient denies any dizziness at this time. Additional vitals BP 128/81, HR 57 -- > 126/77, 59 prior to D/C. Pt stable and released from the vaccination site.
25 2021-07-05 dizziness Patient's hands felt tingly, was very lightheaded, broke out in cold sweat. After about an hour of l... Read more
Close
Patient's hands felt tingly, was very lightheaded, broke out in cold sweat. After about an hour of lying down, patient felt fine and was able to walk on his own.
25 2021-07-06 dizziness Patient is a 25 y/o male whom after being vaccinated and being informed about 15 min. observation p... Read more
Close
Patient is a 25 y/o male whom after being vaccinated and being informed about 15 min. observation period, lost consciousness. Client's head was supported until he regained consciousness and was helped into a wheelchair and taken to the private recovery area where EMS took his vitals. BP 70/40, pulse 58, Glucose 88, Resp. 16, normal mentation. Patient diaphoretic, complaining of nausea and dizziness. Client was then transported by EMS staff from recovery area @ 12:33pm and taken to Coral Springs Hospital Emergency Room.
25 2021-07-07 dizziness Incoming TC from patient, reporting possible COVID-19 side effects / adverse reaction: Patient call... Read more
Close
Incoming TC from patient, reporting possible COVID-19 side effects / adverse reaction: Patient called in reporting difficulty breathing, rapid heartbeat, chest tightness, dizziness when walking ""had to hold onto my dad's shoulder while walking so I don't faint, I feel anxious like something is going to happen."" Reports received 2nd dose Pfizer 5/07 felt "okay" afterwards. Starting 1 week ago 5/18 started to rapid heartbeat, anxious, even at rest. States HR is 78 O2 sat 98%. Was seen at a clinic 1 week ago, EKG performed WNL. Advised to call 911, or seek emergency care. Pt stated he will have his dad drive him toER.
25 2021-07-11 fall Patient fainted and fell on the ground about 10 minutes after the vaccine was administered. We calle... Read more
Close
Patient fainted and fell on the ground about 10 minutes after the vaccine was administered. We called the ambulance and they came 10 minutes later and checked his vitals. Patient did not leave on the ambulance.
